loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies: notebooks, pens, protectors, cardboard folders, etc.

loans.name: Bakoliniaina Angelina

texts.fr:
Angelina est une jeune femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille dans une entreprise médiatique. Le couple est parents de deux petits enfants de 1 et 4 ans, le premier est scolarisé. 
Auparavant, elle travaillait en tant que vendeuse dans une boutique, mais il y a maintenant quelques mois, ou plus précisément depuis le mois de février de cette année, elle dirige son propre commerce. Elle démarrait avec ses propres efforts et l'appui de CEFOR. La raison de cette décision était ses enfants et surtout le dernier, problème de "baby-sitter". Le couple a pris ensemble l'initiative de changer l'activité de madame pour qu'elle puisse à la fois s'occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking and resourceful young woman of 22. She is married and her husband works in a media company. They have two small children of one and four years old. The first child goes to school.
In the past, Angelina used to work as a saleswoman in a shop, but a few months ago, or more precisely since the month of February of this year, she has been running her own business. She started the business by herself and with support from CEFOR. The reason for her change of orientation was the management of her children, especially the second child. She had babysitter problems, so the couple initiated a change of business for the mother together so that she can also take care of her children

loans.use: to buy general  merchandise: cartons of soap, candles, diapers, sweets, biscuits,...

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old, married man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago Mohammad started his own business.  He manages an Internet cafe in his city providing many services like Internet, printing and games. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new computers  for his business. This will increase the capacity of cafe sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new computers  for his business.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid, 29 years old, lives in the Gaza strip with his small family. One year ago he started selling birds, a good business that still needs a lot of improvement.

Khalid has applied for this loan to buy different kinds of birds as per customer requests, as well as cages and food for them. This will increase his income, helping him to improve financial conditions for his family.

Khalid is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds as per customer requests.

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Wendy  continua trabajando para  una empresa privada, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua también con su negocio de internet, la socia agradece el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de sus maquinas.
Los socios agradecen el apoyo otorgado y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Wendy is a member of the “Juntos para el progreso” communal bank located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.
Wendy is still working for a private business. She is a responsible, hardworking person, and she is also still working with her internet business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her established payments. She has had her business for a long time; among other things it has brought her personal satisfaction, as it is how she gets her family ahead. She is asking for this loan to do computer maintenance. 

The members are grateful for the support granted and also promise to make their payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to do computer maintenance

loans.name: Mamisoa

texts.fr:
34 ans, Mamisoa est mariée et son époux est revendeur des téléphones portables et accessoires. Elle est mère d'un enfant de 13 ans, scolarisé dans une école privée. 
Elle exerce une activité de vente en détail de différents articles comme des cartables, des sandales, des chaussures, des vêtements prêt à porter. Le couple se soutienne mutuellement pour le bien de la famille. L'objectif est de construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mamisoa is thirty-four years old and married. Her husband retails cell phones and accessories. She is the mother of a thirteen-year-old child who goes to a private school.

She manages a retail business for a variety of articles including school bags, sandals, shoes, and ready-to-wear clothing.

The spouses help one another for the well-being of their family. Her objective is to one day build her own house.

loans.use: to buy school bags, sandals, and clothes.

loans.name: Rondro Nadia

texts.fr:
46 ans, Nadia est une femme divorcée depuis des années. Donc elle élève seule ses trois enfants. Ces derniers sont âgés de 5, 14 et 16 ans et il sont tous scolarisés.
Elle exerce deux activités sources de revenu pour gagner sa vie: elle dirige une petite gargote il y a maintenant 8 ans et elle venait d'ouvrir un poissonnerie il y a 6 mois. Elle voudrait développer et améliorer ces deux activités mais celle qui la presse en ce moment est la poissonnerie. C'est récent et a encore besoin d'investissement. Le prêt va être utilisé pour acheter un congélateur
texts.en:
Nadia is a forty-six year-old woman. She has been divorced for many years. Therefore, she raises her three children alone. They are five, fourteen, and sixteen years old. They all go to school.

She makes a living from two revenue-generating businesses: she manages a small food stall, opened eight years ago, and just opened a fish store six months ago. She would like to grow and improve both businesses, but the one requiring her attention right now is the fish store. It is new and still needs investments.

The loan will be used to purchase a freezer.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Veronique Vaosolo

texts.fr:
Véronique est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 38 ans. Elle est mariée, son mari est agent de sécurité. Les deux époux sont parents de cinq enfants, âgés entre 5 à 18 ans. L'ainée et la seconde sont déjà mariées en ce moment tandis que les trois derniers sont encore à leurs charges et scolarisés.
Pour gagner sa vie, Véronique exerce une activité de vente des fruits et des volailles il y a maintenant 7 ans. auparavant, elle lavait les linges (washerwoman). A cause d'un problème de santé qu'elle subissait, il lui est interdit par le médecin de continuer cette activité et elle a pris l'initiative de pratiquer un petit commerce.
Elle projette de construire une petite maison car elle en a marre de toujours louer et de ce fait elle s'efforce de faire des épargnes.
texts.en:
Veronique is a courageous and hardworking woman of 38. She is married and her husband works as a security agent. They have five children aged between five and 18 years old. The first and second are already married, whereas the three younger children attend school and are dependent on them.
To earn a living, Veronique has been selling fruit and fowl for seven years now. Previously she was a washerwoman. Due to a health issue, her doctor forbade her to continue that activity, and she took the initiative of starting up a small business.
She plans to build a little house because she is fed up with always renting, so she is doing her best to save money.

loans.use: to buy bananas and fowl.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Mohammad works in the public sector and he also has a workshop for plaster work and decoration in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the bad conditions in Gaza directly affect any small business. Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy material and plaster templates for his workshop. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand the workshop.

loans.use: to buy material and plaster templates for his workshop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy an electrical generator to use when electricity is cut off to the family house. Palestinians are dependent on electricity in all walks of life, and the lack of electricity creates a big problem so a generator has become the main alternative in every home.

loans.use: to buy an electrical generator to use when the electricity is cut off to the family house.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a married mother of five children who has been working for four years selling Brazilian gold from her house so that she can help her husband, who is employed with a limited monthly salary, in covering their family's living needs.

Roula is a hardworking woman and a caring mother. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees and requested stationery.

She hopes to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees and requested stationery.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 41-year-old married mother of four. Ten years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house, and baking "Markook" bread  to help her husband in covering the increasing needs of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well-known among her region for her tasty and delicious "Mouneh" and bread.
Huda is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a kneader which will facilitate her business and serve her customers better. 
Huda hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a kneader which will facilitate her bakery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's shoes for selling

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan applauds the Kiva lenders for their generosity. Using the previous loan of ugx3000,000 that helped her to mulch her banana plantation and this helped to restore the moisture and sustain the growth since it has been a very dry season lately.

She now needs another loan that she will use to hire labour so that she can expand her garden and plant more bananas. She is assured of market when the production begins.
She is a hard working and focused young woman who believes that with hard work all things are possible.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and mulch and to hire labor.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a 49-year-old married woman with one child attending school in Hoima, Uganda. Since 2011 she has been milling maize, millet and cassava, an enterprise she ventured into after realizing a need to raise more income for her family.

Teopista is seeking this loan to buy another machine for milling rice to increase her income. Despite competition, she hopes to expand and grow her business as well as pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy another machine for milling rice.

loans.name: Roger

texts.fr:
40 ans, Roger est marié et les deux époux exercent ensemble l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille. Il s'agit de la vente des bidons en gros. L'activité  lui est pratiquée il y a maintenant déjà 15 ans. L'activité ne cesse pas de se développer depuis et il voudrait ajouter des barriques avec le prêt. Il envisage ainsi d'acheter une charrette plus tard pour éviter de louer quand il effectue les livraisons.
Le couple n'a qu'un enfant, il a 14 ans et il est en classe de 4ème actuellement. L'objectif du couple est la réussite de leur enfant et il projette ainsi d'acheter un terrain et de construire une maison .
texts.en:
Roger is 40. He is married, and he works with his wife to make an income to provide for the family. They sell cans wholesale. They have been running this business for 15 years now. Their business develops constantly and Roger would like to add some barrels with this loan. He plans to buy a wagon at a later date to avoid paying to rent one when he does his deliveries.
This couple has only one child. He is 14 and is in 4th year at present. Their objective is to see their son succeed, and they plan to buy a plot of land and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy cans and barrels (kegs)

loans.name: Fahmeeda's Group

texts.en:
Fahmeeda is a 38-years-old married woman. She has been making embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact her husband earns very low income.

To cherish her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all raw materials for making embroidery. She completes her tasks along with her daughters over wooden frames. She wants to sell embroidery directly in the market, so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her arts and wants to buy raw material her own so that she can sell her hand made embroidery.

Therefore, Fahmeeda has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can embroider more dresses to sell and will generate maximum income.

She is a mother of three sons and a daughter. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials so she can directly sell her handicrafts in the market.

loans.name: Zead

texts.en:
Zead is a 42-year-old married man from Gaza City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Zead took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy an electrical generator to use when the electricity is cut off to the family house. Palestinians are dependent on electricity in all walks of life, and the lack of electricity creates a big problem so a generator has become the main alternative in every home.

loans.use: buy an electrical generator to use when the electricity is cut off to the family house.

loans.name: Oushak El Zahraa Group

texts.en:
Fadia is the featured borrower for Oushak El Zahraa Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Fadia is a 39-year-old married mother of three children. Nine years ago, she started preparing and selling "mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is well known in her region. Fadia is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Fadia is the lady in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Maya is the first lady on the right, and Afifa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Señor De Ecce Homo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Angelica tiene 64 años de edad es viuda y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez se dedica a su negocio de ferretería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  a cada uno de ellos, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicito el crédito para la compra pinturas entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía, compra y venta de llaveros, trabajadores independientes.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO communal bank located in the department of Cusco. Angelica is 64 years old, is a widow, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities, making a living by selling food. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She also makes a living with a hardware business. She has had her businesses for quite a while, and they are going very well thanks to the effort she puts into them each day; this is how she gets her family ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy paints, among other items.

The members in general feel grateful for the loan granted and they promise to make their established payments. The other members make a living by selling crafts, buying and selling key chains, and as independent workers. The members in the attached photos asked permission to arrive at the meeting late for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy paints, among other items.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 41-year-old single lady from Rafah city, Gaza Strip. She lives with her family in a small, old house, and she is the sole support for her family.

Suzan has a greenhouse for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the city, a business that provides her with a good income; however, the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. This loan from Palestine for Credit & Development will help her to buy some seedlings and pesticides for her greenhouse for this season.

Suzan hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales and customers, eventually enabling her to save enough to cover all family expenses.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old, single young man from Nablus city. His father works in the building sector, where he earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Mohammad is a student in the university, where he studies business administration. He wants to take the B.A. degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is industrious and responsible woman. She is married and blessed with two grown up children. Her husband works as a miner and farmer within her village. Anita sells variety vegetables and gasoline to sustain her family needs.mShe's been doing this kind of business for three years.

Anita would like to borrow additional capital of PHP5,000 to buy variety vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, okra, green pepper, bitter gourd and squash to sell. She knows that she could be able to generate better income through her financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy variety vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, okra,green pepper, bitter gourd and squash to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 53 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Herminia works very hard to provide for them.

Herminia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Herminia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Harriet ..

texts.en:
Harriet is 39 years, married with seven children. She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. Five of her children attend school and she also takes care of 2 dependants in the family who belong to her late brother. She deals in buying and selling cocoa as her major source of income. Initially she was a cocoa farmer growing and selling to dealers, she eventually started trading in cocoa herself 20 years ago after realizing that the business is very lucrative.

She works 12 hours a day to raise income in spite of the challenges like poor road network to transport to nearby markets and bad weather which affect her sales and profitability. She would like to educate her children to university and hopes to become a prominent cocoa trader in the area. Harriet is in need of a loan of Uganda to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is a widowed woman who lives in Tbaung Khmum province, she is 46 years old. Growing cassava is the primary source of her family’s income. She has been growing rice to earn supplement income. These businesses have been with her for 20 years. Her crop did not grow well, she couldn’t get high yields and this is the main challenge for her business. Her daily income saved her about 5USD per day to support her living.

For Pov, this is the first time for her to get a loan. She is leading a group of two and she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer and pesticide for supporting her farm to produce good yields. She hopes to sell it in good price so that she can afford to buy household supplies to support her family condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for supporting her farm to produce good yields so that she can sell it in good price and can afford to buy household supplies to support her family.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat, 37, the farmer is living in a wooden house in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and a father of three children, two of whom are in school. Nowadays, he has been growing cassava to support his living condition for 13 years. He can earn more income via growing rice.

This is his fourth loan with VisionFund and he repaid his past loans completely. The past loans, he can afford to buy consumption to support his family’s living much better. In a group of two, he is the leader. As the group leader, he will manage his portion of loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer to increase the crop. He hopes this fourth loan will help him to earn more income to improve his living standard and support on his children’s studying as well.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to increase the crop so that she can earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.name: Sambok

texts.en:
Sambok is a single son of a family, who is from the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Electrical Engineering and is in his fourth year. Due to the fact that he is lacking finance to pay his fourth-year university fees, he would like to request a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to go through the fourth year at the university successfully. In the future, he wants to find a good job with a decent salary to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year university fees in Electrical Engineering.

loans.name: Mwamsho Group

texts.en:
Victoria is in her mid 40's and is married with four children. Two of them are grown up and two of them are still in school. She has been selling shoes for thirteen years now. She works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Victoria's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on improving and increasing the shoes stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, build her own house, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the shoes stock. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Victoria will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shoe stock.

loans.name: Bahtigul

texts.en: Bahtigul is a goodnatured woman with a kind heart. She was born in 1963. Bahtigul is the married parent of two children. Her children are not adults. Bahtigul is the main feed keeper of her children as her husband has a little salary. Bahtigul has been busy with feeding more than 20 years. She grows crops and potatoes. Little by little with the passing of the time she has developed her farming business. Bahtigul is going to make a new sowing of crops and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new planting season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new planting season.

loans.name: Deb's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Deb is 48 years old and a married mother of two schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via growing cassava for 25 years. Moreover, she can get additional income via growing rice. Unfortunately, her hard-working at farming business has been ruined by insect pests.

This is Deb’s third loan with VisionFund. As the group leader of two members, she will use her loan portion in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farming. She hopes this new loan will help her to get more yields so that she can sell it in good price to improve her lifestyle and support on her children’s studying on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farming so that she can sell it in good price to improve her lifestyle.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
Married with three dependent daughters, Kimly is 28 years old and a vendor living in Kampong Cham province. She sells grocery items to support family and she has been doing this for six years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her business. 
This is the first time for her with VisionFund and she, the group leader of three members, will use her loan to buy variety of items to fill her grocery store. She hopes that she can make great sale to improve the living condition and support her daughters’ studying.

loans.use: to buy variety of items to fill her grocery store to support her daughters’ studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat  and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat  and cooking fat

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr:
35 ans, Charles est un brave père de famille très responsable, Il est marié et le couple exerce ensemble l'activité objet de demande de crédit. Il s'agit de fabrication et vente de caca-pigeon et chips. L'exploitation de cette activité débutait en l'an 2000, avant même qu'il se marie. Donc, il possède tant d'année d'expérience dans ce domaine de métier. L'activité ne cesse pas de se développer, la preuve en est qu'il arrivait à construire une maison avec les épargnes qu'il a pu effectuer par le biais de l'activité.
Il est père de deux enfants de 7 et 11 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés. L'objectif est de pouvoir offrir à  sa famille une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Charles is 35. He is a good, highly responsible father. He is married, and he works with his wife in the business for which they request a loan. Their business is the sale of ‘pigeon droppings', a traditional Malagasy recipe made with flour, yeast, oil and eggs, and chips.
He started running this business in 2000, even before he got married. So, he has many years experience in this business and the activity progresses constantly. For proof, he has been able to build a house with the savings that he has made with this business.
He has two children of seven and 11 years old. They both attend school. His aim is to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, potatoes, peanuts.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is 38 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and this time she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Riffat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color and lotion for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Bukurie

texts.en:
Bukurie is a 30-year-old married mother of two, 10 and 7 and is seen with the kids in the photo. She has been living with her in-laws and the family in a town, renting an apartment. Prior, they were living in a village that was about two hours driving to get to the nearest town. "Life was so different there; we could breath fresh air and eat all organic and be physically fit, yet we had no access to medical care. And when my father-in-law became ill and needed consistent care, we were not able to get it, should we continued staying in the same place. Thus, we considered moving to the town," said Bukurie who has found an employment at a nearby fish factory, doing work for a monthly pay of approximately $160 in addition to the retirement pensions of her in-laws in the amount of $240 both.

The loan of 180,000 Albanian Lek will help Bukurie pay for a scheduled surgery of her father-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for a major operation of her father-in-law

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 30-year-old married mother of one child. Two years ago, she started selling shoes to help her husband in covering the increasing needs of their family. She is now well-known among her region and has her loyal customers. 
Zainab is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to transport products easily. 
Zainab hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Every week, Paz, 51 years old, joins a group of people that studies the word of God. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to go on living with hope and joy. Despite the fact that her family is not as fortunate as other families, with her husband Renato, who is a gardener, they persevere and work hard for their children's lives.

As of today, she is operating a small store of variety products along the road. Through this small stand, they are able to give the family enough for basic needs. She wants to improve this so she could also develop her sales and she is asking for help from you.

She humbly wants to avail herself of financial support amounting to PHP 25,000 to be used to buy more products to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this.

This is now your chance to help in just a little way.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
The loan that was previously given to Evelyne helped her to buy drugs to sell. She is a 37-year old married woman with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a medical clinic as her main source of income. Aside from that business, she also carries out farming in order to earn additional income. As a loving mother, she started this business to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

Her greatest inspiration was to help her community access medical services nearby since government hospitals are quite a distance and moving there using bad roads would escalate the patients illnesses. High cost of rent and stringent government restrictions on private clinics hinder her , but has hopes of owning a big hospital. Evelyne intends to use the loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more human drugs to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati  is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats for slaughtering and selling.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Saran is a young mother who has a young child and she is 25-year-old. She has been growing cassava to support her family’s living for 10 years. To get additional income, she has been growing rice. The insects affected her cassava so she can’t earn good income.

This is the second loan of her to take a new loan with VisionFund and she paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan, it helped her to improve her lifestyle than before. As the group leader of two, she is going to manage her prompt of loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop. She hopes this year she can earn more income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop so she can earn more income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Se is 47 years old and a father of three children, one of whom is in school. He has being grown rice and worked at garment factory to support his family’s living for 29 years. The crop has been threatened by insect pests and drought, so he couldn’t get high yields. Beside this, the lacking of capital to support on his business, he decides to take a loan with VisionFund. He will use his entire loan to buy fertilizer to improve on his rice farmland in order to increase the crop. He hopes to earn more income to improve his standard of living than before and he can support on his child’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his rice farmland in order to increase the crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Violita

texts.en: Violita is a married woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is 47 years old and a mother of seven children, two adults and five school age children. Her husband is a farmer while Violita sells vegetables in the market. They work hard together to provide the needs of their children and give them better education. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables such as cucumber, bitter gourd, beans, and pumpkins to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business to give good life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as cucumber, bitter gourd, beans, and pumpkins

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 27  years old. He is married with one children. He has had a motorcycle business for two years. He will be using the loan to complete payment of another motor cycle and hopes this will help him live in a better house. His hopes and dreams for the future are to own cars for transport business.

loans.use: to  complete payment of another motor cycle to help him live in a better house

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana's businesses are doing well and this is his second borrowing to finance his business. He will use the money to service his motorcycle, add stock of milk,sugar, wheat and maize flour, rice to uplift his food stall which is currently doing well and the loan will also be used to educate his children.

He hopes to have a good financially stable life in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, cooking fat, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 26 years old. He is not married with no children. He has had a motorcycle business for two years. He will be using the loan to complete payment of another motor cycle and hopes this will help him live in a better house. His hopes and dreams for the future are own cars for transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motor cycle.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 36 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children are enrolled in school.

Amelita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Amelita has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jetridah

texts.en: Jetridah is a mother of two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She wants to see all her children go to school and this makes her work hard at her fresh food stall for eight hours a day. She has realized that the business is improving her family's standard of living, and she dreams of expanding it and selling to big markets, though unpredictable weather changes and transport costs limit her plans.  She used the first loan to buy tomatoes to sell and is now requesting for another loan to buy more fresh foods like onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Samoeun's Group

texts.en: Samoeun is 41 years old living in a bed-room house located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district and she has two children, one of whom is too young. To make a living, she has grown cassava for 23 years. She can earn more income via growing rice. Her cassava has grown not well and it is the main challenge for her farm. This is her first time with VisionFund and as a group leader of two. She will get her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity crop for her family. She hopes this year the crop yields higher than before so that she can sell it in higher price which she can save sufficient capital to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity crop for her family

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is the age of 51 year old; she is the mother of seven children. Her son runs a garments store; this shop is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he devotes all his all efforts and time to the garment shop.

His shop is situated under the clothing market and there is a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing for his shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the winter season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy clothing related to the winter season. If he cannot replace the winter season's clothing with summer season's clothing, it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and his monthly income.

Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can be empowered to buy winter season's garments.
She hopes that her son will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and could grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy winter season's garments for her son's garments store.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine, 49, has been involved in farming for many years. Specifically, Armine keeps cattle and cultivates peaches and apples
.
Armine and her husband are teachers with higher educations, working at the local village school. Their time after work is totally devoted to the development of the farm.

Armine has applied for this loan to assist with the farming costs. She needs to increase her cattle by two cows, and also to purchase forage to feed the animals.

Armine says, that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family's standard of living little by little, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and for forage to feed the livestock so as to earn more income for the family's living expenses.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima lives in Trinidad, Bohol. In this place, farming thrives due to vast lands being cultivated by the residents. Trinidad is also the place for gold mining. Felicisima is engaged in both farming rice and buying raw gold from miners. The gold will then be sold to be reprocessed and refined in the next town. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hope to find sustainability in her business so she can pay for the school feed of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a young man who has a barber shop, which has been opened for the past two years. He has now a good experience and he is well known in his city, Khan younis. He loves his job and always thinks how to improve it.

Tahreer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Tahreer appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 46-year-old widowed mother of one child, who has been running her clothes selling business for a year to make sure she can support her only child after her husband passed away.
Zeinab is working hard to be the caring mother and the hard working parent. She is putting so much effort to develop her newly established business.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase special Autumn and winter clothes new released collection.
Since her current acquired business income is barely covering her small family's living, she needs education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase special autumn and winter clothes new released collection.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, mattresses and other plastic containers. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers and mattresses. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to take care of her family using the proceeds from her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic containers and mattresses.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. Her business goal is to have more butcheries within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, eggs, charcoal, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, eggs, charcoal, and other items. His business goal is to expand business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards and educate his child. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, eggs, charcoal, and other items.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is married with 2 children. One of her children is married. She started producing wedding candies to earn additional income and then improved her sewing skills by attending a course. In the last term, she used her second loan to buy a sewing machine and started taking orders. She earned more income through sewing and will use her third loan to buy an overlocker which will help her to improve her product quality and variety. She dreams to improve her business more and to start a shop.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nigar hanım evli, bir tanesi evli iki çocuk annesi. Ek gelir elde etmek için nikah şekeri işine başlayan Nigar Hanım daha sonra az bildiği dikiş dikme işini kursa giderek ilerletti. Bir önceki dönem de ikinci kredi ile dikiş makinesi alarak evde dışarıya dikiş dikmeye başladı. Dikiş dikme işinden daha çok gelir elde etti. Üçüncü kredisi ile overlok makinesi alan Nigar hanım diktiği kıyafetlerin kenarlarını elde değil makinede baskı yaparak tamamlayacak. Hayali işini daha da ilerleterek dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is married, and lives in Kasese-Uganda. He operates a retail shop and a tea room as well.

He is a very responsible man, and his family never lacks anything. His greatest desire is own a bigger mini supermarket and he is steadily moving toward it. At the moment, he lacks enough stock in his shop, which he would like to remedy. However, he is limited by price fluctuations and high license fees.

He intends to use the loan to buy packed juice and school bags, among other things, to sell. This would help to increase the number of customers, and thus, increase his income.

loans.use: to buy packed juice and school bags, among other things, to sell.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is musician by profession, working in local restaurants during weddings, birthdays and other special events. Fifteen years ago he was able to create his own band of musicians and over those years he has been participating in different concerts with his musician friends.

Stepan has requested this loan to purchase musical instruments (electronic piano, etc.) to increase his musical variety and activities. Stepan is a father of three children; his elder daughter is a student and the other two children attend school. Income that Stepan earns is vital for supporting his family. Stepan hopes to receive the loan and so he can invest in his business.

Stepan plans to develop his musical band so he will be popular and participate in large ceremonies as well.

loans.use: to pay for musical instruments (electronic piano, etc.) to increase his activities as a musician and provide better living conditions for his three children and wife.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 35-years-old married woman from Gaza city. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

Samia is a student in the university where she studies Business Administration. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family in part of their expenses.

Samia took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Samia will be able to do her home works and reports easily. Samia appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her university study in Business Administration

loans.name: Elsieta

texts.en:
Elsieta is a 41-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. Farming rice has been her livelihood for nineteen years now. From this, she support the needs of her six children. Her eldest is 20 and her youngest is eight.

Elsieta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor. Through this, they will be able to improve their farming business as well as their harvest. Elsieta hopes of making their business sustainable so her children can have a better future through their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for  labor

loans.name: Edgardo Rodolfo

texts.es: Edgar de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Edgar, 40 years old, lives in his own home with his son. He has worked selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years. His business is located in the municipal market and with the earnings he obtains he is able to cover some of the expenses of his home. He is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables to be able to continue with his sales and in that way have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and it urgently needs to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools.
Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.
Naseem hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to repair a lathe and buy cutting tools for her husband's turner work. .

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her mid 30's, is married with two children, who are still in school. She has been selling electronic money transfers for five years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her electronic money transfer services and to start selling soft drinks and fabrics, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.

She used the profit to pay school fees. She also bought a plot of land, bought a car, repaid her loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her electronic money transfer services, like M-Pesa and Tigo-Pesa, to increase her soft drink stock and to buy up-to-date fabrics. She dreams of building her own house.

Aisha will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to increase her electronic money transfer services, like M-Pesa and Tigo Pesa,  to increase  her soft drink stock and to buy up-to-date fabrics.

loans.name: Sady

texts.es: Sady tiene una pequeña librería en la cual desea ampliar su oferta de servicios, para esto solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de computadoras, impresoras y papelería para implementar un cibercafé en su librería y poder abarcar mayor demanda de servicios principalmente de estudiantes de la zona.
texts.en: Sady has a small bookstore where she wants to expand the services she offers. In order to do this she is asking for a loan of one million Costa Rican colones (₡ 1 000 000) to buy computers, a printer, and paper to open an internet cafe in her bookstore and to better address the demand for services, primarily from students in the area.

loans.use: to buy computers, a printer, and paper

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es: Víctor es un comerciante de 29 años que reside en el municipio de Soledad y en esta misma localidad funciona su expendio de carne de res, pescado y queso, esta actividad que heredó de su padre con quien trabaja en sociedad.  Hoy en día cuenta con cinco años en esta labor en la que dedica diez horas a cumplir con su meta de ventas y sus principales clientes son vecinos y transeúntes del sector, aunque también distribuye a tiendas de barrios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar carne de res, pescado y queso al por mayor, así sus ganancias serán mucho mayores. Aunque Víctor se encuentra separado de su cónyuge es un padre responsable del bienestar de su hijo que es menor de edad  y su meta a futuro es potencializar su negocio para ofrecerle estudios profesionales y garantizar su calidad de vida y que pueda dar su aporte a la sociedad por medio de sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Victor is a 29 year old businessman who lives in the town of Soledad. In that same town he has his meat, fish and cheese shop, a business he inherited from his father with whom he works in partnership. He now has five years in this business in which he spends ten hours to meet his sales goals. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby from the area, although he sometimes distributes to neighborhood stores.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing done through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy meat, fish and cheese wholesale. As a result, his earnings will be much greater. Although Victor is separated from his wife, he takes responsibility as a father for the welfare of his young child. His future goal is to strengthen his business in order to allow his child to study to be a professional and guarantee his quality of life, so that he can give support to society through his knowledge.

loans.use: to buy beef, fish and cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales desde hace 10 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas plantas ornamentales por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 55 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband. She has made a living by selling ornamental plants for the last ten years. Her business is located in her home, and she has been able to get ahead with what she earns from her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy more ornamental plants wholesale to continue with her work, as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more ornamental plants wholesale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy soap, bags of sugar and rice to sell.

She is strong and active and works long hours throughout the week. She has opened a mobile money business to earn a side income and these two businesses have enabled her to earn more income and care for her family.

Her dream is to have diversified sources of income like a motorcycle to do motorcycle transportation. She also hopes to build a good, permanent residential house, but her main challenge is inadequate capital to achieve all of her dreams.

Patience is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for motorcycle transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for motorcycle transportation.

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a married mother of eight children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that had neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open-air food sales business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing thread.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es: Gladis es una estilista profesional que cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, ofreciendo servicios estéticos a centenares de Soledeños que se preocupan por su imagen personal, ella identificó una oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales al aprovechar a su clientela para comercializarles mercancías varias por encargos, obteniendo nuevos ingresos para el beneficio de su familia. Ella es madre de dos hijas menores de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge, les ofrecen educación en valores. Ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para fortalecer su capital de trabajo y poder comprar mercancía que sus clientes le han solicitado e insumos de peluquería. Su meta a futuro es tener un local comercial en donde pueda consolidar su negocio sin incurrir en pagos de arriendo y con las utilidades poder costearles los estudios a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Gladis is a professional stylist with 10 years of experience offering her aesthetic services to hundreds of people from Soledad who are concerned with their personal image. She identified an opportunity to generate additional income by using her customer base to sell various merchandise through orders, thereby obtaining added income for her family. She is the mother of two young girls, and with her spouse they offer them education in values.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to strengthen her working capital, and to be able to buy merchandise that her clients have asked for and hair salon supplies. Her future goal is to have a commercial locale where she can consolidate her business without incurring rent costs, and with the profits be able to pay for schooling for her girls.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that her customers have asked for and hair salon supplies.

loans.name: José Pablo

texts.es: José Pablo es un joven muy trabajador que junto a su familia se dedica a la siembra de diversos cultivos, principalmente  jengibre. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para el crecimiento y buen desarrollo de sus cultivos. De esta manera logrará un mejor producto para ofrecer al mercado.
texts.en: José Pablo  is a young worker who together with his family works growing diverse crops, principally ginger.  He seeks a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), to buy the agricultural supplies necessary for the growth and good development of his crops.  In this manner he will achieve a better product to offer in the market.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing ginger.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married with children. She operates a retail shop, and meets her family's needs as well.

She desires to expand her business and fully stock it to attract more customers, only to be limited by constant price fluctuations and inadequate capital to buy stock. However, she is working hard towards acheiving her dream. Joy possesses a family dream of educating her children, since she didn't get the chance to study.

She is requesting money to buy maize flour and soft drinks, among other things, to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour and soft drinks, among other things, to sell.

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en:
Sopiko, who is a 33-year-old young woman, lives in the village of Dikhashkho with her mother, who is a music teacher.

She earns 100-150 GEL per month. Sopiko is involved in a small agribusiness; in particular, she sells harvested nuts at the local market. She wants to start a stable business and increase her family's living condition.

Sopiko requested a loan from local financial institutions to start a trading business, but it was without success, as the family's whole income was not sufficient to get the loan.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Sopiko to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and start a trading business.

She will renovate the place for a general store, will purchase stock of products and will open it locally.

She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.

With the support of the Start Up program, Sopiko will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle financial difficulties.

loans.use: To renovate the place for general store and open it locally

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna lives in the Pemzashen village in the Shirak region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

Zhanna's husband works at a stone-grinding factory as a laborer and works hard to manage the family's daily expenses.

An important source of income for the family is their farm. There, Zhanna keeps two cows, calves and hens. She also cultivates wheat and potatoes and sells the gathered harvest in local markets.

Zhanna asks for this loan to purchase forage for the livestock, an ox, and seeds for land cultivation to develop farm and earn more income for the family. She hopes for lenders' support and dreams of seeing her farm developed and sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock, an ox, and seeds for land cultivation to develop the farm and earn more income for the family

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is in her mid-thirties and is single with one school-aged child. For five years now, she has been running two projects: a stationary business and a business selling soft drinks. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stationary stock and started selling soft drinks. She is happy with the loan. She used the profits to pay school fees, build her house, take care of her family, repay her loan and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stationary and soft drink stock.

She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Mwasiti will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stationary and soft drinks stock.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.pt:
Tem 37 anos de idade, esta a frequentar a 10 classe, vive maritalmente, pai de 5 filhos menores dos quais 4 com idade e acesso a escola, vive na casa própria feita de material convencional e ainda em construção. Trabalha como assentador da via ferrovía, com um rendimento que triplica o salario mínimo nacional e com direito a horas extras, dependendo da sua carga de trabalho. Está a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, embora o primeiro tenha sido em nome da esposa.
Pretende comprar cimento, varões de ferro, barrotes, tijoleira, pranchas, pregos e fechaduras, para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é crescer profissionalmente e futuramente realizar a cerimonia de casamento com sua esposa.
Diz não ter qualquer dificuldade relevante.
texts.en:
Constantino is 37 years old and attends 10th grade. He's in a common law marriage and has five underage children, four of whom are in school. He lives in a house that he owns and it's still being built with conventional materials. He's a railroad construction worker for a railway company and earns three times the national minimum wage. He gets paid overtime depending on his worload. This is his second loan, although the first one was taken on behalf of his wife.

He intends to purchase cement, iron rods, beams, tiles, planks, nails and locks so that he can continue building his house.

His biggest dream is to grow professionally and someday have a wedding ceremony with his wife.

He states that he doesn't face any relevant struggles.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron rods, beams, tiles, planks, nails and locks.

loans.name: Shantilata's Group

texts.en:
Shantilata, a 32-year-old woman from a small village in Khurda district of Odisha, works for a daily wage on the agricultural farms. She is a single mother and has three children in her care. In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small-scale animal husbandry business, too.

The family of four earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Half of the income being utilized for expenses, they end up saving 4,000 INR per month. Shantilata has bigger dreams. She wants to get rid of financial dependency and wants to become secure. This will take a lot of savings and a lot of hard work.

Shantilata doesn't think twice to invest her best efforts. She wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase her income. She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 24,000 INR. Shantilata will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a buffalo, with which she expects to increase her monthly income by 2,000 INR.

She is the one standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is a musician from Berdavan village in Tavush region. He lives with his wife, two sons and his parents. 

Mher works with his band consisting of 5 musicians; Mher plays wind instruments. They play at different events like weddings and birthday ceremonies in communities near Tavush region.

Mher asks for this loan to purchase a microphone reinforcement device and musical wind instruments needed for their musical performances. Mher is the main breadwinner in his family, as his parents are involved in the farming business but it is enough only for covering small daily expenses.

He hopes to receive lenders' support and improve the quality of their performance as musicians.

loans.use: to pay for a microphone reinforcement device and musical wind instruments

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a 30-year-old, married woman living with her two children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets, and earns additional income from growing and selling cocoa.

She is very hardworking, but is challenged by low income and lack of a source of financing her business to to her greater expectations. She has hopes of building a permanent house, and also of educating her two children up to university level.

Jolly has requested a loan to continue increasing her stock to meet the demand of her customers. She intends to buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages, rice, and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like tomatoes, cabbages, rice, and ground nuts to sell

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es: Doña Olga se dedica a la siembra de yuca y pimienta. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de fertilizantes y demás insumos agrícolas necesarios para el buen desarrollo de su cultivo. De esta forma logrará mejorar la calidad de su producto y aumentar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en: Olga works growing yucca and pepper.  She seeks a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies necessary for the good development of her crop.  In this manner she will be able to improve the quality of her product and increase the earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing pepper.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Here is Jennifer from Davao City. She is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who takes care of her family while doing business. Her husband, Gilbert, is a porter--a job that requires physical strength because a porter lifts heavy objects and moves stock from one place to another. They have three children who are all studying, one in college, one in high school, and the youngest in elementary school. The bloating family expenses drives Jennifer to venture into direct selling and dried fish vending.

She sells undergarments, toiletries and cosmetics from a popular brand, Avon. She also has a rented space in the town’s public market where she sells dried fish. Now that it’s the rainy season and she can hardly afford the increasing price of dried fish, she has to give more attention to her direct selling business. She’s requesting a PHP 14,000 loan that she will use to buy more Avon products. But of course, she will also set aside a supplementary capital for dried fish. If she hears about affordable dried fish, she jumps at the chance to buy bigger volumes of it. 

Jennifer prays to God to bless her business and grant her children a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more undergarments, toiletries and cosmetics; as well as a greater volume of dried fish

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 35-year-old hardworking married woman with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Four of her children attend school and the entire responsibility of caring for them rests on her.

She used her previous loan to buy manure for her farm. She still deals in the growing of bananas as her main source of income and sells coffee, goats and also distills local brew as her side source of income.

She has been a farmer for more than 17 years and works six days a week. She hopes to become rich, have a modernized farm and establish another business; however, her main challenges are thieves who steal her goats and ready bananas, natural calamities like droughts, and bad debtors.
 
She is requesting a loan to buy building materials to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Chandrabati's Group

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old differently abled Chandrabati lives in Khurda district of Odisha, India with her husband and two grown-up sons. She is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. Her sons both work in a small company. She is a homemaker, and her husband is involved in a fishery business. He has a lot of experience in this field because he has been engaged in this business for 30 years.

They have a fish pond, and he uses the pond for business purposes. He has been involved in this business for a long time, since fish is very popular among the people of this region. For family functions and festivals, crowds of customers gather at the fish markets.

Now he wants to expand his business, but money is the main problem. So, to help her husband, Chandrabati, along with her other group members, has applied for a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. Her husband wants to use the money to fulfill the demands of his valuable customers by enhancing his stock.

She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a variety of baby fish to raise in the pond and some fish feed to expand the business and sell more fish for income generation. They hope that they can expand their fishery business with the help of this loan and save money to develop their family's financial status.

loans.use: to buy a variety of baby fish to raise in the pond and some fish feed to expand the business and sell more fish for income generation.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade, viúva, mãe de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu sobrinho que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende reabilitar a sua obra e erguer.
texts.en:
Ana comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. She's 47 years old and a widow. She has three adult children and takes care of her nephew who lives with her.

She started working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, metal plates, etc., so that she can continue building her house.

In the future she intends to move forward with the construction work.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal plates, etc., so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Juliao

texts.pt:
Tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente na casa própria, pai de 5 filhos o primeiro maior de idade e já no seu lar, os quatro ainda na sua responsabilidade e ainda a estudarem, trabalha numa escola como guarda e pedreiro, profissão esta com a qual tem conseguido maximizar seus rendimentos de tal maneira que consegue sustentar sua família e construir sua residência mesmo ganhando um salario mínimo no seu posto de trabalho. Está a repetir o credito pela quinta vez, sempre se comportou muito bem e pontualmente nos pagamentos tendo investido na construção e na compra de bens para sua casa.
Pretende dar continuidade fazendo acabamentos na sua casa e comprar alguns bens, como por exêmplo, cimento, tijoleiras, sofás.
Ele tem o sonho terminar sua casa, mobilar e num futuro próximo comprar uma viatura.
Diz não ter grandes dificuldades, apesar do seu ordenado ser aquém do desejável, tem tentado auxiliar se com trabalhos por conta própria para poder alcançar seus objectivos
texts.en:
Juliao is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives in a house that he owns. He has five children, one of whom is an adult and already has his own home. The other four children are under his care and still in school. He works as guard at a school and as a bricklayer. This line of work allows him to increase his income so that he can afford to support his family and build a house even though he earns minimum wage at his job. This is his 5th loan. He has always been very abiding and punctual with his repayments. He used the loans to build and furnish his house.

He intends to keep on doing finishing work on his house and purchase some goods such as cement, tiles and sofas.

His dream is to finish his house and furnish it, then in the near future buy a vehicle.
