He states that he doesn't face great struggles, even though his salary is below his expectations. He has been getting by with self-employment in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase cement, tiles and sofas.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Felister, who is in her early thirties, is single with three kids who are still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for four years now. She works from 07:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Felister's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of salon products and has managed to pay back her loan successfully.

She is doing great with the loan. She used the profits to pay school fees, repay the loan, buy a fridge and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' needs. She dreams of opening another salon in a different area.

Felister will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
El señor José Humberto de 62 años de edad es casado y vive con su esposa y sus hijos en  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años a la actividad de herrero, elabora machetes, piochas, barras, cuchillos, clavos de herradura, herraduras, barretas, etc. también hace reparaciones de herramientas.
Don 	José Humberto vive en San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales como: cemento, arena, madera, láminas, etc. para realizarle unas mejoras en su vivienda en la parte del corredor, como repellar, pulir, ponerle piso de cemento y cambiar una parte del techo. y con esta inversión espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Don Humberto su sueño es  crecer con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Septiembre  2015
texts.en:
José Humberto is 62 years old and married, and he lives with his wife and their children in a house they own. For the last twenty years, he has made a living as a blacksmith, making machetes, pickaxes, bars, knives, horseshoe nails, horseshoes, crowbars, etc. He also repairs tools. José Humberto lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He is a hardworking man with the desire to improve his quality of life.

He is asking for the loan to buy materials like cement, sand, wood, sheet metal, etc. to do home improvements in his hallway like plastering, renovating, putting in a cement floor, and replacing a part of the roof. And with this investment he hopes to improve his family's quality of life. Don Humberto's dream is to grow with his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - September  2015

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wood, sheet metal, etc. for his house

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is 29 years old. He lives in the Gaza Strip with his small family. One year ago he started selling birds; it’s a good business but still needs a lot of improvement.

He applied for this youth loan to buy different kinds of birds as per customer requests, as well as cages and food for them, which will increase his income, helping him to improve his family's financial condition.

Muhammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds as per customer requests, as well as cages and food for them.

loans.name: Bwizi Balema Tukore Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a hardworking married woman who hails from Kamwenge, Uganda. She previously became a Hofokam borrower after initially borrowing 300,000 UGX to add more items in her general shop. Joyce is a member Bwizi Balema Tukore Group. Her business challenges include seasonality and an unreliable market.

Joyce is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from Hofokam to expand her business by adding more items to her shop. She will buy more salt, soap, sugar, and fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, sugar and fresh vegetables  to sell

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín es un comerciante que aperturó su tienda de víveres y abarrotes gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes depositaron toda su confianza en él y le brindaron toda la infraestructura en una de sus casas para que emprendiera este proyecto de negocio. Como sus padres son tenderos por tradición consideraron que con la experiencia que Joaquín posee,  puesto que desde niño estuvo al tanto del negocio familiar, sería todo un éxito esta nueva propuesta de lo cual no hay duda, hoy en día Joaquín cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento brindando a los Barranquilleros todos los productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar y un variado surtido en detergentes para uso doméstico y personal. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para abastecerse de víveres entre ellos arroz, legumbres, aceite, pastas, también detergentes y bebidas.  Joaquín de 30 años es soltero y su meta a futuro es ampliar el negocio y construir la segunda planta de la vivienda donde está ubicada su tienda, y conformar un hogar.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a businessman who opened his store of convenience items and groceries thanks to the support of his parent who put their trust in him and provided him all the infrastructure in one of their houses so he could undertake this business project. As his parents are shopkeepers, by family tradition they considered that with the experience Joaquín had, given that since a boy he was involved with the family business, he would be a complete success in this new venture, without a doubt. Today, Joaquín has two years in business, providing people from Barranquilla all the products that make up their household needs, and a varied supply of detergents for domestic and personal use.

Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to stock up on convenience items such as rice, vegetables, oil, pastas, detergents and drinks. Joaquín is 30 years old and single. His future goal is to expand his business and construct a second story on the house in which his store is located, and to set up a home.

loans.use: to stock up on convenience items such as rice, vegetables, oil, pastas, detergents and drinks.

loans.name: Lalita's Group

texts.en:
Lalita is a 50-year-old widow standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village in Khurda district, Odisha, India. Life was never easy for her after her husband's demise. All the burden of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only son.

Lalita is currently engaged in a sewing business and works hard in order to meet the household needs. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Lalita is unable to provide a higher education to her only son.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Lalita will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son to pursue his higher education smoothly and efficiently.

Lalita is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course.

loans.name: Sita's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing to the middle is Sita, a woman with grand aspirations. She is both humble and grateful and lives in the Khurda district of Odisha. She is a widow.

Sita is the mother of five lovely children, and she has been in the agriculture business for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables.

Sita has been relying on agriculture to provide all of her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly.

Despite these tough conditions, Sita remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. She along with her group members is seeking a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high.

With this loan, Sita will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and earn more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields.

This loan will support Sita’s economic activity, and will improve her family’s living standards as well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Sofia

texts.pt:
Nasceu Maputo tem 45 anos de idade, é casada oficialmente mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que se encontra em Ressano Garcia.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2010, este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas, blocos e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende abrir um estaleiro e um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Sofia comes from Maputo. She's 45 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom attend school. She supports her mother who lives in Ressano Garcia.

She started working with Hluvuku in 2010. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, metal plates, bricks, etc., so that she can continue building her house.

In the future she intends to open a supply yard and a store.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, metal plates and bricks.

loans.name: Zilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo Província do mesmo nome, tem 33 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2014, este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e mais para fazer acabamentos a sua obra.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, garantir a formação dos seus filhos e dar continuidade com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Zilda comes from Maputo, province of the same name. She's 33 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three underage children, all of whom are in school. She doesn't support anyone else.

She started working with Hluvuku in 2014. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, etc., so that she can do finishing work on her house.

In the future she intends to finish building her house, pay for her children's education and move forward with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, etc., so she can do finishing work on her house.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Shukuru is in his early 30s and is married with one child who is still small. He has been running a transportation (tricycle) business for four years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shukuru's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on taking his tricycle for servicing and was able to make more trips without any problems. He has paid back all his loans successfully.

He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay the loans, to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle, and to cover house hold expenses. He will use this loan to buy new spare parts and to service his tricycle for making easy movement and to be able to make more trips.

Shukuru will share this loan with his loan group, Machimbo Group, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts and to service his tricycle for making easy movement and to be able to make more trips.

loans.name: Suru

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Suru, who is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, two of them married, can only make 400 INR per day to support her family. Suru resides in a rural area of Bolangir District, Odisha, India. She has been involved in this career for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Suru would like to get a Kiva-funded loan of 15,000 INR from Peoples Forum in order to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, apenas 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2015, este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade como: arroz, feijão, óleo e mais para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
texts.en:
Pedro comes from Zavala, province of Inhambane. He's 33 years old and in a common law marriage. He has three underage children, two of whom are in school. He doesn't support anyone else.

He started working with Hluvuku in 2015. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and with it he intends to increase the stock in his business. He sells products that are household staples such as rice, beans, cooking oil, etc. That way he'll meet his customers' needs.

In the future he intends to continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, etc., so he can meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Catalina Esther

texts.es: Catalina de 50 años es habitante de Barranquilla y reside en un barrio de este municipio en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, ella es una emprendedora mujer que inició su negocio desde su hogar por el incumplimiento de los pagos por parte de su anterior empleador, en medio de esta circunstancia tan difícil con sus ahorros compró víveres para la preparación de almuerzos y frituras que propuso a vecinos del sector.  En la actualidad cuenta con dos años en su negocio con los resultados esperados y está muy contenta y optimista porque considera que tiene muchas expectativas de crecimiento en esta actividad. Ella desea tener más capacidad y poder ofertar mucho más almuerzos y desayunos, es por ello que aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en víveres tales como: harina, masa, aceite, legumbres y carnes, que le permitirán abastecer a nuevos clientes. Sus metas a futuro es tener un restaurante, comprar su vivienda y continuar apoyando con los gastos en el hogar.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 50 year inhabitant of Barranquilla. She lives in a neighborhood of this municipality with her husband and her children. She is an enterprising woman who started her business from her house due to a default of payment on the pert of her previous employer. In the midst of such difficult circumstances she bought foods to prepare lunches and fried foods with her savings, which she offered to neighbors in her area.

At present she has operated her business for two years with the hoped for results and she is very optimistic and happy as she feels she has good prospective to grow in this business. She wants to have greater capacity and be able to offer many more lunches and breakfasts.

So she is applying for a loan from Kiva her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in supplies such as flour, corn flour (masa), oil, vegetables and meat which will allow her to supply her new clients. Her goals for the future is to have a restaurant, buy her house and continue to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to invest in foods like flour, corn flour, oil, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en:
Yovan is single man who is planning to marry, who hails from Kasese, Uganda. The need to be self-employed forced him to engage in agriculture, basically growing bananas and rice. He also owns a retail shop as a side income project.

Yovan wants to plant more rice, which requires labor. Unfortunately, the money he has at hand is not enough to employ enough labor on the farm. He is requesting credit to hire enough labor to plant his rice so that he catches up with the season.

He believes that in future he will be referred to as a model farmer in his area. He will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: to hire enough labor to plant rice so that he catches up with the season.

loans.name: Johnbaptist

texts.en:
Johnbaptist is a 36-year-old hardworking married man with three children aged 5, 7, and 9 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sews and sells clothes to earn a living and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

Apart from that, he also grows bananas and coffee, from which he earns more money to support his family. He has been dealing in the cloth business since 2010 and has a vision of expanding his business into a wholesale store of modern designer clothes, but his main challenge, like other business people, is inadequate capital to meet the high demand.

With the requested loan, Johnbaptist intends to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir uma geleira para sua família.
Futuramente pretende contrair matrimónio e terminar a sua obra de residência. O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Rogerio comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 28 years old and in a common law marriage. He has two underage children and doesn't support anyone else.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with it he intends to purchase a refrigerator for his family.

In the future he intends to get married and finish building his house. His biggest challenge is moving forward with his studies and providing his children with an education all the way through college.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his family.

loans.name: Irma Giorgina

texts.es:
La socia Irma Giorgina  continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de zapatos y negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos para niñas.
texts.en:
The borrower, Irma Giorgina, continues to work at her business selling shoes and her business selling clothing. The borrower is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower is a responsible and determined person. The borrower has had her business for a good while, which is going well for her, thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day, and in this way the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase girls' shoes.

loans.use: to purchase girls' shoes.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Florencia se dedica al negocio de venta de pasto, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pasto. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pasto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Florencia, works at her business selling forage. The borrower is an enterprising and hard-working woman who, through this business has gotten her family ahead. The borrower's dream is to expand her business selling forage. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase forage.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase forage.

loans.name: Bendra

texts.en:
Bendra, 52, lives in her own humble home made of daub and wattle in a small village in Bolangir district. She has lived there for a number of years with her husband and their two daughters, age 26 and 24, and their 19-year-old son. Bendra works as a paddy farmer in the community, and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Bendra is well known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.

Bendra is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene. She hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system

loans.name: Nambasi Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and married. Her husband runs a grocery store. She has four children.

Catherine owns a general store. She would like to use this loan to buy cooking oil, hardware, salt, wrappers and soap for her store. Three of her family members help with the daily activities of the business. Catherine started her business to be self employed and to provide food for her family.

Her future goals are to own a motor bike and to open another store in a neighboring village.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, hardware, salt, wrappers and soap

loans.name: Abeta

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Abeta and her small general store located in Buhangin, Davao City. She notices that her store is not that appealing to customers due to her limited stocks. Many customers prefer a store with a wide variety of selections. But because she has small capital and it’s not very often that she visits the town to buy stock of groceries, she just added marang to her inventory. She can buy it from growers within their community.

Marang is a delicious, aromatic tropical fruit usually seen in Mindanao. It looks like a small jackfruit outside but is different inside. It’s the season of marang and Abeta wants to seize the opportunity to buy a higher volume while it’s still cheap.

She asks for PHP 20,000 additional capital for this purpose. Also, she intends to procure more grocery items to enhance her store inventory. In due time, she plans to open a small canteen to increase her profit.

Arturo, her husband, is always there to support her business. They have children who are already starting their own families. She prays for good health and understanding within her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a higher volume of marang fruit, plus more grocery items.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor  José Mauricio de 38  años de edad es soltero  y  vive con su familia  en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de granos básicos e insumos como herbicidas,  gramoson, urea,  en su aldea es reconocido porque es muy popular y amable. 
Don José Mauricio es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de superarse y mejorar su condición de vida.  
Está solicitando el préstamo para compra de granos básicos como maíz  y frijoles,  está muy contento de salir adelante con su negocio. Es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y su sueño es crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.      
                    
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
José Mauricio is 38 years old and single. He lives with his family in a home they own. For 5 years he has worked selling staple grains and supplies such as herbicides like Gromoxone, and urea. His village is known for being very traditional and friendly. José Mauricio is an entrepreneurial man with the desire to improve himself and better his condition in life.

He seeks a loan to buy staple grains such as corn and beans. He is very happy to move forward with his business. He is a new customer who wants to work with Prisma. His dream is to grow with his business and improve his quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to buy staple grains such as rice and beans.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Francisca continua dedicándose a trabajar como  veterinaria, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua cuidando y curando a los animalitos que necesitas sus servicios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de jarabes entre otros.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Nueva Visión de Urubamba communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba and Cusco department.

The borrower, Francisca, continues to work as a veterinarian. The borrower is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. The borrower continues to care and heal animals which need her services. The borrower is a responsible and determined person, and in this way the borrower gets her family ahead.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase syrups among others.

loans.use: to purchase syrups and more.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is a 49-year-old, hardworking married man with five children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He grows and sells bananas and coffee that help him earn income and pay school fees for his children. He also rears and sells goats and works for six days in a week.

He is experienced and determined in farming and has done this work for over 22 years. He has hopes of buying more land for growing more coffee in the near future, though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital.

He requests a loan to buy more coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy more coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Dunia Melissa

texts.es: Dunia es una joven que junto a su familia se dedican a la actividad de ganado caprino. Solicita un préstamo de seiscientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 650 000), para la compra de cabras que le permitan aumentar el número de animales en su finca y de esta manera incrementar la producción y los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Dunia is a young woman who, with her family, works raising goats. She asks for a loan of six hundred fifty thousand colones (₡ 650 000) to purchase goats that will allow her to increase the number of animals on her farm and in this way increase the production and the income coming from this work.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a mature, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has four children and three are still in school. He loves to work hard so as to provide for them, especially so that they may finish school and then realize more development in his family.

He used his previous loan to buy more manure for his farm. He now deals in cattle and goat fattening, alongside farming, to earn extra income, which work he has done for more than fourteen years. He also works throughout the week.

Moses hopes to own a big animal and banana plantation farm in the future though his main challenges are competition, unfavorable price changes, droughts and pests, and diseases.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening at his farm.

loans.name: Kambazithe Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 and married. Her husband is a welder. She has three chidren and two orphans that depend on her.

Ruth sells vegetables for a living. She would like to use this loan to buy more tomatoes as well as beans for the new business she intends to start. She started her business to support her family by providing daily necessities and to help with the paying of school fees for the children.

Ruth would like to keep supporting the orphans in her home and to renovate her home. She would also like to start buying and reselling farm produce like maize in a couple of years.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and beans for her new business

loans.name: Alinafe Group

texts.en:
Stevelia is 42 years old. She is married to a university lecturer. She has three children.

She runs a grocery store. She would like to use this loan to buy more groceries to stock up her store. She started her store to raise her standard of living and to easily pay school fees for her children. Her family members help with the running of the business.

Stevelia plans to build a larger house so she can have enough room for her family. She also plans to start selling farm produce like maize in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a mature hardworking married man with four children aged 2, 9, 12, and 14 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy building materials to complete his house.

His now deals in farming as a main source of income, though the shop is still there, and also has now completed his rentals which businesses help him earn an extra income. He believes he will be able to earn more income and profits and adequately provide for his family.

He has intentions to become a rich man, expand his retail shop business, and educate all his children to a minimum qualification of a degree. However, his main challenges are inadequate capital and bad debtors.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize flour, crates of eggs, and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, crates of eggs, and soda to sell.

loans.name: Nkhunguni Group

texts.en:
Olivia is 37 and married. Her husband is working as a driver. She has five children and one relative who depend on her.

Olivia sells beans and rice. She would like to use this loan to buy more rice, beans, and fish. One of her family members helps her with the running of the business. She started her business so she could provide basic needs such as clothing and food for her family. She also wanted to pay school fees for her children.

Olivia hopes to build a good house roofed with iron sheets and to educate her children. In a couple of years, she envisions owning a big general store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and fish.

loans.name: Solofo Tanteraka

texts.fr:
22 ans, Solofo est une jeune femme travailleuse, dynamique et courageuse. Elle est mariée et son mari aussi est commerçant. Le couple a un enfant de un an. 
Elle est commerçante depuis long temps, sauf seulement, ce sont les marchandises qui ont changés. Au début, elle vendait des savons (vente ambulante car elle n'a pas encore eu de lieu de vente fixe), ensuite quand elle a trouvé un point de vente fixe en 2015, elle commençait la vente des fruits et légumes car c'est le plus convenable à l'emplacement.
L'objectif est d'acheter un terrain et de construire une maison, un objectif qui la pousse à s'efforcer d'effectuer des épargnes.
texts.en:
Solofo is 22. She is a courageous and hardworking young woman. She is married and her husband is also a tradesman. They have one child aged one.
She has been a shopkeeper for a long time, only the merchandise has changed. To start with, she sold soap (as an itinerant saleswoman because at the time, she did not have a place to sell her goods), and then when she found a stall in 2015, she started selling fruit and vegetables, as they are the easiest things to sell from her location.
Her goal is to buy a plot of land and to build a house, a goal that encourages her to save money.

loans.use: to buy different sorts of fruit: bananas, papayas, oranges, strawberries, pineapples, and mangoes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Your help can improve the lives of others!

Here is Mary Ann, 41 years old, a resident of Buhangin, Davao City. She is currently running a store that offers the usual commodities that are needed in an individual’s daily life. Her income from the business helps sustain their everyday necessities. Her husband, Edgardo, has an occasional job, and it’s hard to imagine how they are able to support their family with five children; maybe because two of their children are now working and already capable of extending financial help. Nevertheless, the rest are still studying, and their expenses continue to increase.

With this case, Mary Ann wants to ask for help from you. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan that she will use to buy more groceries, toiletries, and snack items for her store. She is truly hopeful that this amount will help her attract more customers and will then lead to a higher profit.

She dreams of growing her business and having a better living condition someday. She would love to see all her children finish their studies to gain stable careers. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, toiletries, and snack items for her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is married with five children. He deals in motorcycle spare parts as his main source of income. He also owns rentals. His clientele has recently increased. This is happening because he sells almost every spare part, as he has access to all the mechanics around. At the moment he is overwhelmed and his stock cannot contain his clients. He is requesting for money to buy more spare parts to sell. He is 100% able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet used the previous loan to to buy rice, sodas and beers to sell ahead of the Christmas season. She is a retailer selling items like beers, sugar, rice, soap, sodas and cooking. She also runs a bar which she started six years ago with a hope of employing and developing herself.

She is performing very well and uses the proceeds from her business to pay the loan, pay medical bills and pay school fees for her children. She is faced with challenges of customers defaulting her and this leads to low profits and delayed growth. However, she is looking forward to buying a piece of land where she can build rentals as a way of income diversification. Annet has asked for a loan to buy beers, sugar, rice, soap, sodas and cooking to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sugar, rice, soap, sodas and cooking to sell.

loans.name: Ricklin

texts.en: Ricklin used the previous loan to buy beers, soap, salt, sugar and other goods to sell. She owns a retail shop in a busy area of Fort Portal town in the Western region of Uganda. At the same time, she has a canteen and rentals from which she gains additional income. She is facing hardships of her customers defaulting her and low capital that all together delay growth and lower profits. However, she is looking forward to buying a piece of land to build more rentals. She has asked for another loan to help her buy sugar, rice, beans, sodas, posho, wheat flour and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, sodas, posho, wheat flour and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris used the previous loan to buy exotic cattle to raise. He is a farmer rearing cattle and growing tomatoes. He also owns rentals for additional income. He is facing challenges of unpredictable weather changes, especially the drought that destroys his tomatoes and lowers milk production. However, he is looking forward to constructing more houses for rentals and educating all his children up to the university level. Chris has asked for a loan to buy another heifer for milk production.

loans.use: to buy another heifer for milk production.

loans.name: Tukamulane Group

texts.en:
Patuma is 28 and married. She has five children. Her husband operates a second-hand clothing business.

Patuma runs a second-hand clothing business. She is going to buy more clothes to sell. She has employed one person to help with running the business. The profits from this business will help her pay for food for her family. Patuma started her business to become independent and help her husband pay for household expenses.

Patuma hopes to buy a motor bike for business purposes. In a couple of years she hopes to open a second location for her clothing business in a nearby village.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Olivienne

texts.fr:
32 ans, Olivienne est mariée et son mari est agent de sécurité. Le couple a trois enfants, âgés de 3, 7 et 11 ans. Les deux premiers sont scolarisés actuellement.
Elle exerce une activité de vente de friperie et des chaussures à l'occasion. L'activité était pratiquée par son mari avant qu'il trouve son travail d'agent de sécurité et elle s'occupait de ses enfants et du ménage. 
La priorité du couple en ce moment est le développement et l'extension de l'activité, pour que le revenu familial augmente afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Olivienne is 32. She is married and her husband is a security agent. They have three children aged three, seven and 11 years old.
She sells secondhand clothing and shoes. Her husband used to run the business until he found his job as a security agent, and she took care of the home and the children.
This couple's priority at present is the development and expansion of their business to increase their income and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 1 bale of secondhand clothing and 1 bale of secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt février 2001. Ce groupe est composé vingt femmes dynamiques qui développent le commerce comme activité. Madame  Ndeye Binta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle s'active dans la vente des produits locaux depuis plus de sept années. Elle compte acheter trois bidons de vingt litres de jus de citron, deux bidons de vingt litres d'huile de palme et un panier de poissons séchés. Elle a une très bonne clientèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à assister ses parents.
texts.en: The banc villageois was inaugurated on the 20th of February 2001. This group is made up of 20 dynamic women whose business is trade. Mrs. Ndeye Binta, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She has been selling local produce for seven years. She plans to buy three cans of 20 litres of lemon juice, two cans of 20 litres of palm oil, and a basket of dried fish. She has a very good clientele. She will use the profits to help her parents.

loans.use: to buy lemon juice, palm oil, dried fish and dried shrimps.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like onions and cabbages. He works six days a week and has been doing this activity since 2001. He started doing this with a hope of earning an income. He is faced with challenges of limited capital and high cost of maintenance. However, he hopes to educate all of his children to higher levels of learning and expand his farming activities in order to increase output. Benon now needs a loan to buy herbicides to spray the tomatoes and pay workers working for him.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to spray the tomatoes and pay workers working for him.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah used the previous loan to buy cassava flour, maize flour, soap and rice for resale. She has a retail shop and also does farming that gives her extra income. She is faced with challenges of her customers delaying in paying her, and this lowers her overall profit. However, she is looking forward to buying land where she can build rentals and obtain more income.

Sarah is performing very well in her business. With the profits she is able to pay the loan, pay medical bills of her family, and pay school fees for her children. She has asked for another loan to help her buy cassava flour and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer rearing chicken and also grows bananas and does motorcycle transport which earns her more income. She has been in this business for two years now. She started the business with a hope of getting an income for her family. She is looking forward to buying a plot of land where she can construct a residential house for her family. She has asked for a loan to buy chicken feeds.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he works 12 hours per day. He has been doing this for 12 years now. Besides that, he has a retail shop which brings him more income. He started this with a hope of earning income and developing himself. He has future prospects of buying a car for taxi transport. He is facing hardships of high competition in the transport sector. Andrew needs a loan to buy stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, and posho to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, and posho to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking woman with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling foodstuffs, along with cocoa growing for supplementary income. She used the previous loan to buy foodstuffs to sell to her increasing number of customers. She has a great desire to make bigger profits and become a prominent businesswoman in her area, although she complains of the difficulty of high transport costs, unpredictable weather changes and limited sources of financing her business. She is requesting another loan to buy foodstuffs, mainly sweet potatoes and fresh beans, to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Moh'd

texts.en: Moh'd is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Moh'd has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Moh'd would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Moh'd can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Moh'd will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Moh'd is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sol De Luz 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Rose is one of the members of Sol de Luz 4, 5 & 6. This group is comprised of Haitian immigrants. They are located in the city of Santo Domingo, which is one of the rural cities around the capital in the country. Its economy is dependent on different sales markets and working in the capital industry. These 15 businesswomen are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community. Rose enjoys attending church and visiting her family.

Rose, a Haitian mother living in the north of Santo Domingo, makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They have three children, none of whom live in their small and simple home structure. She is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She runs a fried food stall where she sells breakfast and dinner like fried sausages, empanada (fried dough filled with meat or veggie), fried meat and vegetables like plantains or potatoes, etc. She will use this loan to buy ingredients to produce her fried food plates.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help her partner with home expenses. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy plantains, meat, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a young woman living in an informal settlement in Nairobi. She has come to iSmart in search of a job so that she can earn money to support herself. At iSmart, Millicent sells life-improving products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves. She earns a commission on each sale that she makes. Please help Millicent earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en: Kirui is young man living in Nairobi's slums in search of an opportunity to improve his life.  He started working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya where he earns an income selling green energy products like clean cookstoves and solar lamps in his community. He is learning valuable job skills in sales, customer service and professionalism that will help him throughout his lifetime.  Please help Kirui in his quest for financial independence by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
“One bag, one design.”

This is Carolina’s tagline when she promotes her products. She’s a skilled sewer from Buhangin, Davao City who creates these beautiful backpacks from combined used clothing and new fabrics. She selects sturdy fabrics from worn-out clothes and jackets, and then recycles them into backpacks. She has a caring consciousness about re-use and recycling of products; this is why she ventured into this kind of business. She distributes the finished bags to various stores, and sometimes she accepts bulk orders from companies that use her products as gifts to employees and guests. Aside from this, she’s into buy-and-selling used clothes, which is commonly known in the Philippines as “ukay-ukay.”

Carolina is hiring six employees to help her all the way from purchasing of raw materials to sewing, designing and marketing. Her husband, Danilo, is her business partner who assists her at all times. Despite some problems like lack of manpower, especially during peak season, they persist because it’s a very good source of livelihood for them and their employees.

Now Carolina would like to enhance her business and buy a volume of raw materials such as used clothes, new fabrics, zippers, sliders, threads, and other accessories for her business. Additional capital amounting to PHP 29,000 would be enough to meet this need. This will not only help her generate higher income and savings, but most importantly, it will endorse the recycling and use of locally-made products.

According to her, part of the profit will be used for the training of housewives who want to learn sewing. Carolina is a responsible leader of their community and she initiates the Homemakers’ Livelihood Program. Indeed, it’s her desire to help others.

Personally she dreams that her two children will finish college and obtain stable jobs. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy in volume raw materials such as used clothes, new fabrics, zippers, sliders, threads, and other accessories.

loans.name: Ladies And Bicycle - 09Phòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 44 years old and she is married with two children. For eight years she has had a service business selling bicycles. Huệ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more kinds of bicycles to resell.

In 2014, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of Ladies and Bicycle - 09PHòa, which consists of six members.

In the future, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more kinds of bicycles to resell.

loans.name: Giovvanny

texts.es: Giovanny de 20 años es un peluquero empírico que aprendió este arte de su madre, ella es una estilista que le entregó su mejor legado y le apoyó en su idea de negocio al proporcionarle sus primeras herramientas con las que realizó sus primeros cortes de cabello. Desde niño decidió que esta era la profesión en la que se quería desempeñar  y su propósito se hizo realidad hace cinco años, cuando aún no había cumplido su mayoría de edad. El ofrece manejo de la imagen unisex y maneja una variedad estilos contemporáneos y a la vanguardia, su calidad de su trabajo está marcada por la experiencia que lleva en la labor, por eso Giovanny está decidido a crecer profesionalmente y con la finalidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar el aspecto de su negocio con este capital realizará adecuaciones e invertirá una silla de peluquería, pintura, iluminación y una maquina profesional. Su meta a futuro es tener una mejor barbería y sucursales en toda Barranquilla. Su meta personal es comprar su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Giovanny is 20 years old and is a hairdresser who learned this art from his mother.  She is a stylist who has handed down her legacy and has supported him with his business idea, providing him with his first tools with which he made his first hair cuts.  Since he was a child, he decided that this was the profession that he wanted to pursue and his plan became a reality five years ago, when he wasn't yet an adult.  Giovanny offers unisex image services and is skilled with a variety of contemporary and cutting edge styles.  His quality of work is marked by his experience with this trade, and it is for that reason that Giovanny is deciding to grow professionally and with the goal of offering better services, he is applying for a Kivaloan, with financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  In order to improve the appearance of his business, with this capital, he will make adjustments and invest in a hairdresser's chair, paint, lighting, and a professional machine.  His future goal is to have a better barber's shop and branches all around Barranquilla.  His personal goal is to purchase his own home.

loans.use: to invest in a hairdresser's chair, paint, lighting and a professional machine.

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.en:
The six women of this group live in Santo Domingo Xenacoj, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. They range in age from 41 to 58. Three of them are illiterate, two have a second grade education, and one went to school through fifth grade. These are hardworking women who are doing their best to support their families with their meager profits. Most of the women in the group make or buy woven items such as napkins and table runners that they sell to tourists in nearby cities such as La Antigua or Guatemala City. Two of the women make and sell tortillas. Two others supplement their fabric income by selling fruits and vegetables.

A member of the group contacted a Namaste business advisor and asked if they could be part of the program because they felt they needed to know a lot more about managing a business. Namaste will provide them with basic financial training, a business advisor to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan. The women are very hopeful that these tools will make a difference in their business, their profits, and their lives.

Doña Fermina is 58 years old, and a single mother with a fifth grade education. Her youngest son, who is 18, still lives with her and helps her at home and with her businesses. Fermina has two businesses that have been the family’s sole source of support for many years. One business is buying and selling handwoven table napkins and the other is selling avocados. She buys the avocados locally and, very early in the morning, takes as many as she can carry to the large market in Guatemala City where she sells them all in an hour. She then returns home to work on selling the table napkins. Her dream is to increase her profits so she can do more to help her family. She wants to sell more avocados and to increase the variety of woven products she sells. She will spend her loan buying more avocados and more woven goods.

Fermina currently works 224 hours a month and makes a monthly net profit of 4462 Guatemalan Quetzales. In the course of her nine months in the Namaste program, she and her business advisor are projecting a 28% increase in profits.

loans.use: to buy more avocados and more woven goods.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar hails from the town of Pilar, Bohol. She is married with six children. One of her children is still attending school. She raises and sells hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her children.
Aside from hog raising, she engages in farming; she grows and sells rice.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for the farm and pig feed. It could boost her income and help her continue to handle it properly, thus supporting her family and providing better living conditions.

She is hoping that someday she will be productive in her chosen field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm and pig feed.

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en: Fuifui is a 40-year-old mother with five children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Fuifui requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Charlie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Charlie is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, and additional utensils for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, and additional utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are still in school. Ma. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 54 years old and married with five children. Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for five years.

In the future Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Jo Ann

texts.en:
Jo Ann is 39 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Jo Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Jo Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

Jo Ann has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jo Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is an 18-year-old single freshman who is from the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature at a university in the city. Her father is a civil servant and her mother earns her main income from fattening animals.

Sophan is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her future dreams, Sophan hopes to have a good job with a reasonable salary, build a fence around her parent’s house, and if she has children, she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Mr. Ganbat, 31 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as technical translator at a petroleum company since 2011. His wife stays at home, looking after their children. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to buy furniture such as a sofa, drawer and closet for his house. By doing so his family will live in comfortable place.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Heam is 30 years old, married with three kids, and lives in yata Hebron city. Heam has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Heam needs the USD loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Heam hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of her livestock.

Heam thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make a profit.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married with five children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Imelda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Anecita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Anecita is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 36 years old and married with five children. With four children still in school, Gemalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Gemalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack food, etc.

Gemalyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future Gemalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 33 года, замужем, 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Венеры на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, овца и лошадь. Также занимается торговлей канцелярских принадлежностей в магазине, в обороте есть товар на сумму 250,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный совокупный доход Венеры составляет 41,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку канцелярских принадлежностей для увеличения ассортимента товаров в магазине. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Venera is 33, married, with three children. She has a higher education and works in a school. In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she is also involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she now has five cows, one sheep and one horse.

Venera also sells stationery supplies in a shop and her inventory is worth 250,000 som (KGS). She makes a total monthly income of 41,000 som (KGS). Eager to increase her business, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy stationery supplies and increase her selection of goods in her shop. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies in order to increase the turnover in her shop.

loans.name: Yadiris María

texts.es: Yadiris es una comerciante de 42 años de edad, habitante de Palmar un municipio del Atlántico en donde se consolida su clientela  a la que ofrece una amplia variedad de productos entre ellos prendas de vestir, accesorios y calzado, ella inició con esta actividad para aportar a los gastos en el hogar y como no cuenta con un capital con el que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, toma la mercancía a consignación y su costo es muy alto, de esta forma no está siendo competitiva y para mitigar esta situación aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para contar con un capital que le permita comprar de contado jeans, blusas, vestidos, faldas y accesorios, y aprovechar las fiestas que se aproximan en las que sus ventas se incrementarán. Su meta a futuro es mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar en su negocio muy consolidada.
texts.en:
Yadiris is a 42-year-old merchant. She lives in Palmar, a city in the department of Atlantico, where she has formed a customer base to which she offers a wide variety of products including articles of clothing, accessories, and shoes. She started this business in order to cover household expenses. Since she does not have enough capital to meet the demands of her customers, she purchases the merchandise on credit. However, this makes her prices too high, and does not allow her to be competitive.

To fix this situation, she applied for a CrediKiva, which is the first loan that she takes out through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to have capital that will allow her to buy jeans, shirts, dresses, skirts, and accessories in cash. She will take advantage of the holidays that are approaching, during which her sales increase. Her goal for the future is to improve her quality of life and to continue with her well-established business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, dresses, skirts, and accessories in cash.

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
Vin, 40, is living in a wooden house located in Tbaung Khmum province with her children. She is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom are in school. There is a kid not yet of school age who needs her support. To support her family’s living, she has been running a business growing cassava and rice for 20 years.

She is new to VisionFund. She is the leader of three-member group, and will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic weedicide for her farm. She hopes that her crops grow well, resulting in more outputs for her. She dreams of sending her children to school and buying a hand tractor to support her farming business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields so that she can buy a hand tractor and send her children to school.

loans.name: Borhan

texts.en:
Borhan is a 28-year-old, single man from Nablus City,west bank, which is an ancient and beautiful city . He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Borhan has a store for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the the store need many of improvements . Borhan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to make some re-decoration for the store . He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.
Borhan appears in the store while the store under working.

loans.use: to make some re-decoration for his clothing store .

loans.name: Giovana Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Giovana Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
[Communal bank] member Giovana Carmen works in the business of selling food. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who is raising her family through this business. Her dream is to expand her business of selling food. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be happy. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more pigs. Her business goal is to have many pigs within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has this hidden dream that bespeaks hope. She's just 29 years old now and resides in a down-and out city of Quezon City with her husband and four vigorous children. 

She's operating a sari-sari store business which is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite a sort of smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are common necessities such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. 

Well, unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at a low-cost and in a retail basis which is really an advantage for the customers. Yet, gaining high profit here is a no easy feat when customers credit, delay payment or don't go with the demand. 

However, Rosalie already learned what to do when situations like these comes. CCT, on all accounts, starting 2013 where she joined as a member, guided her to improve her livelihood. 

Now, being introduced to KIVA, she likes to ask help from you. She likes to borrow a loan worth PHP 10,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for their family’s daily living condition. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce who used the previous loan to buy tomatoes, onions and beans to sell is a single mother with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Through her hard work she has been able to look after her children and all of them are in school. She deals in fresh foods, such as selling tomatoes, onions, cabbages, fresh beans, and ground nuts in markets around town. She hopes to expand her business and operate from a more permanent place to overcome challenges of too much sunshine and heavy rains on top of the challenge of high level of perishability of her products.

She gets loans to buy fresh foods to sell as her major source of income. She is now requesting for a another loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mmasi

texts.en:
Mmasi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own  house that neither has electricity nor  piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past four years, selling meat goat. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a hardworking married man, committed father of 5 children aged 4, 9, 12, 16, and 18 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more farm inputs, such as husks and fertilizers, to improve his plantation.He now deals in contracting  of construction work which he supplements with farming where he especially grazes cattle to earn income and have improved standards of living for his family.

Vicent works for ten hours each of the six days worked in the week since 2009. His dream is to take on bigger contracts so as to earn more profits in order to educate all his children equip them with skills that can also help them earn a living and income to sustain themselves but his main challenge is a lot of bureaucracy in acquiring a contract. 

He needs a loan facility to pay laborers working on the new construction contract recently awarded to him.

loans.use: to pay laborers working on the new construction contract recently awarded to him.  .

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with five school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.In addition she operates an open air food selling business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Melahat

texts.en:
Melahat is married with 2 children. With her first loan, she had purchased jewelry and materials for wax/soap production. She sold jewelry and her products. Since she made a bulk purchase, her profit increased. With this second loan, she will purchase more jewelry. Because wax/soap production is costly, she plans to sell just jewelry this time. She says that she will make more money from jewelry. She plans to open a jewelry shop as soon as her children grow a bit older.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Melahat hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. İlk kredisi ile hazır takılar ve mum malzemeleri almışdı. Mumdan sabun yapımının yanında hazır takılarda sattı. Toplu malzeme aldığından karı biraz daha da arttı. Aldığı ikinci kredisi ile takı alacak. Mumdan sabun işi daha çok masraflı olduğundan bu sefer sadece takı alıp satacak. Takı işinde daha çok kazandığını belirtti. İleride çocukları biraz daha büyüdüğünde kendine bijuteri dükkanı açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy purchase more jewelry

loans.name: Tuğba

texts.en:
Tuğba is married and she runs a hairdresser. With her first loan, she bought supplies at a low price and increased her profit. Then she moved her shop to a larger space and turned it into a beauty salon. She now provides more variety of services to her customers. With her second loan, she will replace her signboard and print leaflets. With these, she will reach more customers. She wants her shop to succeed more.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Tuğba hanım evli. Kuaför dükkanı işletiyor. İlk kredi ile toplu malzeme alıp kar edip, kazancını arttırdı. Dükkanını büyük bir yere taşıyarak güzellik salonuna çevirdi ve burada müşterilerine daha farklı alanlarda da hizmet ediyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile yeni dükkanının tabelasını ve broşürlerini yaptırdı. Burada daha çok müşteriye ulaşıp hizmet vermek istiyor. Yeni dükkanın da başarılı olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy signboards and print leaflets for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man. He operates a farm where he keeps goats. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more goats. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is married with three children, two of whom attend school. They live at their own house, that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 23 year old single lady living in Fort Portal Uganda and has a business of tailoring and designing which she started 4 years back with a hope of employing herself. She is facing hardships of customers defaulting and this reduces her overall profits.

However, Agnes is looking forward to buying land and construct there a good residential house. Agnes has asked for a loan to to buy clothes for tailoring to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for tailoring to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tuvo mejores ingresos y atrajo nuevos clientes desde que utilizo el crédito anterior en el fortalecimiento de la granja de pollos, actualmente solo practica la crianza de ganado y cerdos, tuvo que cerrar la granja de pollos debido a que presento problemas de salud a causa del contacto con ese tipo de animales. José comparte una vida más confortable con su familia.
Tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para cuidar mejor a los cerdos y al ganado, considera que podrá continuar trabajando y generando los ingresos que tanto necesita para subsistir.
texts.en:
