José had better income and attracted new customers since he used the previous loan in strengthening his poultry farm. Now he only raises cattle and pigs. He had to close the chicken farm because it presented health problems because of contact with this type of animal. José shares a more comfortable life with his family.

He has need for a new loan in order to buy feed concentrate and vitamins to take better care of the pigs and the cattle. He judges that he will be able to continue working and generating the income that he so much needs in order to subsist.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate and vitamins to take better care of the pigs and cattle. He judges that he will be able to continue working.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: Vasil is 61 years old. He lives alone in Gori district. Vasil is a physical worker and works daily to generate income. He wants to start trading business and requested a small credit for that. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 500 USD. With the received credit he will purchase seasonal fruits and will start trading business. Vasil will be able to generate stable income, along his activity. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and generate an income.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Farangis was born in 1995 year. She is young and smart and is married. She is very hardworking and industrious. She has been busy with her own business deal. Farangis grows onions, watermelon, wheat etc. She works in this field more than 3 years. Farangis’s husband and mother-in-low help her with managing her business.

Farangis likes her job and she dreams to develop the business further. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Gulbu

texts.ru: Гулбу, 51 год, замужем, есть 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 21 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гулбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает клевер для реализации. В хозяйстве есть также 6 коров, 10 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход Гулбу составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Гулбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит накопить на улучшение жилищных условий ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbu is 51, married, with four children. She has a secondary education and, for the past 21 years, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which bring a source of income for her family. Thanks to her very hard work and determination, Gulbu has come to the point where she now has one hectare of her own land on which she grows clover for resale. She also has six cows, 10 sheep and two horses on her farm. Her monthly income comes up to 20,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Gulbu has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business, which will in turn allow her to save some money to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving for sale business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak, 18, was an outstanding student when she was in high school. Now she is studying at university to pursue a bachelor’s degree in Khmer literature. Sreyleak’s family are rice farmers whose whole source of income is from their farming, so it can be hard to count on the farm’s yield to pay tuition fees.

To pay them, Sreyleak is applying for a loan of 2,600 USD through Kiva's field partner KREDIT. When she finishes her bachelor’s degree, she wants to find a good job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees at university.

loans.name: Yuranis Paola

texts.es: Yuranis es una emprendedora de 22 años que decidió seguirle los pasos a su cónyuge, quien ha conseguido el sustento del hogar con la actividad comercial que ejerce y fue su principal motivación para iniciar su miscelánea en las instalaciones de su vivienda.  Lo que más le gusta a Yuranis de su trabajo es que puede velar por el cuidado de su hija de cuatro años de edad y realizar sus labores en el hogar como de costumbre.  Los habitantes del sector están satisfechos de contar con un almacén que les bride un buen surtido de papelería, útiles escolares, manualidades, servicio de fotocopiadora y accesorios.  Ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para fortalecer su capital de trabajo y poder comprar nuevo surtido de productos de papelería para continuar sin contratiempos en su actividad.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio para captar más clientes que le permitan incrementar sus ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yuranis is a 22-year-old entrepreneur. She decided to follow in the footsteps of her partner, who has been able to support the household through the commercial activity that he pursues. Indeed, this was her primary motivation to establish a general store in her home. What Yuranis likes most about her work is that she can take care of her 4-year-old daughter as well as perform her household chores as usual. Those who live in the area are happy to have a store that provides them with a good assortment of paper goods, school supplies, crafts, photocopies, and accessories.

She is applying for a CrediKiva, which is the first loan that she takes out through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to strengthen her working capital so that she can buy a new assortment of paper products and continue smoothly with her business. Her goal for the future is to improve the image of her business in order to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her earnings and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of paper products.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 62 years old, married, and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. This business gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 14,900 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family.

Recently, she availed another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso hails from the town of Dauis, Bohol. He is 61 years old and married, with three grown children.

He earns a living by selling balut, a developing duck embryo (fertilized duck egg), that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It originated and is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines. Aside from selling balut, he also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle with extended seat), and transports passengers from one place to remote areas.

He has requested a loan to purchase additional balut, and to do motor maintenance like change oil and get gasoline. These could boost his daily income and allow him to continue to handle it properly. Thus, he could start to pay his obligation and be able to expand.

Narciso is hoping that someday he will be productive in both of his sources of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase addtional balut, and to do motor maintenance like change oil and get gasoline.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a farmer in the Philippines. In 2013 she learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She took out and successfully repaid a loan that she used toward the betterment of her farm. To keep improving her farm Miguela has now applied for a 30,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to pay for seedlings and compost.

Miguela feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She is grateful and would love to be in a position to help others like herself.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 31 years old and married, with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nelia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena, solicita un nuevo préstamo que invertirá en prendas de vestir y variedad de cosméticos, le servirán para mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
 Para Lorena el crédito anterior le dio recursos económicos para reactivar su negocio y cubrir las  nuevas demandas de sus clientes, su familia se mantiene y todos viven en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Lorena is requesting a new loan which she will invest in clothing and a variety of cosmetics which will allow her to maintain her business in operation.

The previous loan gave Lorena the economic resources to revive her business and cover the new requests from her clients. Her family is well and they all live in the best conditions.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and a variety of cosmetics which will allow her to maintain her business in operation.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Lorn is 50 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are still in school.

To earn a living, she has raised pigs for 12 years and has also worked as a laborer for others to get extra income for her family. Her pigs became ill and this is her main challenge that she faces in her family’s business.

For Lorn, this is her twelfth loan cycle with VisionFund and she has wisely paid back her past loans. Her living condition has improved as a result of her previous loans.

The group leader of three members, she will use her loan portion to buy more piglets and feed to improve her pig raising business to better support her family.

Lorn wishes that her family’s business will run smoothly and that it will earn her a good income. She wants to expand her pig-raising business, especially so she can support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed to improve her pig raising business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old, married and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.

The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more income, she has decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Pauglam PC, she has obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional feed. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family.

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, de 59 años de edad, está casado desde hace más de 20 años, vivo parte de su vida trabajando en el extranjero, para poder hacer una casa para vivir con su familia. 

Juan, hoy en día se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, ese fue el trabajo que aprendió cuando estaba joven y lo conoce muy bien. 

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y otros insumos para sembrar frijoles, porque la cosecha pasada la perdió porque le llego una plaga y casi acabo con todo lo que había sembrado.  

Juan, desea obtener una buena cosecha y poder vender una parte y el resto dejarlo para consumo familiar.
texts.en:
Juan, at the age of 59, has been married for more than 20 years. He spent part of his life working abroad in order to be able to build a house to live in with his family.

Now Juan raises corn and beans. This was the work that he learned as a youth, and he knows it very well.

Juan needs the loan in order to buy compost, pesticides, and other supplies to raise beans, because he lost the last harvest because a blight arrived and finished off almost everything that he had planted.

Juan wants to obtain a good harvest and be able to sell one part and leave the rest for family use.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides and other supplies to grow beans.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: In the year 2009, Avelina learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. As a farmer in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Avelina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Avelina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 43 years old and is known in Tudela, Misamis Occidental for her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products for snacks to different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. She had expanded and had increased her production due to high orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and other items. Trinidad believes having enough of the raw materials in her inventory will not hamper her daily operation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
Sin, who is 57, lives with his family members in the rural village of the Kampong Cham province. He is a father blessed with three children, one of whom is in school.

Sin's main sources of income to support his family’s living are from cassava and cashew farming. He has been in this business for 20 years. However, his cassava did not provide him with good yield lately.

Sin leads a group of two members to seek a new loan from VisionFund. For Sin, this is his fourth cycle and he has fully repaid his past loans on time. His family’s living has improved gradually with his previous loans.

As the leader of the group, Sin will use his loan portion to buy fertilizer to support his cassava farm to get a good yield. He will use a part of his loan to purchase organic pesticides for his cashew farm in order to produce higher yields than last year.

He hopes that he can improve the yields from his crops to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support his cassava farm and to purchase organic pesticides for his cashew farm.

loans.name: Visezi Group

texts.en:
Hoseni, who is in his late 70s, is married with twelve children. Eight of them are grown, and four of them are still in school.

Hoseni has been buying and selling cows and goats for five years now. He works from 8 am to 4 pm daily, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hoseni's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy cows and goats and has repaid all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay his loans, start building his own house, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy goats and cows to resell. He dreams of extending his business.

Hoseni will share this loan with his group Visezi, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to resell.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
From Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Eleazar, 57, is married and has three school-aged children. During his childhood he experienced extreme poverty, on days not having anything to eat. He told himself that when he had a family of his own, he would not allow his children to experience the same meager life. With only a small amount of money he ventured into buying and selling balut, a common street food that is a developing duck embryo boiled and eaten from its shell.

Eleazar has now built up a big enough customer base that he employs his friends to sell baluts. He knows, though, that if he made his own baluts, he would make more in profits, but he hasn’t the capital to expand into production. So he has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner PMPC to buy duck eggs for this purpose.

Eleazar continues to work hard to build upon his own success. His desire is to build a decent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs to make the Philippine street food called baluts to sell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a businesswoman who earns income through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is a 27-year-old single man. He has the responsibility of taking care of his mother and father. He is a farmer who rears cattle as his main source of income and has been in the business for the last 6 years.

He has applied for his first loan of 2,500,000 UGX from Hofokam Limited, Uganda to purchase more cows for better harvests and to add the surplus into his crop farming so that he can give his parents the best standards of living.

He plans to use the anticipated loan to buy more cows for his farm and the surplus to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm and the surplus to expand his business.

loans.name: Zhiydegul

texts.ru: Жийдегул, 49 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Жийдегул в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав 2010 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жийдегул есть 3 коровы и 20 овец. На участке мерою 0,30 Га выращивает пшеницу. Ежемесячная прибыль около 18,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жийдегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhiydegul is 49 years old, married, and the mother of two. To support her family, she does farm work. She started this business in 2010. At present Zhiydegul has three cows and 20 sheep on her farm. She also grows wheat on a field of 0.3 ha [0.75 acres]. Her monthly income is around 18,000 KGS. 

In order to develop her business further, Zhiydegul has applied to the Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy three cows to increase her livestock headcount. Zhiydegul plans to use the revenues from her loan to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos, an adult married man with six children, runs a retail shop in Kamwenge, Uganda. He started this business 15 years ago with an intention of making profits and purchasing a piece of land so that he could construct his own house and stop renting.

His greatest dream is to improve on his standard of living and have all his children educated. However, he faces challenges of inadequate capital to stock his shop with all the necessary items that his customers request.

Amos hopes to become a prominent businessman with a wholesale shop. He is requesting a loan to buy more items like salt, sugar, sweets and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items like salt, sugar, sweets and others to sell.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt février 2001. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes courageuses qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Hawa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée; âgée de vingt cinq ans et mère de cinq enfants dont trois filles. Elle est dans l'activité depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité un sac d'arachide, six sacs de charbons, un kilogramme de farine par jour et deux seaux de mangues. Elle a une bonne clientèle. Elle arrive à écouler ses produits facilement. Les bénéfices vont servir à assister à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was launched on February 20, 2001. This group is composed of 20 determined female entrepreneurs. Ms. Hawa, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative. She is married, 25 years old and the mother of five children, including three girls. She has been in business for years.  

Hawa plans to use her loan to buy a bag of peanuts, six bags of charcoal, a kilogram [2.2 pounds] of flour per day and two pails of mangoes. She has a good customer following. Her wares sell quickly. Her revenues will allow her to help provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, charcoal and flour.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has started her own small business and become the boss of a sari-sari (general) store. Until now, she has managed to have a large enough inventory and to use her capital to make more profit. Every day she has good sales as she is the only store in her barangay (area).
Recently Elizabeth approached Paglaum for much needed extra capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Lai is 34 years old and a mother of two school children. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for 16 years and she can save about $7 USD per day. Besides this, she can earn more income by working as a construction worker for others. Her crop can be destroyed by insects, so that is her main challenge.

Lai is applying for her second loan cycle with VisionFund and she repaid her past loan completely. She was able to earn a decent income using her previous loan and improve on her living conditions as well. As the leader of four group members, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and more organic pesticide for her farm so she can produce a good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her family’s business in order to improve her living conditions and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more organic pesticide for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ilza

texts.en:
Ilza is the owner of Baby Development Journal Inc. Her business specializes in creating commemorative infant developmental journals. Before starting her business in the U.S,, Ilza worked as a child psychologist in Brazil. She moved to the U.S. to begin graduate studies in developmental psychology. Ilza has numerous certifications for the provision of childcare and is licensed by the Mass Office of Childcare Services to provide care for children. She has 15 years of experience in providing care for children in daycare centers as well as to families directly in the greater Boston area.

Ilza enjoys creating journals that compile memorable and significant moments in the development of infants as they grow into their childhood years. Ilza is currently seeking a loan that would allow her to have access to the working capital she needs to operate her business and take on additional commemorative projects. She hopes to grow her business enough to be able to hire employees in the future.

loans.use: to access working capital necessary to operate her business .

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 64-year-old married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en: Matia is married with children and lives in the Kasese district of Kenya. He operates a general store and coffee business to generate income and provide for his family. Of late, Matia has needed to add goods to his store stock such as sugar, maize flour and drinks so that his business will perform better. The challenge is that he does not have enough money to do so. He would be thankful to Kiva members who lend him money so he can meet the above need and he will willingly pay back the loan in full instalments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aiole

texts.en: From Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Aiole earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to it that she has enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of her business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. Aiole hopes to live comfortably with her children until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory to sell.

loans.name: Dolphy

texts.en: Dolphy is a farmer from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old and married with six  school-age children. He avails various loans from Paglaum MPC to prepare for the next cropping season. He is availing a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Originally from Kandal province, Savoeun is 40 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. She earns an income to support her living conditions via rice cropping. Moreover, she works as a construction worker and security guard to get more income. Because of the drought, her rice did not grow well on time and this is her main challenge. Her current business can allow her to save from her daily income about 3.5 USD per day. For Savoeun, this is her fifth microloan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans on time. With her previous loans, she was able to get a better income than before to improve her family and support her children’s studies on time. She is seeking this new loan with VisionFund in order to buy a decent motorbike to go to work on time. She hopes that she can save more time from her work to improve her farming and she wishes that she could get more income to upgrade her living conditions and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to go to work on time

loans.name: Erly

texts.en: Erly is managing her food vending business in Tudela. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vilma has been in pig fattening for seven years and earns additional income from her general store and from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en: Esteria is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 43 years old and married. She never gets tired of tending her store. Jocelyn's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. Jocelyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Jocelyn continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Netty

texts.en:
Netty is 43 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Netty is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Netty has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from her general store and farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hazim

texts.en:
Hazim is a 23-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, his father earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.
 
Because he is not able to save enough money, Hazim took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Yolanda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 60 years old and married with four children.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like coffee, bread, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Angeles has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Angeles aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like coffee, bread, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and shampoo.

loans.name: Doeun's Group

texts.en:
Doeun is 63 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are dependent on her. To support her family, she is growing rice, yard-long beans and lettuce. She has been involved in her rice growing business for 45 years. Doeun earns about USD 15 per day and can save about USD 7 each day. Challenges of rice growing are the drop in rice’s price in the market and pests.

Having been with VisionFund for two cycle loans, she is now leading two members to request a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic fertilizer, and organic pesticide and to pay for land preparation cost. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to upgrade the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity to upgrade her standard of living

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
If there's one thing that I would like to happen, that is to see my child someday finish his studies. My heart would leap for joy when that day comes." said Josie.

Josie is married to Cancio, and they live at Batasan, Quezon City. By now, she owns a "sari-sari" (variety) store business where she gets income for their family living.

In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) store sells different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, can goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and other various products which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodity for people.

Being said, Josie wants to request a loan. She wants to have an additional capital for buying more merchandise items. It would be better since it is easier to respond to the customers' demands when there are more items displayed on the store. With this, she needs PHP 10,000.

She really hopes that you would give her this chance.

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise items to sell. .

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
For fourteen years, Gene has been involved in a hog-raising business and she desires to continue the growth of this.

Yours now is the chance to help her, as she lets you know her sincerest request. She would like to acquire financial assistance worth PHP 50,000 that she will utilize in purchasing more pigs for her agriculture business. With sound mind and clear hope, she dreams for her family to succeed someday and make a go of her business. And this dream starts now with you.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: for purchasing more pigs for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent.

She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production.

She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater for tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is a 19-year-old single freshman, he is from Soung Province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers.

Currently, Sopheak is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year, he would like to apply for a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the first to fourth year successfully. For his dreams, Sopheak wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a businessman from Tudela. He is 37 years old, married and has expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family.

Angel is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default.

Now, he applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Angel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Antonio Joel

texts.es:
Antonio, ofrece el servicio de viajes en su camión y además es propietario de una granja de pollos, el negocio lo inicio por motivación propia, trabaja de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, vive con su esposa y no tiene hijos que dependan de él, no representa riesgos para realizar sus actividades.
Con el préstamo comprara 200 pollitos para fortalecer la graja y pagara algunas reparaciones del camión para dar un servicio óptimo, continuara desarrollando sus actividades sin problemas y con todo lo necesario a su alcance, espera que el resultado de la inversión sea positivo.
Los sueños que Antonio tiene son mantener su negocio y tener un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Antonio offers trips on his truck and also owns a chicken farm. He started this business through self-motivation. He works from six in the morning to five in the evening. He lives with his wife and has no children who depend on him or who pose challenges to his jobs.

With this loan, he will buy 200 chicks to bolster his farm and pay for repairs to his truck to provide optimum service. He will continue working without a problem and with the necessary resources within reach. He hopes for positive results to his investment.

Antonio dreams of keeping his business and having a more dignified quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks to bolster his farm and pay for repairs to his truck to provide optimum service.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 40 years old and has four children. Normelita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Normelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Normelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Normelita has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Normelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Norma has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune.

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Melytona

texts.en:
Melytona makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a firewood sales business in Tudela and earns a promising income to support her family.

She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now she availed herself of a loan to buy firewood to resell.

Melytona hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
She is Florence, aged 47, widowed, a member of CCT at Dasmarinas, Cavite. Ever since her husband died she has dedicated her life to raising her three children of which two are already in college and the youngest is a high school student. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge but with her faith in God and perseverance she came out of it victorious.

Florence is able to support their daily needs and her children's education by the income she derives from her catering business. For almost ten years she has established a good name for good food and satisfied service for her catering business. To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 20,000 loan to buy more cooking utensils and ingredients needed for more efficient preparation of her dishes. She thanks Kiva and its lenders for supporting small businessmen like her.

Her aim is that someday she will own a place or her own venue to hold events for her clients. Her valued dream is for all her children to finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cooking utensils and ingredients for her food catering business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and married with four children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is 55 years old and widowed with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Renita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Renita has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 47 years old and has two children. Marcelina is married and has two children who are in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marcelina has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jose Horacio

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo crédito por los beneficios que tiene al invertirlos en su negocio, lo utilizará para comprar abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus cultivos, espera  tener una cosecha abundante.
Su negocio es más rentable, cumple con sus compromisos y está dando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, esto es posible por haber invertido el crédito anterior en sus cultivos de granos básicos.
texts.en:
José decided to get another loan because of the benefits investing it will have for his business. He will use it to buy fertilizer and insecticide to care for his crops. He hopes to have an abundant crop. His business is more profitable.

He fulfills his commitments and gives his family a better quality of life. This is possible because of having invested the previous loan in the in his crop of staple grains.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to care for his crops.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt février 2001. Le groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui ont comme activité le commerce. Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente neuf ans et mère de sept enfants dont deux filles. Elle a cinq années d'expérience. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité des sachets de carrots, des sachets de choux, des tomates, des poissons secs et quarante paires de chaussures. Elle arrive à écouler sa marchandise et elle a de très bon clients. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de la vie de famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 20 February 2001. The group is made up of 20 women who work in commerce.

Mariama, who is on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, of whom two are girls. She has five years of experience [with her work].

With this loan, she plans to buy bags of carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, dried fish, and 40 pairs of shoes.

She manages to sell her stock and she has very good customers. Earnings will serve to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, shoes, and fabric.

loans.name: Biagui 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le deux juin 2009. Ce groupe est composé de huit femmes qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Nicole qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est divorcée, âgée de quarante deux ans sans enfant. Elle s'active dans la vente de la rafraichissement depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle compte avec le montant sollicité acheter de la matière première pour préparer jus et autres. Elle est très expérimentée dans son domaine d'activité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir à ses besoins et soutenir ses parents.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 2 June 2009. The group is made up of eight women who work in commerce.

Nicole, who is the woman standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 42 years old, divorced, and has no children.

Nicole has worked selling refreshments for more than five years. With this loan, she plans to buy the basic ingredients to make juice and other drinks. She is very experienced [with this work].

Earnings will serve to support her needs and those of her parents.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Emelia was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune.

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene has owned and operated a transport service for many years to earn a living. He has to support the needs of his family's daily expenditures.

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle used for the transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecil works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cecil is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy raw material like abaca, silk, etc. for her weaving business.

Cecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw material like abaca, silk, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her bakery business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Dylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Dylen works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Dylen is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, beans, onions, garlic, eggplant, etc.

Dylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, beans, onions, garlic, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Biagui 2 Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été inauguré le deux juin 2009. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 33 ans et mère d'une fille. Elle s'active dans la pâtisserie depuis trois ans. Le prêt sollicité va servir à renforcer son activité. Elle arrive à écouler facilement ses marchandises. les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was inaugurated on 2 June 2009. This group is made up of 20 women who reimburse their loans without difficulties.

Fatou, who is the woman standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter.

Fatou has worked as a baker for three years. This loan will serve to strengthen her business. She is easily able to sell her baked goods. Earnings will serve to help cover her family's expenses and support their needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Kelyn Angelina

texts.es:
Keylin Angelina tiene 20 años de edad,  es soltera   es una  persona muy  responsable y reconocida en esta ciudad  de Trojes por su honrradez y dedicacion al trabajo cuenta con un molino de  maiz  la cual es su fuente principal de ingresos    y  cuenta con muy buena clientela y  experiencia en el manejo del trabajo lo  que le a permitido la captacion de nuevos clientes y asi poder  octener muy buenos ingresos.
 La  Joven. Keylin Angelina esta solicitando el credito para invertir en un nuevo negocio y quiere comprar  equipo para un salon de belleza  y asi poder satisfaser la demanda de sus clientes.
su sueños es poder tener este salon de belleza  y que sea uno de los mas reconocido de la zona.


Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Kelyn Angelina is 20 years old, single, and a very responsible person. She is known in the city of Trojes for her honesty and her dedication to her job. She has a corn grinder, which is her main source of income. She has very good customers and experience managing her business, which has helped her acquire new clients. Because of this, she has a very good income.

This young woman, Kelyn Angelina, is requesting a loan to invest in a new business. She wants to buy equipment for a beauty salon and satisfy her customers' demand.

She dreams of having this beauty salon and for it to become one of the most recognized salons in the area.

Trojes, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Munarkul

texts.ru: Мунаркул, 62 года, вдова, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, сейчас она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи Мунаркул занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, теленок, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кормов на зиму для скота. Доходы от кредита Мунаркул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en:
Munarkul is a 62-year-old widow. She has had two children. She has a secondary education and is now retired, although she is still involved in animal husbandry in order to provide a source of income for her family. Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she now has one dairy cow, one calf, and 20 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income comes up to about 9,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Munarkul has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock feed for the winter. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her number of farm animals. She also wants to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Biagui 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le deux juin 2009. Ce groupe est composé de six femmes qui se soutiennent et remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Félicité qui est à la droite de la photo levant main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 41 ans et mère de deux enfants dont un garçon. Elle s'active dans la vente de fruits, de légumes et du citron depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle compte renforcer son activité avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins des enfants et personnelle.
texts.en: This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on June 2, 2009.  The group consists of six women who help one another and who have been able to repay their loans without any difficulty.  Félicité, the woman raising her hand on the right side of the photo, is the group's representative.  She is 41, single, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl).  She has been selling fruits, vegetables and lemon for over five years.  She now wants to boost her business thanks to this loan.  She will use her profits to meet her needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: to buy lemons and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Edmond Sagna Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt sept décembre 20011. Ce groupe est constitué de cinq femmes qui remboursent leurs crédits sans difficulté. Madame Cornélia qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de cinquante neuf ans et mère quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans l'aviculture depuis plusieurs années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle va acheter deux cent poussins, des aliments et des vaccins. Son activité marche très fort car elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de la famille et à épargner.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was inaugurated on 27th December 2011. This group is made up of five women who repay their loans without any difficulty.

Cornélia, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 59 years old and mother to four boys. She has been a poultry farmer for several years, and with the loan she has requested, she is going to buy 200 chicks, food and vaccines. Her business is going very well because she is not able to satisfy customer demand.

The profits she makes will be used to take care of her family and to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy chicks, food and vaccines.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en: Emalyn has switched from selling processed meat to a food vending business. Her business is doing well, and she doubles her time perfecting her own recipe of various food products. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. She has availed another loan from PMPC to purchase ingredients for food vending such as flour, meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food vending such as flour, meat, fish, vegetables, condiments, and confectioneries.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita works hard to support her family. Florita is single with six children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Florita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Florita has been in this business for 6 years now and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Florita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en:
Tieng, 45, is a local farmer living in Preah Vihear province and a mother of four children. Nowadays, she needs to support her two dependent children, one of whom is in school, the other studying in university. To offset her family’s hardship, she has grown rice, soybean, and cassava as her main sources of income. She also gets extra income by raising cows and pigs.

She has been involved with her businesses for three years. With her current businesses she can earn about 6 USD per day, but can only save 1 USD from her daily income.

For Tieng, this is her first time with VisionFund to seeking for this loan. She will use her loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Accounting.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Almamie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Almamie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell purchase order cards business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Almamie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

Almamie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanitriniaina Marie Véronique

texts.fr:
Mariée, Véronique a 26 ans. Elle vit en concubinage avec un mécanicien. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé  dans une école privée. Son rêve est de pouvoir offrir une vie meilleure à son enfant: vie meilleure par rapport à ce qu’elle a enduré.
Véronique a commencé son activité depuis l’arrêt de ses études ( à 18 ans). Elle dispose 8 années d’expériences dans la vente de légumes. Elle connaît bien les besoins des clients. Depuis son enfance, elle a toujours accompagné sa mère qui exerce la même activité d’où l’idée de créer sa propre unité. Chaque jour, elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes auprès de la capitale pour revendre les produits dans le quartier où elle habite.
Le prêt sert à acheter des produits locaux (produits séchés tels que haricot  )  et des fruits et légumes (tomate, choux, pomme de terre, gingembre, oignon, haricot vert, ail), l’objectif étant de diversifier la gamme des produits vendus.
texts.en:
Véronique is 26 years old and married. She lives with a mechanic and the couple has one child who goes to a private school. Her dream is to be able to give to her child a better life than she has had. Véronique began her business after she finished school (at 18 years old). She has eight years' experience of selling vegetables and understands her customers' needs well. She accompanied her mother, who carried out the same business, from her childhood, and this gave her the idea to set up her own business.

Every day she gets her supplies from wholesalers near the capital and resells her goods in the district where she lives. Her loan will be used to buy local produce (dried products such as beans) as well as fresh fruit and vegetables (tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, ginger, onions, green beans, garlic), the aim being to diversify her range of products.

loans.use: to buy dried and fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en: Emalyn has always enjoyed farming. She has cultivated their vegetable fields in Tudela, Misamis Occidental and has produced good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers. This will ensure that the vegetable field will give more harvest. Emalyn knows that she has to get things right to produce more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Edmond Group

texts.fr: Le ban villageois a été inauguré le vingt sept décembre 2011. Ce groupe est constitué de vingt et une femmes qui remboursent leurs prêts sans difficulté. Madame Marie A J M qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de soixante un ans et mère de deux enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans la confection de draps, de nappes et d'habits depuis deux ans. Elle va acheter des rouleaux de tissus avec le prêt sollicité. Elle n'a pas de concurrent. Les bénéfices vont servir à renforcer ses épargnes, son fonds de roulement et à se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was inaugurated on 27th December 2011 and this group is made up of 21 women who repay their loans without any difficulty.

Marie AJM, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is single, 61 years old and mother to two children, one of whom is a girl. She has had an activity making up sheets, tablecloths and clothing for the past two years. She is going to buy rolls of fabric with the loan she has requested. She has no competitors.

The profits she makes will be used to build up her savings and working capital and to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school equipment: exercise books, pencils, rulers, envelopes, cardboard folders, etc...

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bassine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 29 décembre 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
MARIAMA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 3 garçons et une fille. Elle s'active dans l'embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte acheter 3 moutons  mais aussi un bœuf. Elle achète les 3 moutons  à 125 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi un bœuf à 200 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi de l'aliment de bétail pour 57 500 FCFA. Elle supporte enfin des frais de vétérinaires qui s’élèvent à 20 000 FCFA. Le reste constitue son fond de roulement.  Après élevage, elle revend les moutons l'unité à 175 000 FCFA et le bœuf à 300 000 FCFA. 
les bénéfices vont lui permettre d’épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi acquérir d'autres moutons pour les mettre dans son troupeau.
texts.en:
This group of three members belongs to the Banc Villageois which was created on 29th December 2010. It is made up of women from the same village and surrounding areas, who get on well together and are very supportive of one another. They are mainly active in small trading businesses or raising animals.

Mariama, who is standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the star borrower of the group. She is married, 35 years old and mother to three boys and a girl. She raises animals and with the loan she receives, she is planning to buy three sheep and a bull. The three sheep will cost 125,000FCFA and the bull 200,000FCFA. She is also buying food for her livestock to a value of 57,500FCFA and finally will pay 20,000FCFA for vetinerary expenses. The balance of the loan will constitute her working capital. Once she resells the sheep (at 175,000FCFA) and the bull (300,000FCFA), the profits she makes will enable her to build up her savings at the Banc Villageois and also acquire other sheep for her flock.

loans.use: to buy three sheep and a bull.

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie is 29 years old, married, and has two children who are both enrolled in school.

Novie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Novie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Novie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 50 years old and married.

Jesusa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jesusa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like coffee, bread, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Jesusa has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jesusa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like coffee, bread, drinks, spices, milk, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 90 years old, a widow with two adult children.

She has been a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC for seven years and is actively participating in every activity the cooperative offers to members despite her age.

Recently, she availed a loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 43, married and living in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports her family.

She never gets tired of tending her store. Elvie is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default.

Now she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza never gets tired of attending her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Gusa, Calatunana, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte for she owns the only store in their place.

She's making good sales on her business that sufficiently support the needs of her family.

In need of additional capital to restock the sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others, Liza asks a loan from Paglaum MPC where she is an active member.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods like noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confectioneries, condiments and others.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is deeply grateful to Kiva, CCT and its lenders for their kind hearts in lending her funds several times in the past. This helped sustain and grow her store, and it has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business. She is forever thankful for the help for small business people like her.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, bread, eggs, etc., which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income to sustain her family's basic needs and send her child to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to bless her efforts with success. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and personal products to sell.

loans.name: Joverlyn

texts.en:
Joverlyn is 31 years old and married. She has three children.

Joverlyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Joverlyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old, married, and has school-age children.

She dreams of finishing the construction of their dream house, which she and her husband laboriously built while their children were still young.

Rosemarie is an active member of Paglaum MPC, where she avails her financial needs. Recently, she borrowed an amount of PHP 5,000 to buy bags of cement and sand for finishing the house. She wishes to continuously maintain her membership in good standing for she can always turn to it whenever she needs financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement and sand for finishing her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and she industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Gloria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gloria dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 48 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Geronima is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and she industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock.

Gemma requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Gemma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Merly Jose

texts.es:
El señor  Merly José de 34  años de edad es casado y  vive con su esposa  en  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de granos básicos, electrodomésticos, motocicletas, etc. en su aldea  lo reconocen por ser  trabajador y amable, que tiene una buena relaciones con sus vecinos  y amistades y demás personas de su comunidades.
Don Merly José es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de superarse y mejorar su condición de vida. Está solicitando el préstamo para, ya que este es su fuerte,  espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Es un cliente honesto con deseos de trabajar con Prisma,  su sueño es crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y también comprarse un carro para poder repartir su producto y poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  2015
texts.en:
Merly José is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife in their own house. He has worked for 10 years selling basic grains, household appliances, motorcycles, etc. In his village, he is known as being hard-working and friendly, and having good relationships with his neighbors and friends and other people in his community.

Merly José is an enterprising man with desire to improve himself and improve his living condition. He is asking for the loan to purchase basic grains such as corn and beans, since this is his strength. He expects that this investment will allow him to get ahead with his business. He is an honest client with desire to work with Prisma, his dream is to grow with his business and improve his quality of life and also purchase a car to be able to distribute his products and to be able to provide good customer service.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to purchase more basic grains, such as corn and beans, for his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young man from Khan younis Gaza strip. He works in the public sector also he decided to open a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin. As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk and deliver them to his customers by using his rickshaw. Mohammad’s loan will enable him to buy a rickshaw to distribute the goods , and eventually increase the size of his business and his income.

Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)
Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw to distribute goods .

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 29 years old and married. She has four children who are all currently in school. Ana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, cereals, juice, milk, canned goods, etc.

Ana Marie requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like seasonings, cereals, juice, milk, canned goods, etc. to sell.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like seasonings, cereals, juice, milk, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce, 25 lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a married, hard working man charged with the task of providing basic needs for his 2 children and only one attends school. He deals in produce, majorly buying and selling rice, beans and maize. In order to supplement his income, he carries out farming, particularly growing cassava and beans on a small scale.

He is the kind of a man who desires to expand and develop his business the more, only to be challenged by price fluctuations and bad weather changes, that make transportation of his products difficult. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sale.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 40 years old. He is married and lives in Borjomi district with his wife, pensioner mother and sister. Mikheil is unemployed and his wife works at local pharmacy and gets a small monthly salary.

Mikheil decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2900 GEL.

With the received credit, he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. He will serve people as a taxi driver and will generate daily income.
Mikhel awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a youth man live in Khan younis Gaza strip, where he also works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of high cost of living, a few years ago, he decided to open a business to transport goods and inventory between traders using his rickshaw.

Amer bought a new rickshaw and become well known and has loyal customers. Now Amer took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Amer can work more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.

loans.use: to carry out some maintenance on his rickshaw,.

loans.name: Los Sacuces Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “LOS SAUCES” una de ellas es La Sra.
