Miriam de  35 años de edad soltera y con 2 hijos. La Sra. Miriam  tiene  como  negocio una pequeña bodega (venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, etc.) en su propia casa ya hace 8 años. La Sra. Miriam ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio para  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería para su bodega y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. A la vez  la Sra. Miriam  y todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidas   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado. La Sra. Miriam es la tercera del lado izquierdo, es  la única que viste con una casaca de color plomo. Ella se despide  dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
A group made up of 7 enterprising women with a lot of creativity for business, these are the members of the Los Sauces communal group. One of them is Miriam, 35 years old. She is single with 2 children. Miriam has had as a business a small store (selling food products such as rice, sugar, etc.) in her own house for 8 years. Miriam has managed to get loyal customers, which has generated earnings to be able to cover the household expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business more to get more earnings. With the granted loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store and, so, continue satisfying her customers' needs.

Miriam and all the members of the group are also grateful to Kiva for the granted loan and for the confidence offered to them. Miria is the third from the left, she is the only one wearing a grey jacket. She bids farewell, leaving the promise that she will achieve all her established goals.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise (rice, sugar, oil, etc.).

loans.name: Carol Vania

texts.es:
Carol es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año y su negocio es la venta de frapuchino.
Ella es buena madre, autosuficiente y muy honesta. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘equipetrol’ un barrio residencial de primera clase donde el idioma inglés se habla con normalidad y el comercio es lujoso.
Carol es morena, de cabello negro y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza con su hijo que está aprendiendo a caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de frapuchino, esta bebida es una mezcla entre jugo y helado que se sirve frio y es muy popular por el calor que hace en el lugar, “trabajo en esta esquina porque aquí pasa mucha gente y las ventas son buenas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de un refrigerador para congelar su bebida. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta propio, ella desea comprar una congeladora para congelar sus jugos y bebidas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carol solicita un préstamo para comprar una congeladora para congelar frapuchino.
texts.en:
Carol is a 25-year-old woman, single, who has a 1-year-old son and her business is the sale of frapuchino.

She is a good mother, self-sufficient, and very honest. Her business is located in the Equipetrol neighborhood, a first class residential neighborhood, where the English language is frequently spoken and business is luxurious.

Carol has dark skin, black hair and is short. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She has her life with her son who is learning to walk, they live in a rented room built of brick which has all the basic services. Her business is selling frapuchino, this drink is a mix of juice and ice cream which is served cold and is very popular due to the heat in this place. "I work on this corner because many people pass by and the sales are good..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of a refrigerator to freeze her drink. Her dream is to have her own sales stand, she wants to purchase a freezer to freeze her juices and drinks. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years she has done this work.

For these reasons, Carol asks for a loan to purchase a freezer to freeze frapuchino.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to freeze frapuchino.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn became a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) back year 2012. Counting three years now, she experienced ups and downs with her direct-selling business. But through the guidance and mentoring of CCT, she remained still and optimistic about the future of her industry.

In her direct-selling business, she sells various personal products like lotions, soaps, powder, etc. Cost vary from product to product. Her income in this trade gives her enough amount to help her husband in providing for their family necessities. Her husband, Albert (37) is currently working as security guard and they have two children.

Merilyn comes to you today for a reason. She would like to borrow an amount of PHP 15,000 that she would use to buy more direct-selling products.

She hopes that you'd help her reach her dream of growing and expanding her business.

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more direct-selling products.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man, with 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will save the anticipated profits .

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap,sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with four  children three of whom attend school.She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly has electricity is food. 

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen has been involved in auto repairing works in Kapan town of Syunik region. In the rented garage, Gurgen has been renovating different types of cars and gathers income for his family's living. Gurgen is 56, father of two grown up children.

Gurgen needs this loan to purchase tools he needs for his work. He plans to use the loan in purchasing a gas compressor, cover the costs of technical repair of his car and tools for auto repairing works (grinding machine). This investment is important for Gurgen's business to function well and he greatly hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for gas compressor, costs of technical repair of his car and tools for auto repairing works (grinding machine)

loans.name: Spring Group

texts.en:
The termination of an employment contract can mean many different things to different people. Some can see it as the end of the world, while some as an opportunity to open new doors. Privilege is one such lady who decided not to despair at the closure of one door but saw it as an opportunity for the opening of new and better doors.

In an ever worsening economy, Privilege decided to be her own boss instead of seeking another employment contract. In October 2014 she attended a detergent manufacturing class where she learnt how to produce washing up liquid, toilet cleaners and other household cleaning agents.

Privilege is a 33 year old wife and mother residing in Waterfalls, Harare. She came to Thrive Microfinance along with her group members and introduced themselves as Spring group. Spring group consists of 6 members of which Privilege is the youngest. She started her business in November 2014 with just two 20 litre buckets, using savings she was availed by her husband. She sells detergents from home and walks around the neighbourhood and to her fellow church mates. Her business has been steadily growing and she now sells a minimum of five by twenty litres of the house-hold cleaning agents.

With her husband also self employed and not having fixed employment providing constant income levels, Privilege has to chip in to meet the family’s needs. For her to do this, she needs to increase her income levels, meaning that she has to increase her production levels. It is that realisation that led her to seek a loan from Thrive Microfinance.

Privilege feels that the training on record keeping that she got from Thrive is helping her keep track cash movements in her business. With her loan she is planning to produce more products and properly brand her cleaning agents so as to make them more competitive in the market. In future she would like to have a company that produces the cleaning agents and also provide cleaning services to companies.

loans.use: to produce more detergents and properly brand her cleaning agents, so as to make them more competitive in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yellow mottled fish, sardines, and other fish to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 64 years old and married with two children. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods and etc.

Aida has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Aura Orfilia

texts.es: Aura es una microempresaria domiciliada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla con cercanía al mar y en esta localidad emprendió su almacén misceláneo en el que ofrece a los habitantes del sector una gran variedad de productos de papelería, fragancias, accesorios, insumos de modistería, productos de belleza y detalles para toda ocasión. Ella es una apasionada por las ventas y lleva en su negocio siete años, compartiendo los roles de madre, cónyuge y empresaria, un mix que le brinda bienestar y felicidad. Ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir y juguetería con la que promoverá ventas para la temporada de fin de año, en la que estos productos son de elevada demanda.  Aura tiene metas muy claras para su negocio y una de ellas es comprar el local donde funciona para obtener mejores ingresos, así mismo para su vida desea tener mejores condiciones de habitabilidad en su vivienda y trabaja para realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aura is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla, near the sea, and in this place she established her variety store in which she offers the people in the area a great variety of products such as paper goods, fragrances, accessories, sewing supplies, beauty products and decorations for all occasions. She is passionate about sales and has had her business for seven years, sharing the roles of mother, spouse, and businesswoman, a mix that brings her well-being and happiness. She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through
Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase clothing and toys with which she will promote sales for the end-of-the-year season, when these products are in higher demand. Aura has very clear goals for her business and one of them is to purchase a retail space for her sales to get more income. She also, for her life, wants to have better living conditions in her house and to work to make upgrades to her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and toys.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro vive con su esposa de 40 años de edad y sus hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad, todos trabajan para salir adelante, don Pedro se dedica a dar el servicio de sastre, elabora prendas como pantalones, camisas, faldas, entre otros, también a cultiva maíz.
Comprará telas, zippers, botones, hilos, etc., su propósito es tener un buen inventario en la sastrería, otra parte le será de ayuda para adquirir insumos agrícolas así el cultivo de maíz tendrá un buen desarrollo y su cosecha será abundante.
Él desea tener un negocio más amplio y generar mejores ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos a que se superen.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his 40-year-old wife and their children, ages 20 and 15. They all work to get ahead. Pedro works providing tailoring services, he makes clothing such as pants, shirts, skirts, and more, and also grows corn.

He will purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, etc. His goal is to have a good inventory in his tailoring shop, and another part will be a help to get agricultural supplies so that the corn crop will develop well and the harvest will be abundant.

He wants to have a larger business and generate more income to support his children so they improve themselves.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, etc., his goal is to have a good tailoring inventory.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Living in Prey Veng province, Pov is a 47 year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is dependent and in school. Pov, along with her husband, grows rice to earn the main source of income and sometimes works for others for a fee in order to better meet family’s needs. She has been involved in farming business for 29 years already. Around USD9 is earned every single day and Pov can save approximately around USD3 per day for future needs.
Lack of water to apply in farmland and pests are challenges to her rice farming business.

She has been with VisionFund for a cycle loan already and it has helped her support family’s needs and send her children to school. With this loan, Pov will use it to pay for school fees for her daughter and buy a laptop to assist in her studying. She hopes that she can pay school fees on time and her daughter can get good paid job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her daughter and buy a laptop to assist in her studying.

location.town: Prey Veng province, Bar Phnom district

loans.name: Maftunahon

texts.ru: Мафтунахон общительная и гостеприимная девушка из городка Исфара. Народ Исфары славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства. Мафтунахон замужем и имеет 3 и 1 летного ребенка. Ее муж занимается сварщиком. Он производить печь из металла путем сварки. Мафтунахон дома занимается шитьем женской национальной одежды. Она 7 лет продвигает свою любимую дело. Мафтунахон хочет создать хорошие условия для жизни семьи. На часть заемных денег она намерена приобрети стройматериалы для ремонта дома. Мафтунахон хочет жить комфортно и уютно. Она верит, что ей не откажут в кредите и заранее выражает благодарность.
texts.en: Maftunahon is a sociable and hospitable young woman from the city of Isfara. The people of Isfara is known for its incomparable style of hospitality. Maftunahon is married and has three-year-old and one-year-old children. Her husband is a welder. He makes ovens from metal by welding. Maftunahon sews women's national clothing at home. She has been doing her favorite work for seven years. Maftunahon wants to create good living conditions for her family. She intends to buy construction materials to renovate her house with part of the funds. Maftunahon wants to live comfortably and cosily. She believes that she will not be refused a loan and expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a young man from Khan younis Gaza strip. He has a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin.  As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk and deliver them to his customers using his personal rickshaw.  Mohammad’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory and goods to resell and eventually increase the size of his business and his income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and goods to resell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has been running her convenience store for almost 20 years. She started from a small store with an initial capital of 1,500 PHP that she had on hand after her wedding. Lilian invested that little amount into buying consumer goods that are commonly used in a simple household and rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she expanded her business and added on more products such as liquor and cigarettes, deodorants, over-the-counter medicines, and even rice and corn grains and animal feed. Lilian recalls that her dreams of being the boss of her own business had come true. However, she said that this was made possible by the assistance of Paglaum MPC, that has nurtured her for a long time. 

Lilian is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan from Paglaum MPC to buy construction materials to complete the construction of her house. She has always wanted to live in a decent house that is fully finished.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete her house

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Analyn has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed eight previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Analyn is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joyce works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.

Joyce is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkıs married with 2 children who both have mental and physical disabilities. She runs a hairdressing salon. With her first loan, she made a bulk purchase of supplies and increased her profit.

Because carrying her daughter is very hard, she moved her store. She continues to serve her customers there. With this second loan, she will buy more supplies at cheap prices. This would help her because the winter is usually a quiet season and she will have her supplies


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Belkıs Hanım evli biri zihinsel ve fiziksel özürlü iki çocuğu var. Kuaför dükkanı işletiyor. İlk kredisi ile toplu malzeme alıp karını arttırdı. Kızını ikinci kata taşımak zor olduğundan dükkanının yerini değiştirerek müşterilerine burada hizmet vermeye devam ediyor. ikinci kredisi ile tekrardan toplu kuaför malzemesi alacak. Kış sezonu biraz sakin geçse bile elinde toplu malzemesi olacak. Çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılmak. Oğlunu okutmak tek isteği.

loans.use: to buy haidressing materials wholesale

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from Bambakashat village, where he lives with his parents, wife and two kids, ages 6 and 4 years.
Ashot chosen to earn living for his family with agribusiness. He cultivates cucumber, okra and greens. Ashot, near the house where he lives with his family, owns a grape orchard and cultivates plum and cherry trees as well. Besides selling the harvest in the market and getting income, Ashot has other source of income as well. In the cellar of his house, for already 6 years, Ashot is also involved in canned food production.

Hard and devoted work, helps Ashot to have a successful business and provide appropriate living conditions for his family. This loan is very important for Ashot to invest in the farm and sustain it. He plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, wires for his grape orchard and also hire workers to reconstruct the orchard , so Ashot's farm will continue functioning well and providing income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, wires for his grape orchard and hire workers to reconstruct the orchard .

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es:
William vive junto a su esposa e hijos, él tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, no tiene apoyo económico de sus parientes, su negocio consiste en vender mariscos, con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, lo desarrolla desde hace seis años.
Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar pescado, moluscos y camarones, podrá orecer mercadería variada y fresca a sus clientes, considera que dará un mejor servicio y sus ventas incrementaran.
La visión de William es comprar un coche para mejorar el negocio y tener recursos  para hacerle reparaciones importantes a su vivienda.
texts.en:
William lives with his wife and children. He has the responsibility of covering the expenses of his home. He receives no economic support from his parents. His business is selling seafood, with a schedule from seven in the morning until four in the afternoon. He started it six years ago.

He is seeking a loan to buy fish, mollusks and shrimp, in order to be able to offer varied and fresh merchandise to his customers. He believes that he will provide a better service and his sales will increase. William's dream is to buy a car to improve his business, and to have the resources to make important repairs to his house.

loans.use: to buy fish, mollusks and shrimp, in order to be able to offer varied and fresh merchandise to his customers.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a fish vendor. She sells fish together with her husband riding on a motorcycle in some rural areas of Baybay, Leyte. They sell from their catch and they also buy more fish from the other fisherman to enhance their sales. Thus, Luciana is requesting a loan to buy additional fish.

She will also use the money to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. As aside from selling fish, she also sells food to the community. Luciana works hard to sustain their day-to day expenses and to be able to provide the needs of their three school aged children. Additionally, she wanted to improve her business and their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila started her small business and became a boss when she opened her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls her capital into more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since she is the only store in the district.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for some much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities.

In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia wants to increase her sales.

Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to buy soda, liquor, cigars, canned goods, condiments and other consumable goods to sell, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy soda, liquor, cigars, canned goods, condiments and other consumable goods for retail.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and is married with three children who are in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Analyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analyn is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam de 43 años es una emprendedora ama de casa que quiso tener un nuevo estilo de vida y consideró que con el comerció saldría de la rutina y podría generar ingresos para su familia puesto que enviudó y es madre de dos hijos. Una amiga que estaba incorporada a las ventas por catálogos le habló de los múltiplex beneficios que lograría mediante esta masiva forma de comercio, Myriam aceptó con mucha expectativa y hasta el momento cuenta con nueve años de experiencia en los que ha obtenido gratificantes resultados. También comercializa calzado para dama y caballero generándole un ingreso adicional.  Ella reside en un barrio de Barranquilla en donde se consolida su clientela conformada por vecinos y recomendados, a quienes promueve ventas mediante visitas que realiza en los horarios comprendidos entre 8 a.m. a 8 p.m.  Con el capital que maneja actualmente no puede responder a todos los requerimientos de sus clientes, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en splash, cremas corporales, fragancias, cosméticos, productos capilares y calzado. Su meta a futuro es aperturar un local y comprar su vivienda.
texts.en: Myriam, 43 years old, is an enterprising homemaker who wanted to have a new lifestyle and thought that with sales she would get out of the routine and be able to generate income for her family, since she is a widow and is the mother of two children. A friend who was involved in sales through catalogs, spoke to her about the multiple benefits that she would get through this massive form of sales. Myriam accepted with a lot of expectations and up to now has nine years of experience in which she has gotten gratifying results. She also sells women's and men's shoes generating additional income. She lives in a neighborhood in Barranquilla where she strengthened a customer base made up of neighbors and people recommended to her, to whom she promotes sales through visits which she does between 8 am and 8 pm. With the capital that she has currently, she is not able to respond to all her customers' needs, so she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing that she is getting through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in splash, body creams, fragrances, cosmetics, hair products and shoes. Her goal for the future is to open a retail space and purchase a house.

loans.use: to invest in splash, body creams, fragrances, cosmetics, hair products, and shoes.

loans.name: Theab

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Theab is 40 years old and a mother with seven children, four of whom are in school. She can earn income to support her living conditions via rice cropping and working as a laborer for others to get more income. She has been with her business for 22 years and she can save from the daily income about 5USD per day. Because of the insects has destroyed her rice, she did not get good yield from her farm.

She is seeking for her first loan with VisionFund to buy more fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce a good yield. She hopes that her crop grows well and earns her more income to upgrade her living conditions and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An, 35 years old, is an ethnic Kinh. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the basic living expense of the family and to save a small amount.

She intends to expand her breeding program by raising more chickens but she does not have enough money to invest in getting it started. Therefore, she wants use her portion of the loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding program with high productivity. Then, when she sells the coming chicken herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in a chicken breeding program.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 42-year-old divorced mother of one child, who has been running her clothes selling business for nine months to make sure she can support her daughter after her divorce.
Hanan is working hard to be the caring mother. She is putting so much effort to develop her newly established business.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase special autumn and winter clothes from a newly released collection, since her current acquired business income is barely covering her small family's living needs.

loans.use: to purchase special autumn and winter clothes which are newly released.

loans.name: Muaaz

texts.en:
Muaaz is a 28-year-old, single man from Tubas, Nablus City, west bank, which is beautiful place. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Muaaz has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the the store need many goods and inventory. Muaaz took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy goods and inventory for the store . He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand the store.

loans.use: to buy goods and inventory for his store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane runs a convenience store and agricultural farm in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She was faced hard times when calamities stuck their farm and they suffered great loss. To be able to get back on her feet, she decided to pawn her cocoland to finance her fruits and vegetables production.

In 2012, Mary Jane sign up for membership of Paglaum MPC and learns on various services it offers to members like her. With her desire to redeem her pawned land that she asks from the coop for a loan of PHP 40,000.00.

loans.use: to redeem land she was forced to pawn.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Doña Silvia se dedica a la ganadería. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de novillas que le permitan aumentar su hato lechero para poder incrementar la producción de su finca. De esta manera logrará aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Silvia works in livestock.  She seeks a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000), to buy heifers that will allow her to increase her dairy herd in order to boost the production of her farm.  In this manner she will increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase dry chilies such as pasilla, guajillo, etc.

loans.name: Lyvaline

texts.en:
Lyvaline is a 43-year-old, married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lyvaline has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

Lyvaline has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 31 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Cerila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cerila requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cerila has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cerila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
Oscar opta por un nuevo crédito por la experiencia satisfactoria que tiene al invertirlos en su negocio, lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que eliminará la maleza y protegerá sus cultivos de granos básicos.
Los créditos le son de utilidad para mantenerse trabajando en la agricultura, satisfacer a sus clientes y generar más ingresos, su grupo familiar se mantiene y no ha tenido dificultades de salud.
texts.en:
Oscar opted for a new loan based on the satisfactory experience he has investing in his business. He will use it to buy agricultural supplies with which he will eradicate weeds and protect his crops of staple grains.

The loans are helpful in allowing him to continue working in agriculture, to satisfy his customers and to generate more income. He supports his family group and has had no health issues.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies with which to eradicate weeds and to protect his crops of staple grains.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo e hijos los cuales son menores de edad, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, sus ingresos le permiten aportar en los gastos familiares, no tiene ayuda de remesas.
Con la finalidad de mejorar la productividad de su negocio, solicita un crédito para comprar maíz y leña, tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas, espera satisfacer las demandas que hacen sus clientes, asimismo aumentar las ventas y ganancias para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando para resarcir su deuda y ser un ejemplo para que sus hijos sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ana has as her business the sale of tortillas. She lives with her husband and children who are minors. She has 10 years of experience, her income permits her to support the family expenses, she doesn't have any help from remittances.

With the end of improving the productivity of her business, she asks for a loan to purchase corn and firewood. She will have the raw material to make and sell tortillas and expects to satisfy her customers' demand, and also to increase her sales and earnings to reduce the household needs.

Her aspirations are to continue working to pay off her debt and to be an example so that her children are good people in society.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to have raw materials to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Flor Evangelina

texts.es:
Flor, tiene 25 años de edad, ya ha formado su familia, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo, de 28 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza, oficio que aprendió de su madre, lo hace de manera independiente desde hace 4 años y trabaja todos los días.
Con el crédito comprara cosméticos, lociones, cremas corporales, etc., tendrá más productos para continuar trabajando, tiene como objetivo atender mucho mejor a sus clientes y seguir siendo un apoyo para disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
Su visión es tener un negocio con bases fuertes para seguir progresando y darle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Flor is 25 years old, and has already formed a family. She lives with her life partner and a son, 28 and 2 years old, respectively. She works selling beauty products, a trade that she learned from her mother, and she has done it independently for 4 years and she works every day.

With the loan, she will purchase cosmetics, lotions, body creams, etc. She will have more products to continue working, she has as her goal to serve her customers much better and to continue being a support to reduce her family's needs.

Her vision is to have a business with strong foundations to continue progressing and give her son a better future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, lotions, body creams, etc.; she will have more products to continue working.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 21 years old; he lives in small village near Hebron City west bank with his small family. Three years ago he started trading in poultry. It’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

He applied for this youth loan to buy different kinds of poultry per customer requests and food for them, which will increase his income, helping him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

Musa is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of poultry per customer requests,

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Nanay "Evangeline" has four children with Juliano, a company worker. Two years in the business line, they were able to explore and learn a lot of life lessons. And even until now, they still bring these lessons with them. 

They live at Las Pinas City, Metro Manila. Here, they sell different kinds of dried foods like fishes and eggs. In a month, they can approximately earn Php. 51,600 from their resources. Of course, this is all fruits of their everyday sacrifice and effort. However, they experience peak of demand not at all times. Income varies from time to time most especially when wet season comes in the Philippines or customers credit and don't pay at times. 

But never she considers quitting her business. This is a great aid for their family and this provides most of their necessities. So, she wants to further enhance this through requesting a loan from you. With borrowing a Php 30,000, she can supply her store with enough dried foods to sell. 

You can help her grow her business by rendering just a small amount now. Small acts could always make a difference.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to supply her store with enough dried foods to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely runs and operates a motorcycle transport business in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte with her husband as one of the drivers. She is making a good income with it everyday that makes her contribute to run their households.

This time that she needs money to buy spare parts and pay labor cost for motorcycle repair and maintenance so she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay labor costs for motorcycle repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
A lot more awaits Herminia as she has started improving her direct selling business lately through your granted loan. Because of your wide and helping hands, Herminia was able to increase profit from her enterprise and thus engaging her family to have a little better daily living condition than usual. 

She wants to continue the race, and so she is asking for a loan worth PHP 10 000 that she would surely use to purchase more quantity of direct-selling products like cosmetics and other personal product sales. This can be a good opportunity for her as she tries to explore different avenues towards success. By now, she just prays that your unwavering support for her won't vanish. 

With a vision in mind to strive her children to finish schooling, she does everything she can to support them all the way. To a woman who is determined to win, nothing is a failure, but a delayed success. 

She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional products to sell like detergent soaps, powders, lotions, and other similar products.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier, 69, is a hard working married man, charged with the responsibility of taking care of 9 children and all of them attend school in Hoima Uganda. He carries out farming, predominantly growing maize, rice and cassava. In turn he also rears goats for additional income.

He ventured into business in 1998 after realizing a need to generate enough income to support his family. He is optimistic of expanding his business so as to satisfy the growing demands of his customers. He is challenged by inadequate capital and also bad debtors who do not pay him on time. He is seeking for loan facility to set up a new maize plantation.

loans.use: to set up a new maize plantation.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, a 63-year-old farmer from Kampong Cham province, is widowed and has two dependent children.

To make a living, she is growing cash crops such as rice, cucumber and kidney beans. She also sells grocery items to earn additional income. Dropping prices for rice is the main challenge to her business.

This is her second loan with VisionFund. Her past loan helped her buy a variety of grocery items to attract customer.

As the leader a group consisting of two members, Neang is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and more grocery items to make greater sales. She hopes she is able to expand her rice growing business and improve the standard of living for family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and to buy more grocery items to replenish the store.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik, 55, lives in Norashen village of Ararat region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little grandson. From 10 years, Manik has been involved in the farming business. Her farm includes different types of fruit trees and she sells the gathered harvest in nearby markets.
Manik's other source of income comes from making fruit boxes and selling them.

Her family members help her a lot with the business. By applying for this loan, Manik would like to develop her farming business. She plans to purchase two oxen and also grapes to freeze in the refrigerator and sell in the winter, so her family will earn income for improving the quality of their life.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and grapes to freeze in the refrigerator and sell in the winter, so her family will earn income for improving the quality of their life .

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung, 26 years old, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and tp save a small amount. She wants to invest in raising ducks but their savings is not enough. Therefore, she wants to use her portion of the loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and when selling the ducks, and will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in raising ducks

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Emilda has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from selling native mats and a general store.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Daniela Paola

texts.es: Daniela es una universitaria de 18 años que aprovecho el gran número de conocidos y compañeros de estudio para emprender su propio negocio, ella comercializa prendas de vestir, calzado y productos de belleza, los cuales exhibe directamente y también los promociona a través de redes sociales.  Sus compras las realiza a almacenes del centro de la ciudad y también está incorporada a catálogos especializados en productos de belleza. Esta emprendedora joven reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y cuenta con un año ejerciendo esta labor con la que ha logrado costearse parte de sus estudios y desea continuar mucho más consolidada en esta actividad comercial es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar nuevas colecciones de prendas de vestir y calzado, con la finalidad de aprovechar el alza en la demanda del último trimestre del año. Su meta es terminar sus estudios y continuar con el comercio de productos, ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Daniela is an 18 year old university student, who took advantage of her large number of friends and schoolmates to begin her own business. She sells clothing, shoes and beauty products, which she exhibits in person and promotes through social networking. She makes her purchases at warehouses in the city. She is also involved in specialized catalogs of beauty products. This young entrepreneur lives in a neighborhood south of Barranquilla, and has one year working at this job, with which she has managed to pay part of her school expenses.

She wants to continue her business in a much more established manner. That is why she seeks a kiva credit, her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy new collections of clothing items and shoes, with the goal of taking advantage of the jump in demand in the last trimester of the year. Her goal is to finish her studies and continue in the sale of products, clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy new collections of clothing items and shoes.

loans.name: Ayfer

texts.en:
Ayfer has been living with her son. After she lost her husband, she started to continue his business and runs a public washroom in the city center.

She also keeps producing handicrafts since her youth. In the evenings, she makes handicrafts to order and to increase her income. With this second loan, she will buy wool at a good price because she will make a bulk purchase. By this means, her profit will double. Her dream is to make more money to buy a house.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ayfer Hanım eşi vefat etmiş. Evli bir oğlu var onunla birlik de yaşıyor. Eşi vefat ettik den sonra eşinin işinin başına geçmiş. (şehir merkezinde umumi tuvalet işletiyor.) Fakat gençliğinden beri yaptığı el işi işlerini de devam ediyor. Akşamları dışarıya sipariş aldığı el işlerini yapıyor. Böylelikle ek gelirinin devam ettiğini söylüyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile yün alacak. Toplu alımlarda daha uygun fiyata aldığından karı da iki katı oluyor. Hayali daha çok kazanıp bir ev almak.

loans.use: to buy wool to produce handicrafted items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a government employee assigned as the municipal social welfare officer. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juliano

texts.en: Juliano is making good income from cassava farming. He supplies cassava in the local community and the neighboring towns and municipalities. Through this activity, he is able to feed his family and send his children to school. In need of additional bags of fertilizer, he asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in an amount of PHP 10,500.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, milk, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap,sugar, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Maternidad works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell purified water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maternidad is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more gallons of purified water to sell to her customers.

Maternidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of purified water to sell to her customers

loans.name: Morex

texts.en:
Morex is a 28-year-old woman living with her one child in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a vendor in markets, selling fresh foods, and she earns additional income from growing and selling cocoa. 

Morex is very hardworking but lacks enough funds to expand her business. She hopes to buy land and build a house. She also hopes to educate her child up to the university level. 

She used the previous  loan to increase her inventory of food stuffs so she can meet her customers' demands. She is so far happy with the progress of her sales volume and now wants a loan to buy more food stuffs like sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs like sweet potatoes to resale..

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tinh, born in 1971, an ethnic Thai woman, has been in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2009. She is living with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding. Her family has almost two hectares of cultivated lands but because the family is crowded with many people, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to buy a bull to help her family with more plowing power but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She expects that the loan amount will help her family have a strong bull to reduce human power in plowing but still get good results in cultivation.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en:
Nayfeh is 50 years old; she lives in small village near Nablus City west bank with her small family. She has a grocery store in the village, but it can’t cover all her family expenses. Four years ago she started trading in rabbits. It’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

She applied for this USD loan to buy different kinds of rabbits per customer requests, cages and food for them, which will increase his income, helping her to improve the financial conditions for her family.

Nayfeh is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of rabbits, feed and cages

loans.name: David De Jesus

texts.es: David de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azucar desde hace 15 años comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
David, 32, lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living growing sugar cane, which he has done for fifteen years, selling his product in the neighboring towns. He has many clients, and with the income from the sales he is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, plague control products, and more, in order to continue with his work and get better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plague control products, and more.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en: Neria is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 53 years old, married with three children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Alma is engaged in cassava growing and farming to augment their family income, knowing that she has increasing needs, especially with her children entering college.

In need of additional capital to purchase cassava seedlings and bags of fertilizers, Alma is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase cassava seedlings and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa has been in the business of operating a jeepney for 10 years. She is now 52 and she has experienced a lot of ups and downs, that made her strong enough in facing life trials. She is thankful to God that Kiva and CCT have been parts of this year-long journey.

Recently, she was given a chance to have a loan that she used for the maintenance of her jeepney. Today, she comes to you again with the same reason. This time, she asks for PHP 35,000 for buying new tires and tools for her jeepney's maintenance. She hopes that you'll help her again with her request.

Jesusa hopes to have a successful future far beyond their life today. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, spare parts, and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ethel is 43 years old and has five children who are in school.

Ethel has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Ethel requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Ethel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ethel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 year old hardworking woman with one child aged 12 years and attends school in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a bar as her main business alongside a restaurant that helps her earn an extra income. She has been operating these two businesses for over 8 years and she works throughout the week given the nature of her business.
 
Though she has responsibilities of educating her child and providing for her family, she also wants to at least build a good house both commercial and residential so as to serve her multipurpose intentions but she faces problems of inadequate capital and seasonal customers.

Mary requests for a loan to buy more crates of beer, soda and food to restock for sell in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda and food to restock for sell in her businesses.

loans.name: Sokyang's Group

texts.en:
Sokyang is a mother with two dependent children, one of whom is in school. They are living in Kampong Cham province. The growing rice and cassava are the main sources of income for her to support their living conditions for 20 years. This year, her rice and cassava was destroyed by insects, so that she could not get good yield as before.

For Sokyang, this is her third micro loan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans. With the previous loan, she improved her living condition. She leads a group of six who are applying for this new loan. As the leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support on her farming business in order to get a better yield than last year. She hopes that she can get higher yields and get more income to expand her farmland and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farming business in order to get good yields to improve her lifestyle.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 37, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She runs a small business at home with the help of her daughter. Her practice to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones over shawls and been selling into the market with the help of her husband. She has been purchasing raw material through her savings. Her savings are spent upon household goods and does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw material to continue her business.

Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will utilize the amount for purchasing sequins, gums, pearls and shawls to enhance her business.
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sequins, gums, pearls and shawls to enhance her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una mujer de 42 años de edad es casada, trabaja en una escuela primaria como secretaria. Sufre de cataratas en su ojo izquierdo por lo que ha perdido visibilidad, ella necesita urgentemente un implante de lente intraocular.
Su padecimiento ha llegado a perjudicar sus actividades cotidianas, en varias ocasiones ha recibido llamadas de atención en su trabajo, por lo que teme quedarse sin él y esto perjudicaría a su familia ya que con sus ingresos apoya la economía familiar.
texts.en:
She is 42 years old and married. She works as a secretary at an elementary school. She suffers from cataracts in her left eye, and she has lost vision. She urgently needs an intraocular lens implant.

Her condition has come to affect her daily activities. Several times she has received warnings at her work. Therefore, she fears losing her job. This would harm her family because she supports it with her earnings.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Hoang Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Van, born in 1971, is the Thai ethnic woman, joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in 2011. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding. So, the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to raise pigs but she does not have enough money to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and the next pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in pig breeding.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
Putri Sari group is a pig breeder and a farming group. They work on two businesses to increasing their income. Last loan period, they used it for farming. But, unfortunately the dry season was too long and their crops did not produce a maximal result. The rice field become dry and the cacaos produce small fruits. But, they can paid off the loan because the pigs had a high price. Although they had unsatisfied profit, the Putri Sari keeps their spirit to continue both of the businesses. They have taken a new loan.

Ni Made, as the head, always motivated her friends to work hard although with the last loan they suffered loss. With her loan, she purchased fertilizer, paddy seed and land maintenance cost. Now it is starting to rain. She hopes the weather will support her plan. Ni Made and all the member of Putri Sari group said they are greatful to lenders, Kiva and MUK for the loan. They promise will use it wisely to support the welfare of their families.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, paddy seed and land maintenance cost

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita a responsible mother requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda never gets tired of attending her business. Her sari-sari store (convenience store) is known in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, for she owns the only store in their place. She's making good sales in her business that sufficiently support the needs of her family.

She is in need of additional capital to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confections, condiments, and other goods. She is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where Daylinda is an active member.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with consumable goods such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, milk, confections, condiments, and other goods.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a businesswoman from Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 51 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Beverly is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default.

Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Beverly continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia works hard to support her family. Eufracia is widowed and has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines.

Eufracia requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell.

Eufracia has been in this business for 46 years now.

In the future, Eufracia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nelia is 52 years old and has one child still in school.

Nelia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Nelia has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 42 years old and married with three children.

She is in agriculture, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Perla has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason a  married man with children operates a retail shop and supplements it with farming in the area of Kasese-Uganda. These two businesses help him to generate income for the family. Nason desires to improve his business but lacks the required capital to run his business to the required standard. Nason is looking forward to have a fully stocked business from where he can get profits to meet his dream. He is requesting for a loan to buy items like more sugar, salt and sauce pans for selling.

loans.use: to buy items like more sugar, salt and sauce pans for selling.

loans.name: Mwajumaa

texts.en:
Mwajumaa is a married woman with four children. None of her children attend school. Mwajumaa works selling charcoal from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwajumaa owns a house without running water or electricity and her greatest monthly expense is food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwajumaa is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асел, 29 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Асел - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она работает медсестрой в психоневрологическом социальном стационарном учреждении. Также занимается полеводством, выращивая органические картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет на 1,30 ГА собственной земли, в хозяйстве также есть фруктовый сад. Асел решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сараев, часть средств будет направлена на полеводство. Доходы от кредита Асел планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса за счет покупки дойных коров.
texts.en:
Asel is 29 and married with two children. She has a specialist high school education and works as a nurse in a psychoneurological hospital as the primary source of income for her family. She also works in agriculture, growing organic potatoes, grains and hay on 1.3 hectares of her own land, and has an orchard. 

Asel decided to approach Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase building materials to build barns and to put toward her agriculture business. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business by buying dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build barns for her livestock, and to cultivate her land in order to grow organic produce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mary operates a poultry business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreaks that cause losses as a challenge in her business. Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is a farmer with many years of experience behind him. He lives in Arevshat village of Shirak region with his wife and their 20-year old son. Manvels whole family is occupied in the farming business. They keep cattle (two cows, four calves) and hens and also cultivate wheat, potato, carrot and beet.

Manvel and his son take the gathered harvest to the nearby open market and sell it there. The most challenging part for them is to manage covering transportation and operational costs in the farm. The requested loan will help Manvel and his hardworking family to purchase wheat seeds and forage for feeding the cattle in the winter season. The loan is important for Manvel's farm to be prepared for the severe cold season, and Manvel hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and forage for feeding the cattle in the winter season, so Manvel's farm will continue bringing income for his family

loans.name: Chhaylim's Group

texts.en:
Chhaylim, a resident living in Kampong Cham province, is 34 years and a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She earns income to improve her family condition via cassava planting and grocery items selling in order to earn extra income. She has been with her businesses for ten years and last year her cassava did not grow well because it has destroyed by insects.

Chhaylim leads a group of five to get her second loan with VisionFund and for her previous loan she fully paid back on time. She can get more income to support on her family with a decent household appliance with her previous loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy organic pesticide to support on her cassava farm and another part of her loan she will use it to purchase more grocery items for resale. She wishes that she can get more income to upgrade her living condition and to support on her children’s studying on time.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for resale in order to get additional income so that she can upgrade her family's living.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 46 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children; three of them sit idle at home.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his household. One of her sons serves as a waiter. This restaurant has been supporting the whole family for many years. Nowadays, her husband wants to offer more menu items to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Shazia is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will help to generate more profit and savings as well.

Shazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her husband's restaurant so he can increase the menu.

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
Mayarani is a 46-year-old woman who lives at Raychenga village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She is blessed with four daughters; all of them got married. Her husband is a carpenter by profession; he makes furniture such as beds, chairs, shelves, tables and wardrobes, etc., and sells his products as per customer order. This is their sole source of income to earn their livelihood.

In order to construct more furniture, her husband requires materials such as logs of wood, nails, a hammer, a saw, paint and various necessary materials.

He has been engaged with this business for 10 years and has attained a good number of customers. To fulfill customers’ orders in time, he had to increase his volume of manufacturing products.

With the intention of expanding her family business, Mayarani seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy necessary carpentry tools and good quality logs of wood in bulk.

Mayarani hopes that the loan will allow her husband to cater to the customers' orders on time, which will generate better income to offer them a better quality of life and new opportunities to get ahead.

Mayarani is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for her husband's small-scale carpentry business.

loans.name: Moises Angel

texts.es: Don Moises de 54 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el posee un taller de calzado el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 25 años, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su elaboración ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Moises is 54 years old and lives on his own in his own home. He has a shoe workshop which has been in his home for 25 years. He has many customers because of the quality of his products. With what he earns from his work he manages to get ahead in life. He is asking for a loan to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc. to continue making shoes, which is his only source of work, and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a 52-year-old married woman with five grown children. She engages in vegetable gardening and grows sili (chili pepper). She has been farming for a long period of time. She resides in the rural town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

Natalia caters to the locals in her community. She would like to improve the yield of her farm to augment her earnings.

Natalia decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 6,000 PHP loan, she wants to buy fertilizers. Over time, she hopes the loan will enable her to manage her finances, settle her obligations, and start to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en:
Myrlinda is 38 years old. She is known in the Tudela area for her sari-sari (variety) store. Myrlinda actively participates in the various programs and services that the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) offers. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record

Myrlinda is requesting a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house. It matters to Myrlinda that she has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all of the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Tudela and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.

Elena knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Elena hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting, and earning income as well. Anastacia has supported her husband in doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Anastacia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds and will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Anastacia hopes to purchase another plot of rice land to cultivate, which will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she can have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can receive financial assistance for her chosen business.

Thelma has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Thelma wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is a Kiva borrower who describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a restaurant and his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. 

Benedict is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house and gutters to enable him harvest rain water.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and gutters to harvest rain water

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose has received and faithfully repaid numerous loans in the past that have really helped to sustain and grow his store. He is grateful for the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. This support has encouraged him to be more conscientious in expanding his business so that he will be able to save up money for him and his wife as they are in their senior years already.

Once again he trusts that you could lend him funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to restock his store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, bread, eggs, coffee, oil, toiletries, and other items to sell at retail prices. His store means a lot to him because it has been his source of income for the past eight years and has covered his family's basic needs. He is hoping that you will consider his request.

Jose aims to own a mini-mart someday and be able to improve their house for their old age. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
