Jose is grateful to CCT, KIVA, and their supporters for their tireless moral and financial support of his livelihood.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 59 years old and widowed with five children. For the past 10 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal. Ancheta works hard to provide for her family.

Ancheta is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, and other merchandise. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF and successfully repaid her previous loan. Ancheta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, and other items

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her rice retailing business.

Flordeliza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Osiris Esther

texts.es: Osiris es habitante de un barrio popular en Barranquilla donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, ella fue inspirada por su madre quien se vinculó a las ventas por catálogos y al palpar los beneficios que estaba adquiriendo con esta actividad se motivó a realizar la misma labor y su cónyuge le otorgo el capital inicial para que pudiese cubrir su primer pedido. En la actualidad lleva seis años comercializando una variada gama de productos con resultados sorprendentes y ha podido ayudar con las ganancias que recibe en los gastos del hogar.  Osiris está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar sus surtido con nuevas referencias de productos que le permitan incrementar sus ventas y aprovechar este trimestre del año en el que sus clientes compran con más frecuencia accesorios, fragancias y ropa interior para lucir mejor presentados en las festividades que se aproximas o para dar presentes. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Osiris lives with her husband and children in a popular neighborhood in Barranquilla. She was inspired by her mother, who got involved in catalog sales. Upon realizing the profits that she was getting with this business activity, she became motivated to do the same work. Her husband gave her the initial capital so that she could cover her first order. She has now been selling a varied range of products for six years. The results have been surprising, and with the earnings she gets she has been able to help with the household expenses.

Isiris is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, The loan is to improve her stock with new product references that will allow her to increase her sales and take advantage of this third quarter of the year. This is when her customers buy accessories, fragrances, and underwear more frequently in order to look better at the festivities that are coming or to give as gifts.

Her goal is to expand her business and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to more frequently buy accessories, fragrances, and underwear.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, she has run a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Milagros is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and has seven children. Myrna is married, and six of her children are still in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business of raising chickens in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Myrna has been raising chickens for 17 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband and her daughter. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her salary as a civil servant, so the income after deducting all costs and payments is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to buy learning tools and pay for her child’s education fees, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her daughter have better conditions for learning. In addition, for herself, Thanh will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and pay for her child’s education fees.

loans.name: Heldita

texts.en: Heldita started a small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and reinvest her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales as her store is the only one in their barangay (district). Recently she approached Paglaum for a loan of much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to establish a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and independence. She has a business producing school uniforms and making repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. Evelyn will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. She hopes the loan will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater to the needs of her tailoring clients.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 50 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines.

Madeline is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens. She has been raising chickens for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Madeline is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 30 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Merlita is in agriculture, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Merlita has been raising cattle for four years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Grey Vanesa

texts.es: Grey es una joven de 20 años que reside en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de soledad y que con su espíritu emprendedor y el apoyo de su madre quien toda su vida ha trabajado en el comercio, organizó un punto de venta de artículos misceláneos en la terraza de su vivienda entre ellos accesorios, prendas de vestir, calzado, gorras y productos para el aseo en el hogar.  Esta emprendedora atiende su negocio a partir de las 8 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 8 p.m., y sus principales clientes son sus amigos, vecinos y transeúntes de la localidad a quienes les ofrece excelentes precios y calidad.  Con la finalidad de aprovechar la demanda que genera el último trimestre del año, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar nuevo surtido de ropa de dama y mejorar sus inventarios, de este modo sus ventas se incrementarán y su negocio estará más cotizado.  Su meta a largo plazo es contar con un negocio más grande,  que tenga un mejor surtido y que le proporcione mayores ingresos, de este modo su nivel de vida será mejor.
texts.en: Grey is a young 20 year old who lives in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Soledad. With her entrepreneurship and the support of her mother who has always worked in business, she organised her shop of miscellaneous items and toiletries. This entrepreneur looks after her business from 8 am to 8 pm. Her main customers are her friends, neighbours and passers-by in the area. She offers them excellent prices and quality. In order to make the most of the demand that the last three months of the year brings, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first fund with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy new stock of women's clothes and to improve her inventory. In this way her sales will increase and her business will earn more money. Her long-term aim is to have a bigger business that has better stock and that brings more income. In this way, her living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy new stock of women's clothes and improve her inventory.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a loving mother of five children. With her desire to uplift their living, she engages herself in a livestock business. Angelita realizes that she only has profits when she sells her hogs, and it takes almost four months to care for a hog before she can sell it. Because of this, she came to the decision to run another business and is also engaged in a retailing business. She is now three years running the business and hopes to grow it. Angelita wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more groceries to sell. She will use her earnings to grow the business and invest in her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad, y con un tiempo de 40 años de residir en vivienda propia, vive con su compañero de vida quien la apoya y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María es una persona que busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello se dedica a la venta de ropa. Actividad que realiza desde hace 11 años en su vivienda, y por lo cual para este tiempo ya cuenta con un número de clientes bastante grande, en ocasiones sale a visitar a las comunidades vecinas para aumentar sus ventas. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así mejorar su condición de vida. Es por ello que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, faldas, y todo tipo y estilos de ropa para su negocio. De esta manera aumentar sus ventas para aumentar las ganancias, ya que ese es su medio para mantener la economía del hogar.
texts.en: María is 54 years old and has lived in her home for 40 years. She lives with her husband who supports her and helps with the household expenses. She is someone who looks for a way to improve her quality of live and so she earns a living selling clothes. She has been doing this for 11 years in her home. She therefore has quite a lot of customers. Sometimes she goes out to neighbouring communities to increase her sales. She does everything possible to be able to meet the needs of her family and thus improve her living conditions. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy tops, blouses, trousers, socks, skirts and all types and styles of clothes for her business. In this way she will increase her sales and her income as this is her way of sustaining her family economy.

loans.use: to buy tops, blouses, trousers, socks, skirts and all types and styles of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Deysi Adelina

texts.es: Deysi de 43 años de edad, tiene diez años de residir en vivienda propia, en la cual vive al lado de sus hijos de 10 y 14 años, una hija de 17 años de edad y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Deysi es una persona responsable y trabajadora, que administra una tienda y tiene 5 años de haberla instalado en su vivienda la cual con esfuerzo y dedicación poco a poco ha logrado expandir y mejorar. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así vivir de una mejor manera. Es por ello que Deysi solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, azúcar, granos básicos, salsas, especias, y todo tipo de mercadería para su negocio y así obtener ganancias, ya que ese es su medio para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Deysi is 43 years old. She has 10 years of  living in her own house, where she lives with her  children ages 10, 14, and 17 years old, and her life partner who helps with the household economy. Deysi is a responsible and hard working person, who manages her store after 5 years of having established it at her house, and being able to expand it and improve it with lots of effort and dedication. She does everything possible to satisfy the basic needs of her family and live a better life.  That is why Deysi is asking for a loan to FUSAI to invest in oil, sugar, basic grains, sauces, spices, and all type of merchandise for her business and obtain earnings, because this is the main source of income to provide education to her children.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, basic grains, sauces, spices and all type of merchandise to sell in her business.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 65 years old and lives in Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a widow with three children.

Felicisima has a fish-vending business and owns a fishing-boat business. She earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish-selling business.

Felicisima has been a member of PMPC for nine years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Aime

texts.en: Aime signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to start a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the assistance that was extended to a small-time borrower like herself. Aime has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as honest.

George operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

George will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with three children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, coffee, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Zenaida dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Evelyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish balls, hotdogs, cooking oil, etc. for her food-vending business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 19 years. Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish balls, hotdogs, cooking oil, etc. for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Nyabwana

texts.en:
Nyabwana is a married mother of six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen, is 32 years old and an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband, her daughter and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2007.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding pigs. The annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family with a small amount of savings.

Duyen wants to build a facility for breeding and raising pigs to earn additional income for the family, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

Duyen hopes that the loan will help her to have a good facility for the breeding of her pigs. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to build a breeding facility for raising pigs.

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah is a 35-year-old married mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband earns a very low income which is insufficient to cherish his whole family.

Farah owns a small business selling ladies' ready-made garments from home. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it, and sells it for higher prices in her community. The ladies in town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather has started and people are demanding warmer clothes. Her husband meets all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

Farah has requested a loan so that she can buy more varieties of delightfully colored cloth to sew and sell to locals. Farah wishes for a bright future for her children. Her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy delightfully colored cloth to sew and sell to locals.

loans.name: Thọ

texts.en:
Mr Thọ is 34 years old and he is married. He has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years. Thọ lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what he really needs to comfort his life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom.

This is Thọ's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.
In the future, Thọ hopes for his business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Lelith

texts.en: Lelith is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 40, a widow in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Lelith is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en: Novembrita landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she obtained another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Novembrita perseveres and always strives to reach her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 48 years old and married with four children of school age from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. During her childhood, she experienced extreme poverty to the extent that she had nothing to eat for an entire day. She said to herself that when she had a family of her own, she would not allow her children to experience the same. Having a meager amount in her pocket, she ventured into selling balut to the town. After having good sales and being able to keep money, she signed up for membership with PMPC to access financial assistance. Arlene believes that she will gain more if she produces her own balut to be sold. Now that she has more customers, she employs her friends as balut vendors. Expanding her business requires additional capital and that's what she asks from the cooperative. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase more eggs for the balut-making business. Arlene still strives hard to exploit the fortune she has now and continuously hopes to increase her income so that she can build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for a balut-making business.

loans.name: Delfín Group

texts.es:
Hay una comunidad en Oaxaca que se considera como zona cañera, allí el canto de los gallos alerta a los habitantes que ya amaneció y el silbato del “carro de caña” avisa a los trabajadores que ya es hora de ir al campo. En dicho poblado se formó un grupo llamado Delfín el cual hace alusión a la inteligencia que se ha demostrado tienen estos animalitos.
   Los miembros son: Rodrigo quien se dedica a vender hotdogs y hamburguesas; Bertha, carne de cerdo; Laura, recipientes plásticos y servicio de flete; Ana M., abarrotes; Ana L. tortillas; Agustín, helados y reparación de electrodomésticos y calzado; Claudia, recipientes. Por su parte Elodia, Paula y Loida criarán cerdos y Julio brindará servicio de taxi.
   Don Rodrigo es uno de los integrantes del grupo, y se define como un hombre responsable y amigable. Actualmente es padre de 2 niños y una niña por quienes día a día entrega lo mejor de sí para obtener ingresos necesarios. 
   Después de cumplir el llamado sueño americano regresó al lado de su familia, y desde hace 6 años se ha dedicado a la venta de hotdogs y hamburguesas desde el patio delantero de su casa. Ha formado un equipo de trabajo muy especial con su familia donde sus hijos se encargan de tomar  los pedidos, su esposa le ayuda a cocinar la carne y él se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Los fines de semana el carrito de hot dog es instalado a un costado del parque de la comunidad lo que ha favorecido las ventas y por ende las ganancias. “El éxito de mi actividad lo atribuyo al sazón, trato al cliente y precios competitivos”  expresa contento mientras arregla su coche.
   Además de dicha actividad, se dedica a trabajar en el campo pues es productor de caña de azúcar, las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido remodelar su casa, solventar los estudios de sus hijos y apoyar a su esposa con el estudio de una maestría.
   El préstamo que solicita le ayudaría a comprar pan, carne, salchichas, brochas y pintura para dar  mantenimiento a su carrito; “gracias por confiar en nosotros, por apoyarnos para hacer crecer nuestras actividades” expresa junto con sus compañeros de grupo.  
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Bertha en la foto se pueden apreciar los tamales de elote que ella prepara, don Rodrigo es el único hombre en la foto.
texts.en:
There is a community in Oaxaca that is considered to be a sugar cane area. This is where the roosters' song alerts the inhabitants that it is daybreak, and the whistle of the "carro de caña" [sugarcane car] tells the workers that it is time to go to the fields. A group called Delfín [Dolphin] was created in this community. The name refers to the intelligence that these animals have shown.

The members are: Rodrigo, who sells hot dogs and hamburgers; Bertha, who sells pork; Laura, who sells plastic containers and freight services; Ana M., who sells groceries; Ana L., who sells tortillas; Agustín, who sells ice cream and repairs domestic appliances and shoes; and Claudia, who sells containers. Elodia, Paula, and Lodia will raise pigs; and Julio will provide taxi service.

Rodrigo is one of the members of the group. He is described as a responsible and friendly man. He currently has two sons and a daughter for whom he gives his best, day to day, to get the needed income. After fulfilling the call of the American dream, he returned to his family's side. He has been selling hot dogs and hamburgers from the patio in front of his house for six years. He has formed a very special work team with his family. His children take the orders, his wife helps him cook the meat, and he prepares the food. On the week-ends his hot dog cart is set up on the edge of the community park, which has favored sales and, therefore, his earnings. "I attribute the success of my business activity to the seasoning, customer care, and competitive prices," he says happily while he fixes his car.

In addition to this business activity, he works in the field. He is a sugarcane producer. The earnings have allowed him to remodel his house, pay for his children's education, and support his wife's study for a master's degree.

The loan that he is requesting will help him to buy bread, meat, sausages, and brushes and paint to provide maintenance to his cart.

"Thanks for trusting us, for supporting us, and for making our business activities grow," his group colleagues jointly express.

*The photo was take at Bertha's house. In the photo you can see the corn tamales that she makes. Rodrigo is the only man in the photo.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, brushes, and paint.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en: Liezl is a businesswoman from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 43 years old and married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Liezl is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Liezl continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Aside from being a registered midwife, Jinalyn also manages a small sari-sari (variety) store business in their place at Ulas, Davao City. She is already of age 44 at this time and still raising two children with Fernando, her husband. 

Davao city is far too distant from the capital city, Manila. However, this place is now one of the most emerging cities within the country with increasing economic rate manifested in the lives of its people. It's citizens are gradually paving ways to further improve their existing businesses, including Jinalyn. 

Jinalyn is a very diligent and versatile entrepreneur. With her business-mindedness and eagerness to multiply her present blessings, she makes sure that she runs well her stores and other businesses. But of course, all of these efforts includes enough resources or financial assistance as well. 

With that, she asks for a 50,000-peso loan. With confidence, she knows that she'll be able to grow her store through buying additional supplies of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and other related commodities if you lend her this amount. 

With your small amount of money, you can help change a life of a family in this instance. Thank you in advance for your generous hearts. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying additional supplies of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and other related commodities

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Servando is grateful to Kiva and its supporters for their tireless financial support on his livelihood. The numerous loans he has received in the past has definitely helped render safe and efficient service of his jeepney and sustained his small store.

This time again he needs funds in the amount 30000 PHP loan to pay for and refill his store with essential food items like rice, bread, instant noodles, canned goods and toiletries. Part of the loan he will use for the regular and proper repair and maintenance of his jeepney unit. He continues to be diligent and conscientious with his businesses. He trust once again for your support.

Servando hopes to expand his store and transportation undertaking to give his family a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for some grocery items and pay for repair and maintenance costs of his jeepney unit as well.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 66 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juliana has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Juliana requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Juliana has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six kids, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a grocery/vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.


With the 50,000 KES loan, Amina wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, mangoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, mangoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, who was born in 1960, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son District, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s civil salary, and it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family with some small savings.

Hoa wants to repair the sanitation works of their house, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

Hoa will work hard to earn money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan will help her family improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the sanitation works of her house.

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
Tom is 42 years old and a mother of two young children, they are living in Kampong Cham province. She has been involved with her cassava farm for 20 years, from which she can earn income to support her family’s living. Moreover, she can get extra income via rice cropping on one hectare area. Her cassava did not grow her with good yield; this is her main challenge in her family’s business.

For Tom, this is her second micro loan with VisionFund and she repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loan enabled her to buy decent household supplies for her family members. In a group of three, she is the group leader and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to input her cassava farm in order to get good yield to gain higher yields for her family. She hopes this loan can help her farm to produce good yield, so she can earn more income to improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to input her cassava farm in order to get good yield to gain higher yields so she can earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van Anh, born in 1979, is an Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her son. The family is living in Son La city under, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from the married couple’s salary as civil servants, therefore, the salary after deducting all costs and repayments, is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount.

She wants to invest in her son’s education. Her son is at grade 7th at school but she does not have enough money for her to pay her son’s education fee. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have a good condition for learning, and then he will have a bright future.

loans.use: to invest in her son’s education

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is an active member of Paglaum MPC and a retailer of consumable goods. She is 72 years old with adult children whom she raised and was able to send to school through her business. She managed her business well as well as her membership with the cooperative. Recently, Gloria applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 for business expansion. The loan will be used to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, confections, milk, condiments, and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, sweets, milk, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy town and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of rice. Her business goal is to have a large retail store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income. She is very grateful for her life and her independence.

Bernadeth has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. This will allow her to cater her tailoring services and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.

Nenita has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Nenita dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Higinia

texts.en:
Higinia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from farming coconuts.

Higinia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Emelia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loads. Marites is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store business.

Marites successfully paid back her previous loans and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Cindy Luz

texts.es: Cindy es una valerosa mujer de 24 años que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, ella decidió dejar su empleo para iniciar su propio negocio desde su vivienda al considerar que éste le generaría mayores ingresos y que sería dueña de su propias decisiones y su tiempo.  Identificó oportunidad de invertir en productos que son muy requeridos por los habitantes del sector y que le generarían una buena utilidad, hoy en día cuenta con dos años está muy satisfecha con su actividad que le permite atender las labores en el hogar y tener más tiempo para sí misma. Ella comercializa fórmulas lácteas, golosinas, mecatos, accesorios para el cabello entre otros y desea incorporar a su oferta calzado para comercializar en la temporada decembrina, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar este proyecto. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y en lo personal adquirir su vivienda para tener excelentes condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Cindy is a brave 24 year old woman who lives with her husband in a neighborhood of the Soledad municipality. She decided to leave her job to start her own business from her house when she considered that this business would generate more income and she would be the owner of her own decisions and time. She identified the chance to invest in products that are needed by the inhabitants of her area and that would produce good profits. Nowadays, she has had more than two years of experience and is very satisfied with the activities which allow her to do her household chores and have more time for herself. She sells baby formula, sweets, snacks, hair accessories, among other things. She wants to add footwear merchandise to her offer, in order to sell it during the December season. For this reason, she is applying to a Credikiva, the first loan she gets from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to finance this project. Her goal in the future is to improve the image of her business, and personally, to buy a house in order to have excellent life conditions.

loans.use: to add footwear merchandise to her offer.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 25 year hardworking single mother of one child aged 7 years. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where she runs a retail shop alongside a local restaurant, which businesses she started 2 years ago with the intention of increasing her earnings and taking good care of her child.

In the future, Charity wants to expand her shop so as to realize more profits and educate her child but she faces challenges of inadequate capital and delayed payments from her customers who buy on credit. This limits her stock turnover and the productivity of her business.

Charity seeks financial support in form of a loan to buy more food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell in her restaurant.  .

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik, a teacher with higher education, has been involved in the farming business as well. While working at the local village school, Hasmik devotes her time after school to her farming business. With the help of her husband and their two sons, Hasmik cultivates barley, potato, carrot and garlic, which her husband sells in the nearby market in Shirak region.

Hasmik's farm needs some investment to be prepared for the winter season. She has applied for this loan to purchase barley seeds, fuel for land cultivation works and forage for feeding the cattle, so the farm will be sustainable in winter and family will be able to cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, fuel for land cultivation works and forage for feeding the cattle, so the farm will be sustainable in winter

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 63-year-old widow from Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) that sells consumable products and other household supplies.

Recently, she asked for a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, condiments, confectioneries, and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, condiments, confectioneries, and other items.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman with 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

Caroline will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to become a large-scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, and a door and to pay for workers to repair the roof and change the door of his home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has always dreamed of opening her own dried fish store to support her two children. She used her loan to buy additional inventories of dried fish for reselling. Virginia is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of dried fish for reselling.

loans.name: Saliya

texts.ru: Салия успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Салии на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 коров, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход Салии - около 29,000 сом (KGS). Она решила и дальше развивать свой бизнес и не останавливаться на достигнутом. Поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 134,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Салия хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Saliya successfully repaid her previous loan, having used it as planned. She is grateful for Kiva and all those who helped with the financing. Today Saliya owns seven cows and 25 sheep. Her monthly income is around 29,000 som (KGS). Instead of stopping where she is at she wants to continue to expand her business. To do so she asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a 134,000 som (KGS) loan for the purchase of livestock. Income from use of the loan will be invested in further expanding her herd, which will allow her to improve the family's wellbeing as well as save for household furniture.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Saraswati's Group

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 53-year-old widow standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She lives with her only daughter in Jeypore, a rural interior town in Odisha. Saraswati is a farmer by profession who is engaged in vegetable cultivation. She works very hard in order to earn money for her family. Saraswati has a dream to make her daughter very successful in her life and provide her the best education.

Therefore Saraswati, along with her other group members, is requesting for a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the fees for her daughter's banking course so she can successfully complete the course and so she can see her daughter become a successful banker.

She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her daughter's banking course.

loans.name: Narmada's Group

texts.en:
Narmada is a woman with great ideas and a creative mind, and she is a very ambitious woman. She is the one standing on the left hand side in the photograph. Narmada has a willpower that led her to be a productive woman in her community. She is always looking for activities that can improve the family income.

She bought a sewing machine and trained on it until she became a professional. She started to make clothes and some products and sold them; that helped her to cover some of the household expenses.

She is 40 years old and lives with her big family that consists of her husband and her five children, which mean that she has a big family.

Narmada along with her group member is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more fabrics and yarns to invest in setting up her business and attracting clients, and in this way creating a positive impact on her earnings.

Her dream is to have a big tailoring business that provides a good income and creates jobs for the women who need jobs to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and yarns to invest in setting up her business and attracting clients.

loans.name: Nianga Madiara's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de deux membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 décembre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui sont très solidaires et dynamiques. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce.
NIANGA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 garçons et 2 filles. Elle est âgée de 55 ans et s'active dans le commerce.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 10 draps à 7 000 FCFA l'un. Elle achète aussi 20 plats à 2500 FCFA l'un et revend l'unité à 3 000 FCFA. Elle achète des paquets de verre à 1 000 FCFA le paquet et le revend à 1250 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt elle achète 5 sacs de mil et 3 sacs d'arachide l'unité à 20 000 FCFA et revend le sac à 25 000 FCFA.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte épargner une partie, et l'autre partie servira à entretenir sa famille surtout ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of two people belongs to a banc villageois that was created on December 21, 2012. It consists of women from the same village who are dynamic and share a bond of solidarity. They are mainly active in commerce.

NIANGA, age 55, is the member standing on the right and raising her left hand, and the featured borrower for the group. She is married with five boys and two girls, and she runs a commercial activity.

She will use this loan to buy 10 sheets at 7,000 FCFA each. She will also buy 20 plates at 2,500 FCFA each to sell for 3,000 FCFA apiece, and cartons of glasses at 1,000 FCFA each to sell for 1,250 FCFA apiece. The remainder will be used to purchase 5 sacks of millet and 3 sacks of groundnuts at 20,000 FCFA each to sell for 25,000 FCFA apiece.

She plans to use her profits to bolster her savings and to provide for her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheets, 20 plates, cartons of glasses, millet and groundnuts.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income. She is very grateful for her life and her independence.

Delia has a business producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. This will allow her to cater her tailoring services and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is a responsible mother who is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC. She will use it to buy more fish for resale.

This way, she will be able to sell more fish which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Judgelyn

texts.en:
Judgelyn is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judgelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Judgelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Judgelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Judithan

texts.en:
Judithan is 38 years old and has four children. Judithan is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Judithan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Judithan requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Judithan has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Judithan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Shirinbu

texts.ru: Ширинбу, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас у Ширинбу есть 4 коровы, 25 овец и 4 лошади. На 1,86 Га земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации.  Ширинбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и постройку сараев.
texts.en: Shirinbu is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary vocational education and is a farmer. Currently Shirinbu owns four cows, 25 sheep, and four horses. She also sells the barley she grows on her 1.86 hectares of land. Shirinbu has asked Bai Tushum Bank for a 80,000 som (KGS) loan to purchase two heifers to expand her livestock herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan back into development of the business and barn construction.

loans.use: to buy two heifers in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 56, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she has grown rice for ages and worked for other for a fee to get extra income. Her rice was destroyed by insects and this is her main challenge for her family’s business that she faced in this year.

She leads a group of three members to seeking this first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of group, she will spend her loan portion to purchase more fertilizer to input her rice farm to gain good yield. She hopes that she can upgrade her family living to a better condition in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to input her rice farm to gain good yield so that she can sell it for good profit to support her living condition

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rabikan

texts.ru: Рабикан, 54 года, вдова, мать-героиня 7 детей. Дети самостоятельные, младший сын живет с Рабикан. На протяжении 32 лет занимается животноводством. У Рабикан среднее образование. В хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 10 овец, 4 лошади. Совокупная прибыль Рабикан составляет около 36,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Рабикан развивать ее бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Rabikan is a 54 year old widow and mother of seven children. The children are independent now, with the youngest son living with Rabikan. She has a secondary school education and has practiced animal husbandry for the past 32 years. She owns two cows, ten sheep, and four horses. Her total income is around 36,000 som (KGS). She asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy cows to expand her livestock headcount. Income from the loan will allow Rabikan to expand her business and save for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy several cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Gouri's Group

texts.en:
Gouri is a 29-year-old mother of two children. The lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph is Gouri. She lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in the Koraput district, Odisha, India. Her oldest daughter is studying at a junior school, and her son is studying at home. Her family’s main occupation is sow breeding, goat breeding for meat and mushroom growing.

It is said that selling several animals can bring in tens of rupees every year in profit, but it is just enough to cover food. The rest is not enough to invest more in the breeding business to get more income for the family. That is why Gouri really wants to take a loan to invest for this purpose.

Along with her group member, she has requested this loan of 30,000 INR and she will use her portion to invest more in the breeding business. She will work hard to earn money to repay Peoples Forum and she hopes that the loan will help her family invest in developing better breeding and her family life will be improved. On behalf of her group, Gouri says, "Thank you, Kiva, for this opportunity".

loans.use: to invest in the breeding business.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is a 33-year-old married construction worker with three children in her care. She resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been working as a construction worker for over five years, all of her children attend school. Her husband is a 33-year-old construction worker as well. Together, they can make approximately USD 7 per day.

Sophy is pictured 1st from the right. She is a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. This loan will help her has enough fertilizer for rice cultivation, and she will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family. In the future, she is going to save to buy pigs, renovate her house and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Gilberto Enrique

texts.es: Gilberto de 26 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su madre. Él es un hombre trabajador que brinda sus servicios como empleado en la alcaldía de su comunidad siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que brinda todo lo necesario para su hogar, además recibe el apoyo de madre quien se dedica a vender en el mercado de la comunidad. Gilberto desea realizar mejoras a su vivienda construyendo un cuarto habitación para poder así brindar mayor espacio y comodidad a su madre, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillos, arena, grava, hierro, pago de mano de obra., para llevar a cabo la construcción del cuarto habitación en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 26 years old and lives in his own home with his mother. He is a hard-working man who serves his community as a local government employee, which is his source of financial income used to provide for his home. His mother also helps to support him by selling things in the community market.

Gilberto wants to make improvements to his home in order to provide more space and comfort for his mother, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, bricks, sand, gravel, iron and labour fees in order to build a fourth room for his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, sand, gravel, iron and labour fees in order to build a fourth room for his home.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is managing her food vending business in Aloran. She mastered the business when she and her husband were on the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family.

Recently she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of flour and confectioneries for her food vending business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of flour and confectioneries for her food vending business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 68 years old and an active pensioner member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years.

Recently, she has asked for a loan to pay for her medication and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for her medication and purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs to enable her increase production.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a risk-taker.

Lucy operates a retail business where she sells plastic chairs, water storage containers, basins, and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals.

Lucy will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of chairs, water storage containers, basins, and other items. Her business goal is to own a large store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of chairs, water storage containers, basins, and other items.

loans.name: Maryoris Elvira

texts.es: Maryoris es una emprendedora mujer de 28 años que su pasión por las confecciones la encaminó a capacitarse en este arte, ella tomó un curso en un colegio cerca del barrio donde reside en el sur de Barranquilla, cuya duración fue de seis meses, posteriormente consiguió un empleo para tomar  experiencia y en el que estuvo por cuatro años, tiempo suficiente para que con el apoyo de su cónyuge comprara tres máquinas y desde su vivienda iniciara con su proyecto de negocio.  Contrató dos colaboradores y hasta la fecha cuenta con cinco años confeccionando prendas de vestir con excelentes estándares de calidad a almacenes que comercializan sus creaciones.  Ella está muy feliz con el progreso que su microempresa ha tenido y le apuesta a que su negocio genere cabida a muchos empleos.  En la actualidad necesita que su producción sea mucho más eficiente y ágil, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una mesa, una máquina cortadora, dos máquinas planas e insumos, y de este modo dejara de tercerizar operaciones que antes no podía hacer por no contar con las herramientas necesarias. Su meta es continuar generando empleos y creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maryoris, 28, is an enterprising woman whose passion for making clothes led her to get training in this art.

She took a six-month course at a school located near her neighborhood, in the south of Barranquilla, after which, in order to gain experience, she found employment that she kept for four years. This gave her sufficient time to buy three machines and start a business from her home,  with the support of her husband. 

She hired two assistants, and for five years now she has been making clothing of excellent quality for stores that sell her creations. She is very happy with the progress of her microenterprise, and confident that it will generate many jobs in the future.

She currently needs to make her production much more efficient and flexible, this is why she is applying for her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a table, a fabric cutter, two flatbed machines and supplies. This way, she will no longer have to rely on third parties to do work that she cannot complete now due to lack of tools.

Her goal is to keep generating jobs and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a table, a fabric cutter, two flatbed machines, and suplies.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 26-years old married woman, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband provides services for troubleshooting refrigerator, air conditioner and dispenser. Regarding his business time to time he has to buy refrigeration accessories such as compressor, condenser, relay, overload etc to continue his business. He buys all the accessories to offer his customers on high price. Mostly customers do not have awareness about the rates which is beneficial for generating more profit.

She requested a loan so that her husband can buy all accessories such as compressor, condenser, relay, overload so that he can get maximize turnover.
Naila wishes for a bright future for her family and her dream is to provide better education to her coming children.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration accessories such as compressor, condenser, relay and overload for her husband so he can generate maximum turnover.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. образование у нее средне-специальное, работает в школе учителем математики. В 1987 году начала бизнес по разведению скота. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, лошадь. На 0,70 Га земли она выращивает ячмень. Среднемесячный доход Тамары составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). Тамара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки нетели. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние семьи, развить бизнес и накопить на свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en: Tamara is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary vocational education and is now a math teacher. She began raising livestock in 1987. Today she owns three cows, ten sheep, and a horse, and she also grows barley on 0.70 hectares. Her monthly income is 27,000 som (KGS). Tamara is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to expand her livestock herd by buying heifers. Income from the loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living, develop the business, and save for her older son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy several heifers in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim, 31 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main occupation is animal breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family. She has to buy learning tools and pay for her son’s education fees for the coming school year, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her son to learn well in order to have a bright future. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and pay for her son’s education fees.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

In addition she also operates a grocery selling business and a Khanga (cloth women wrap around themselves) selling business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Taborakhon

texts.ru: Таборакхон силная и трудолюбивая женщина из города Исфара. Ей 58 лет она и имеет одного сына. Таборакхон проживае вместе с сестрой, сыном и невесткой. Таборакхон в течение 18 лет занимается портным делом. Она может шить не только «Курпа» и «курпача», но и национальные платья. Всему этому она научилась благодаря ее маме.Таборакхон хочет купить ткани и хлопок для расширения деятельности. Она полагается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Taborakhon is a strong, hardworking woman from the city of Isfara. She is 58 years old and has a son. Taborakhon lives with her sister, son, and daughter-in-law. She has worked as a seamstress for 18 years and can sew kurpas and kurpachas (quilted mattresses used as blankets and sofa), as well as traditional clothing. She learned all this from her mother. Taborakhon wants to buy enough fabric and cotton to expand her business. She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cotton.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, to earning an income as well. Arlyn has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Arlyn has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase potentially higher-yielding rice seedlings that will have good results since they are healthier, and heavier. Someday, Arlyn hopes to purchase more land to cultivate rice that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase potentially higher-yielding rice seedlings that will have good results since they are healthier, and heavier.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is 55 years old and is a married woman. She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore. She is a retailer of rice; she buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in her locality. She buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel etc. She has been doing this for many years and has many customers who like to buy rice from her in large quantity. In this tenure she has built up positive relationship among her community.

With the increment in new customers and demand she wants to buy rice in large quantity, so that she can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. Therefore, Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan so she can buy a kind of rice to resell in her locality. In this way she will be able to increase her monthly income and savings as well.

Perveen is the mother of four children; she has grown old now and hopes that her children will support her in her old age.

Perveen praises our honorable support and gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a kind of rice from harvesters to resell in her locality.

loans.name: Whimston Augusto

texts.es: Whimston de 50 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y que juntos han venido saliendo adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como empleado de la alcaldía municipal de su comunidad, trabajo con el que genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha brindado todo lo necesario para su hogar, además de recibir el apoyo en algunas necesidades del hogar de parte de la compañera de vida quien es comerciante.   Whimston necesita realizar unas reparaciones en el techo de la cocina de su vivienda porque está dañado y cuando lleve el agua ingresa al interior, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, tornillos, para llevar acabo la reparación del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Whimston is 50 years old. He lives in his own house with his life companion who together have gotten ahead in spite of adversity. He is a hard-working man who earns his living as an employee of the municipality of his community. This work generates the economic income which provide what is needed for his household. He also gets support with some of the household necessities from his life companion who is a businesswoman.

Whimston needs to carry out some repairs to the roof of the kitchen of his house as it is damaged and water enters inside when it rains. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminated sheeting, beams and screws to carry out the repairs to the roof of his house.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting, beams and screws to carry out repairs to the roof of his house.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be humble.

Betty operates a retail business where she sells shoes, and she has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Betty will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have her own business location within five years. Currently the business is in open market. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Marevic

texts.en:
Marevic is 43 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Marevic is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Marevic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Basorat

texts.ru:
Басорат   добродушная и трудолюбивая женщина  55  лет. Она  замужем и счастливая   мать 7  детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Басорат мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Басорат выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома, Басорат никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Басорат вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Басорат выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Басорат получает хороший доход. Муж Басорат также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Басорат с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Басорат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en: Basorat is a kind and hardworking 55-year-old woman. She is married and the happy mother of seven children. She lives in a small rural town. Since childhood Basorat dreamed of becoming a teacher, but she was unable to due to her family's financial obstacles. As soon as she finished secondary school she married and so became a housewife. However, even though she is always home, Basorat is never idle. She and her husband do all they can to provide their children with everything they need. To earn a reliable income for the family Basorat and her husband began their business in animal husbandry. Basorat raises animals and sells their meat and milk. The business earns her a good income. Basorat's husband works in a local workshop, earning additional income for the family. Their joint income is enough for an average lifestyle, but still not enough to cover all their needs. Basorat and her husband would like to buy a few more head of cattle for fattening. To do this she contacted Arvand for a loan. Basra thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 62 years old, married and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is known for her delicious and palatable snacks that she sells in the neighborhood.

Juanita makes good sales from her business, so she decided to renovate her house. She asks for a loan from the Cooperative to buy plywood, sticks, nails for house repairs.

loans.use: to buy plywood, sticks, and nails for house repairs.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Ma. Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Gloria is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business

loans.name: Francisco
