texts.es: Francisco de 48 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposa y sus 3 hijos 8, 10 y 16 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajado que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como empleado en alcaldía municipal, de esa manera genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindando les todas las necesidades básicas necesarias para su desarrollo y llevar lo necesario para su hogar, también recibe el apoyo con algunos servicios básicos de parte de su esposa. Francisco desea realizar reparaciones en su vivienda como levantar unas paredes de división de cuartos, por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, hierro, mano de obra, para llevar a cabo la reparación en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 48 years old. He lives in his own house in the company of his wife and his three children aged 8, 10 and 16 years old. He is a hard-working man who earns his living providing his services as an employee of the municipal government. In this manner he generates the economic income he needs to raise his children providing them with all the basic things they need for their development and bring home what is needed in his household. He also receives the support of his wife with some of the basic services.

Francisco wants to make some repairs to his house such as constructing walls to divide rooms. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, re-bar and pay for labor to carry out the repairs to his house.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, re-bar and pay for labor to carry out repairs on his house.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 46 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, una hija de 12 años y un hijo de 20 años. Ella en busca de satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia administra un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cosmetología y calzado, con el cual ha podido mantener la economía del hogar. Este negocio lo ha manejado por 5 años, lo que le permite que para este tiempo ya posea un número de clientes bastante grande y lo que le permite que este negocio le sea bastante rentable. Teresa desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello quiere aumentar las ventas de sus productos para poder aumentar las ganancias y para ello es necesario hacer una inversión, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, lociones, maquillaje, sandalias, etc. de esta manera aumentar la mercadería y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old. She lives together with her life companion and a 12 year old daughter and 20 year old son. Looking to satisfy the basic needs of her family she runs a small business selling clothing, cosmetics and footwear to be able to maintain the household finances. She has run this business for five years which has allowed her with time to have a fairly large number of clients which makes the business quite profitable.

Teresa wants to be able to improve her quality of living and to do this she needs to increase the sales of her products so as to increase her profits. To do this she needs to make an investment but she does not have the needed financial liquidity. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, lotions, make-up, sandals, etc and in this way increase her merchandise and her profits.

loans.use: to invest in blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, lotions, make-up, sandals, etc and in this way increase her profits.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en: Pacencia is 68 years old and married, from Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through hog raising. She's making good sales from it and supplies pork in their local market. Recently, she has asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy additional piglets.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap, and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Susmita's Group

texts.en:
Susmita is a very hardworking single mother who is 36 years of age. She is a smallholder farmer from Jeypore, a remote village in the fertile area of Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

This charming mother of four has been engaged in mixed farming for the past five years. Her main source of income has been goat and cow farming, milk, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her farm is an activity she finds very enjoyable.

Susmita has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand for bananas is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to buy seeds for banana farming. She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR. Susmita will use her portion of the loan amount to buy seeds for banana farming.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Susmita will achieve their dreams and goals. Susmita believes that the key to increased banana production is taking proper care of her farm.

The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds for banana farming.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Pagadian City and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Marcela knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past ten years, selling goat meat at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. In addition, she also operates a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jesica Liseth

texts.es: Jesica de 26 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 10 años y sus hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad. Jesica para satisfacer sus necesidades ha instalado una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, además tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos desechables, negocio que administra en su vivienda y en diferentes lugares. Así también su compañero de vida ayuda con la economía del lugar. Jesica en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en productos desechables como: platos, tenedores, cucharas, vasos, papel aluminio para aumentar los productos y de esta forma aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Jesica is 26 years old and lives with her partner, her ten-year-old daughter, and her two sons, seven and four years old respectively.

In order to cover household costs, Jesica has opened a small grocery shop in her home. She also has a business selling disposable products, which she manages from her home while selling the products in other places.

Jesica's partner also helps to cover household costs.

In a bid to improve her quality of life, Jesica is applying for a loan to buy disposable plates, knives and forks, cups, tin foil, and other disposable products to increase sales at her business.

loans.use: to buy disposable plates, knives and forks, cups, tin foil, and other disposable products to increase sales at her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as a risk taker.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water pump for pumping water to her home for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for pumping water

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be determined.

Alice operates a retail business where she sells bread, flour, cooking fat, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Alice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bread, cooking fat, flour, soda and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, cooking fat, flour, soda and other items

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is 32 years old and married with four children.

Debra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Debra has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Debra aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Percelinda

texts.en:
Percelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and earns additional income from selling souvenir items.

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Percelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Dhabali's Group

texts.en:
Dhabali is a 45-year-old woman who is very hardworking and patient. She has been engaged in paddy cultivation for the last six years. She taught her three children the best values, and now they have professional careers. She hails from an interior rural village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

Unfortunately, she does not have a toilet at her home or in her immediate vicinity, because of which she is facing lots of health issues due to lack of hygiene.

Therefore, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will invest her portion of the loan amount in installing a toilet and a shower.

She is dedicated to improving the health of her family, and that is why she is making these changes, which will also help to stop ground contamination.

loans.use: to install a toilet and a shower.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré le 31 décembre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui sont très dynamiques et solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
ASTOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 49 ans, elle est l'emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et une fille.Elle s'active dans le commerce. 
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 11 pagnes et 20 kilogrammes d'arachide pour les transformer en huile d'arachide et revendre les tourteaux après. .Elle achète les pagnes l'unité à 1 000 FCFA et revend ça à 1200 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 20 kilogrammes d'arachide le kilo à 650 FCFA pour les transformer en huile d'arachide et revend le litre à 850 FCFA. Après extraction de l'huile, elle revend les tourteaux la barre à 400 FCFA. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. 
Les bénéfices vont lui permettre d'augmenter son niveau d’épargne au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi aider ses enfants dans leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
This group of 20 members is part of the banc villageois that was inaugurated on the 31st of December 2012. It is made up of women from the same village who are very dynamic and united. Most of them work in trade and pasture fattening.
Astou, who is standing on the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is 49. She is the star borrower. She is married with three boys and one girl. She works in commerce.
With the loan she requests, she plans to buy 11 pagnes and 20 kg of peanuts to make peanut oil and resell the press cake afterwards. She buys pagne fabrics for 1,000 FCFA each unit and resells them at 1,200 FCFA. She also buys 20 kg of peanuts at 650 FCFA per kilo to transform into peanut oil and resells the litre at 850 FCFA. The remainder of the loan constitutes her working capital.
The profits will enable her to increase her savings level with the banc villageois and also to help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 11 pagnes and 20 kilogrammes of peanuts.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 35 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are attending school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Maly is 41 years old and is married with three dependent children, one of whom is below school age. She struggles for a living growing tobacco. She has been doing this for 23 years. She sells grocery items to earn additional income too. The challenge with the farming business is that if the crop is unhealthy she gets lower outputs from the farm.

This is the first loan cycle for Maly with VisionFund. She leads a group of three members to get a loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer, organic pesticide and fuel to support her farm. She hopes to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so that she can gain income to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Francisca Yaneth

texts.es: Francisca de 36 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hijo de 17 años y su hija de 14 años de edad. Francisca con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja ejerciendo la labor de servicios domésticos en una casa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad en la cual su labor principal es de limpieza, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace ocho años y lo cual le permite obtener ingresos económicos para los gastos del hogar y así también sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes a estas alturas se encuentran estudiando, además de eso, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, labor que realiza en su vivienda y de esta manera obtiene un ingreso extra para la economía del hogar. Francisca habita desde hace 10 años en su humilde vivienda, la cual no cuenta con una buena valla y lo cual genera inseguridad en sus hijos. Es por ello que Francisca solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillo, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir un muro frente a su hogar, de esta forma brindarle una mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 36 years old. She lives with her life partner, her 17-year-old son, and her 14-year-old daughter. Francisca works with great effort and dedication performing the domestic chores at a house that is located close to her community. Her main chore is cleaning; an occupation that she has been performing for eight years, which allows her to obtain an income for her home expenses and to also move her children ahead. Her children are currently in school.

Beyond her cleaning, she also has a small business selling beauty products through a catalog. She does this job from her home, and obtains an extra income for her home finances. Francisca has lived in her humble home for 10 years. Her home does not have a good fence, which generates insecurity for her children. For this reason Francisca is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, bricks, and sand, and to pay for the manual labor to build a wall in front of her home, and in this way provide greater security for her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, and sand, and to pay for the manual labor to build a wall in front of her home.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raúl de 37 años de edad vive solo, y para poder satisfacer sus necesidades se dedica a la venta de pan en su comunidad y en las comunidades vecinas. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace tres años, lo que le permite tener una cantidad de clientes bastante grande. Gracias a esto puede ganar el dinero suficiente para sobrevivir en el día a día. Pero debido a que tiene más clientes, la demanda es mayor y por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pan dulce, pan francés y en una bicicleta para poder continuar con el negocio y desplazarse con un transporte propio. Ya que la bicicleta que se observa en la foto es alquilada y él desea poder contar con una propia.
texts.en: Raúl is 37 years old and he lives by himself. In order to meed his needs, he sells bread in his community and neighboring communities. He's being doing that for the last three years and he has a lot of clients. Thanks to that, he can earn enough money to get by day by day. However, since he has more clients, he also has more demand. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sweet bread and french bread. He is also looking to buy a bicycle to be able to continue his business and to have his own mode of transportation. He currently rents a bicycle (shown in the photo), but he wants to buy his own.

loans.use: invest in sweet bread, french bread and a bicycle to continue his bread sales business and have his own mode of transportation.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio de 50 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador quien tiene 25 años de residir en su vivienda junto a su madre de avanzada edad y un sobrino mayor de edad. Julio presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda, con lo que logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos del hogar y para que a su madre no le falte nada. También en busca de obtener un ingreso extra, ha instalado un negocio en el cual vende ropa y accesorios para T.V. labor que ha realizado durante varios años y gracias a ello ahora cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes que demandan sus artículos. En vista del aumento de sus clientes Julio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, pantalones, blusas, antenas de tv, controles, etc. para aumentar los productos y así aumentar las ventas. De esta forma poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio, 50, is a very responsible and hardworking man who has been living in his house for 25 years with his mother, who is elderly, and a grown nephew.  Julio works for a company that is located near his house, and this is how he earns the money he needs for the household expenses, and to see that his mother has everything she needs.  Also, seeking to earn some extra income, he has started a business where he sells clothing and TV accessories.  He has been doing this work for a number of years, and because of this he now has a significantly large customer base.  Seeing an increase in customers, Julio is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, pants, blouses, TV antennas, TV remotes, and other items to increase his inventory of products and thereby increase his sales.  This way, he can gradually improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil soltero, junto con su familia tienen un pequeño negocio donde fabrican muebles.
Se encuentra en una situación muy difícil ya que  su mama necesita una cirugía debido a unos pequeños tumores benignos que están creciendo en su útero esto le causa mucho dolor y sangrado, la cirugía es de urgencia. El quiere tratar de inmediato a su mama pero no cuenta con ningún tipo de servicio médico ni tampoco con los recursos  para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
This borrower is 22 years old and is single.  He lives with his family; they have a small business where they manufacture furniture.

He is in a difficult situation, because his mother needs surgery due to some small benign tumors that are growing on her uterus.  These are causing her a lot of pain and bleeding, so she needs this surgery urgently.  He wants his mother to get immediate treatment, but she is not covered for medical services, nor does he have the funds to cover the expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's gynecological  treatment

loans.name: Mamnga

texts.en:
Mamnga is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mamnga operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is a 45-year-old married woman who resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Sopheap and her husband have grown rice and raised animals for more than 18 years and earn approximately $2.50 per day.

Sopheap is pictured first from right. She is a group leader and would like to request a loan for her group of five members.

She will use her portion to buy duck feed and to improve her family’s finances by selling those ducks. In the future, she is going to buy more ducks and build a new proper house for living standard.

loans.use: to buy duck feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in feed, vitamins, and more pigs in order to increase sales, and thus increase the profits of her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high costs of competition in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis de 46 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida, sus hijas de 2 y 14 años de edad y su hijo mayor de edad quien se dedica a la pesca. Luis es un hombre trabajador y responsable quien se desempeña como pescador y de esta manera logra llevar el sustento diario para su familia. Esta labor la lleva realizando desde hace 25 años, en el transcurso del tiempo ha obtenido mucha experiencia y es muy reconocido por todos los comerciantes, por lo que ya cuenta con las personas que le solicitan el producto. En este trabajo es imprescindible el contar con herramientas fuertes y de buena calidad, y es por ello que Luis solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en atarrayas y trasmallos para aumentar la pesca al poseer unas redes mejores y más resistentes.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old. He lives with his life partner, his daughters who are 2 and 14 years old and his adult son who is a fisherman. Luis is a very hardworking and responsible man who works as a fisherman in order to earn an income to support his family. He's been a fisherman for the last 25 years. During this time he has acquired a lot of experience and earned a good reputation among the local shopkeepers, therefore, he has a number of people who request his product.

In this line of business it is essential to have strong, good quality tools. That is why Luis is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in casting nets and trammel nets to increase fishing and to have better, more durable nets.

loans.use: invest in casting nets and trammel nets to increase fishing.

loans.name: Damacena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS.
La socia Damacena tiene 64 años de edad es viuda y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de pelados de habas, la socia leva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de habas entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS village bank.

The member, Damacena, is 64 years old, widowed, with 6 children. The member varies her daily activities, working at her business selling shelled fava beans. The member has had the business for quite some time, and is doing well, thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day. The member would like to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family.

The member is requesting the loan to buy fava beans, among other items, for her business.

The member is grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy fava beans, among other items, for her business selling shelled fava beans.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family.

To cherish her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with all of the raw materials for knitting embroidery; she completes her tasks along with her daughters over a wooden frame.

She wants to sell knitted embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy raw material on her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Mumtaz has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can knit more embroidery dresses to sell and could generate maximum income.

She is the mother of two daughters and two sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery and wooden frames for knitting embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Nestór

texts.es: Néstor es un microempresario de 59 años residente en Soledad, un municipio del Atlántico en donde se consolida la gran mayoría de su clientela a la que oferta una variada gama de medicinas naturales, vitaminas y complementos para la nutrición.  Su idea de negoció surgió por el consejo de un amigo, decidió emprender este proyecto y ser empresario independiente, en la actualidad ofrece a sus conocidos, amigos y referidos malteadas, suplementos y bebidas. Como su clientela se ha incrementado el capital de su negocio ya no es suficiente para abastecer los pedidos y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en medicinas al por mayor y garantizar un inventario que respalde sus ventas a un buen costo.  Néstor es un padre de familia que vela por el bienestar de su cónyuge e hijos y desea continuar ampliando su cobertura para generar mayores ingresos en pro de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nestór is a small-business owner, and is 59 years old. He lives in Soledad, a town in Atlántico where most of his customers are concentrated. He offers his customers a variety of natural medicines, vitamins, and nutritional supplements. The idea for his business arose through the advice of a friend. He decided to undertake this project and be an independent businessman. He currently sells shakes, supplements and drinks to his acquaintances, friends, and referred customers.

As his clientele has increased, the money from his business is no longer sufficient to fulfill the requests and he is applying for a Kiva loan. This is his first loan that he is requesting through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy medicines wholesale and guarantee an inventory that supports his sales at a good cost.

Nestór is a father who looks out for the wellbeing of his partner and children. He wants to continue expanding his range to generate a greater income in favor of his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines wholesale.

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru: Бобочон отец троих прекрасных детишек. У него один 5 летный сын и две 4 и 2 летные дочки. Бобочон образованный и активный отец. Он из города Куляб. Ему 32 года. Бобочон молодой бизнесмен. Он на рынке занимается торговлей деятельности. Он продает женские одежды. Бобочону нравится своя работа,  и еще нравится помогать клиентам сделать правильный выбор с покупками.  Бобочон хочет перевозить осеннюю одежду и увеличить товарооборот. Чтобы достичь своих целей он обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bobojon is the father of three beautiful children. He has a five year old son and two daughters of four and two years. Bobojon is an educated and active father. He is from the city of Kulob. He is 32.

Bobojon is a young business man. He has a retail business at the market. He sells women's clothing. Bobojon likes his work and also likes helping his customers make the right choice for their purchases.

Bobojon would like to bring in autumn clothes and increase his turnover. In order to reach his goal he turns to you for a loan. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to bring in autumn clothing and increase his turnover

loans.name: Tazhibu

texts.ru: Тажибу, 60 лет, в разводе, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в 2011 году Тажибу открыла бильярдный клуб. Помещение она арендует, работает клуб без выходных с 9.00 утра до 12.00 ночи. Клиентов много, уже наработаны и постоянные. Дополнительно Тажибу сдает бус в аренду. Ежемесячный доход Тажибу 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Тажибу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки мебели в бильярдный клуб и улучшение зала, часть средств направит на ремонт буса и покупку зимних шин.  Тажибу намерена развить свой бизнес и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Tazhibu is 60 years old, divorced and has a son. She has secondary education. In 2011 she opened a billiard club. She is renting the premises and works without a break from 9 in the morning to 12 in the night. She has already attracted many returning customers. In addition Tazhibu has a bus that she rents out. The monthly income is 14,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Tazhibu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase furniture for the billiard club and improve the hall. She will also use a pat of the money to repair her bus and purchase winter tires. Tazhibu intends to continue developing her business and attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for and improve her billiard club, and to repair her minibus and purchase winter tires for it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a new beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар, 46 лет, не замужем, есть дочь. У Анар- среднее образование, она работает преподавателем в Ошском государственном университете, по совместительству и в Городском водоканале. Таким образом совокупный доход составляет 9,600 сом (KGS). Анар сейчас живет у сестры, она начала строительство дома, залила фундамент, в этом году планирует закончить, однако не хватает средств на на покупку кирпичей, цемента, песка и прочего. Поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS). Доходы Анар планирует вкладывать в дальнейшую постройку дома.
texts.en:
Anar is 46 years old and not married. She has a daughter. Anar has secondary education. She works as a teacher at the State University of Osh, and also at the city's water channel. In this way she earns a combined income of 9,600 som (KGS).

Anar currently lives with her sister. She started building a house, making the foundation. This year she plans to finish it, but she does not have enough money to purchase bricks, cement, sand and other building materials. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS). Anar plans to use the loan to continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand and other building material to finish building her house

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru: Амридин 45 летный житель района Файзабад. Он семейный мужчина. У него один сын и одна дочка. Жена домохозяйка, она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Сам Амридин занимается водителем в Гидроэлектростанции. Он более 6 лет занимается в этой предприятие. Он вместе семьей живет в старом доме. Амридин решил улучшить жилищные условия жизни семьи, и жить уютно как остальные жители района. Он давно хотел улучшить жилищные условия семьи, но с заработной оплаты не смог отремонтировать дом. По этой причине Амридин просит кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Amriddin is a 45 years old resident of the Fayzabad region. He is a family man. He has one son and one daughter. His wife is a housewife. She stays at home and provides a sewing service. Amriddin works as a driver at a hydropower plant. He has had this job for more than six years.

Together with his family, Amriddin lives in an old house. He decided to improve his family's living conditions, so they could live comfortably like other residents of the region. He long wanted to improve their living conditions, but with his salary he was not able to renovate his house. For this reason, Amriddin requests a loan. The loan will help him renovate his house.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín con 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Martín se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 16 años, en el Caserío San Cristobal. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y pagar mano de obra de su cultivo de café. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Martín es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado créditos los cuales los ha cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Martín is 37 years old, he lives with his wife and children in the district of Cañaris, in the province of Ferreñafe, state of Lambayeque, Perú. The inhabitants of this locale for the most part work in farming, commerce and raising cattle.

Martín has been growing coffee for 16 years in the hamlet of San Cristobal. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and pay for labor for his coffee crop. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, increase his profits and ultimately, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Martín is a recurring member in our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. He has handled loans, which he has paid off in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and pay for labor for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Kairynusa

texts.ru: Кайрынуса, 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 11 овец и коз, на 0,56 Га земли она выращивает клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайрынуса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Кайрынуса планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и планирует накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Kairynusa is 62 years old, married and has two children with her husband. She has secondary education. To have an income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Currently she has two cows, 11 sheep and one goat. She grows clover for selling on 0.56 hectares of land.

With an aim to further develop her business, Kairynusa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for breeding. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business. She also plans to save moeny to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Cuna De Belén Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense muy bonita y extensa se localiza un grupo que lleva el nombre de Cuna de Belén. Los habitantes se identifica por contar con grandes tradiciones, la fiesta más grande de la comunidad es el 2 de febrero o día de la Candelaria donde se realizan muchos eventos culturales y religiosos.
   Doña Feliza es una de las integrantes más alegres quien siempre contagia su buen humor a las demás. Está casada desde hace 29  años con el señor Miguel quien trabaja como albañil, y juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos de los cuales dos dependen de dicha pareja. Tiene 29 años de experiencia como criadora de cerdos dentro de su comunidad. "Inicié con este bonito negocio porque mi esposo no encontraba trabajo en ese entonces y todos nuestros hijos necesitaban cubrir sus estudios, además nuestros gastos eran fuertes y de alguna manera yo quería apoyar a mi esposo con este reto" comentó. 
   Sus mayores clientes son sus vecinos ya que generalmente preguntan si los cerdos están en condiciones para comprarlos y si es así se apresuran a hacerlo pues conocen de sobra la calidad que los caracteriza. La única dificultad que se presentaba era que a menudo no conseguía los ingresos necesarios para reinvertir pero gracias a los préstamos esto se resolvió. En esta ocasión solicita el apoyo de VF México para comprar más alimento para que sus animales puedan alcanzar un desarrollo ideal lo que se reflejaría en mejores ganancias. 
   El sueño que Doña Feliza alberga es que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de un mejor futuro y concluyan una carrera profesional. Al igual que ella los demás integrantes tienen muchos sueños por cumplir, así  Don Cirilo podría invertir en una tienda de abarrotes; Josefina y Paulina, en pollo; Rufina, en bordados artesanales; María Clara, en ganado bovino; Celia, en carne de res y finamente Doña Gilberta y Adelaida, en cerdos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la plaza del municipio, Feliza es quien porta un rebozo alrededor del cuello.
texts.en:
The group that calls itself "Cuna de Belén" ["Cradle of Bethlehem"] is located in a large and beautiful Mexican community. The residents identify themselves as having great traditions. The largest festival in the community is Candlemas, held on the second of February, when they have many cultural and religious events.

Feliza is one of the most joyful members of the group, one whose good mood is contagious to everyone around her. She has been married for 29 years to Miguel, who works as a bricklayer. They have six children together, two of whom are still dependent on them. Feliza has been raising pigs in her community for 29 years. "I started this wonderful business because my husband couldn't find work back then and we needed to pay for our children's education, plus we had many expenses. I wanted to find some way to help my husband with those challenges," she said.

Her best customers are her neighbors, who often ask her if her pigs are ready for sale, and if so, they hurry to buy from her since they know very well what good quality she offers. The only difficulty she has had is that she often hasn't had enough money to reinvest, but thanks to the loans she has received, this problem has been resolved. This time, she is requesting the support of VF México to buy more feed so that her animals can reach an ideal stage of development, which will result in higher profits.

Feliza cherishes the dream that her children will have the opportunity for a better future and will achieve professional careers. Like Feliza, the rest of the members of the group have many dreams they want to accomplish: Cirilo will invest in a grocery store; Josefina and Paulina, in poultry; Rufina, in artisan embroidery; María Clara, in cattle; Celia, in beef; and finally, Gilberta and Adelaida, in pigs.

*The photograph was taken in the city's plaza. Feliza is the one who is wearing a shawl around her neck.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and cultivating to harvesting and earning income as well. She has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, she has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that she hopes will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Josephine hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Vilma, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Vilma es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella   se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, perfumes y otros accesorios, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella sale por ratos y también vende en su casa, ella tiene muy buena clientela porque les deja a buen precio y les da facilidades de pago, lleva más de 6  años en su negocio el cual lo comenzó gracia a uno de los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y perfumes. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group Sagrado Corazón meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited all year round and for being a city with beauty unequaled by many tourist attractions.

It is here that Vilma, 65 years old, lives. She is married and has three adult children from this relationship, one of whom still lives at home. Her husband is a driver.

Vilma is a woman who likes to earn for herself in order to obtain her own income to help her husband with the household expenses. She works in retail, selling all types of clothing, perfumes, and accessories. She sells door to door, going out for a while at a time and she also sells from her home. She has a very good clientele because she sells at a good price and sells on credit. She has more than 6 years in her business, which she started thanks to a loan.

She will use this loan to buy all types of clothing and perfumes. She has been with this credit group since it began and likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be committed.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an area with good climate and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a role model to other farmers.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs to enable increased production.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 51 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products from Avon like lipsticks, deodorant, perfume, bags, etc., to sell.

Miraluna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Avon like lipsticks, deodorant, perfume, bags, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Delia is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz María es una polifacética mujer que maneja varios roles en su vida; madre, esposa y empresaria independiente, ella encontró en el comercio de ropa una alternativa de generar ingresos para su familia y aprovechando sus dotes en la cocina elabora comida típica; pasteles y sancochos, actividades que realiza diariamente a partir de las 5 a.m. con la preparación de los alimentos y en el transcurso del día exhibe sus clientes las prendas de vestir.  Ella entabla charlas con sus clientes y promueve sus productos los cuales brinda con facilidades de pago.  Ella es habitante de Soledad un municipio con mucho potencial para los negocios y con la finalidad de capitalizarse está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en ropa y víveres, con los que incrementara su oferta y dinamizara sus ventas. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz María is a multi-talented woman who plays many roles in her life: mother, wife, and independent businesswoman.

Selling clothes has allowed Luz María to earn an income for her family. Additionally, using her skills in the kitchen, she makes typical dishes, cakes and soups. Luz María works in these trades every day. She starts at 5am by preparing her meals. Throughout the day she displays the clothing items to customers. She talks to her customers and promotes her products, which she sells on credit.

Luz María lives in Soledad, a municipality with a lot of potential for businesses.

In order to gain access to capital, Luz María is applying for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy clothes and supplies and thus increase the number of products she sells and increase sales.

Luz María's goal for the future is to improve her business's image and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and supplies.

loans.name: Monserrate Betty

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijas de 26, 23 y 13 años, la menor estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Monserrate es una mujer muy colaboradora que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica al comercio, vende frutas, verduras y legumbres,  el de lunes a sábado  sale a vender por  la localidad en un triciclo que tiene para esto, son más de 10  años que él lleva realizando esta labor la cual les permite salir honradamente adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar, frutas, legumbres y verduras. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños es comprar un carro para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The "Sagrado Corazón" loan group meets every fortnight in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited throughout the year. The city is unbeatably beautiful and has many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 43-year-old Monserrate lives. She is married and has three children, ages 26, 23 and 13 years old. The youngest is in high school and the only one still living at home. Monserrate's husband is a trader.

Monserrate is a great team player. She is taking out this loan for her husband to use at his work selling fruits, vegetables and legumes. He works from Monday to Saturday. He goes out on a tricycle to sell his products in the local area. He has been doing this work for ten years, and it allows the couple to earn an honest living and move forward.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Monserrate has been with the loan group for two loan cycles and likes it because she can move forward with the loans. Monserrate's dream is to buy a car to sell products.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Emily Group

texts.es:
En  el Estado de México se ubica una comunidad muy tranquila, llena de tradiciones, cultura, pero, ante todo, llena de personas muy amables y trabajadoras. La cría de animales y el cultivo de maíz siguen siendo las principales actividades económicas que dominan en a región. Los integrantes del grupo llamado Emily son originarios de esta comunidad y se sienten orgullosos por ser de un pueblo tan festivo y colorido, por ejemplo los días doce de diciembre cuando celebran a la virgen de Guadalupe.
   Desde hace ocho años Lorena inicio con la elaboración de bordados artesanales como servilletas, manteles, orillas, etc. Aprendió desde muy pequeña ya que su madre le enseño todo lo necesario en este arte. “Cuando decidí formar mi propia familia los gastos de mi hogar aumentaban gradualmente por eso mismo decidí poner de mi cuenta” comentó muy contenta Lore, como le dicen de cariño. Su familia está integrada por su esposo Roberto y dos hijos los cuales estudian, uno la educación primaria y el otro, la secundaria. 
   Todo su producto lo elabora desde casa de tal forma que no descuida a sus hijos, una vez terminados  los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos. De vez en cuando le piden encargos especiales lo que le favorece ya que así obtiene mejores ganancias, sobre todo cuando se trata de bodas, bautizos, confirmaciones u otras celebraciones religiosas. 
   Lore, por otro lado, está muy agradecida con los beneficios que VF México le ofrece porque podrá comprar más material para su oficio. Además podrá apoyar a su esposo con su actividad de taxista ya que le daría mantenimiento a su unidad. Uno de sus sueños a largo plazo es que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional para obtener mejores posibilidades laborales.
    Los otros integrantes del grupo son Teresa quien invertirá en cerdos; Martha, en pollos; Graciela, en productos de jarcieria; Zoila, en pan y María Delfina, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en los arcos del centro municipal, Claudia es quien viste el suéter color amarillo.
texts.en:
In Mexico State there is a very tranquil community, packed with tradition and culture, but above all, full of friendly hardworking people. Rearing animals and growing maize remain the dominant economic activities in the region. The members of the group called Emily are from this community. They feel proud to be from such a cheerful and colourful town, especially for example on the 12th of December when people commemorate the Virgin of Guadalupe.

Eight years ago Lorena started to make traditional embroidery including napkins, table clothes, crochet etc. Her mother taught her everything she needed to know about the craft when she was very young. " When I decided to start my own family my household expenses gradually increased and this led me to start up on my own" , remarked a contented "Lore" as she is affectionately known. Her family comprises her husband Roberto and her two sons who are in school, one in primary education and the other in secondary .

She makes all her items at home so that she can take care of her sons. When the items are finished she sells them to her friends, family and neighbours. From time to time receives special orders. She prefers this because she makes more money this way. This is especially true of weddings, baptisms, confirmations and other religious celebrations. Lore, on the other hand, is very grateful for the funds provided to her by VF México because she will be able to buy more material for her business. In addition she will now be able to support her husband's taxi business and will give him money for the upkeep for his vehicle.

One of her long term dreams is that her sons have a professional career and the best employment opportunities. The other members of the group are Teresa who will buy pigs; Martha will buy chickens, Graciela will buy household products, Zoila will buy bread and María Delfina will buy sheep. " The photograph was taken beneath the arches in the town centre, Claudia is the one dressed in the yellow sweater.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like needles, fabric, knitting needles etc

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jinnie

texts.en:
Jinnie is always traveling while selling her various cosmetics and fragrance products that give her an approximate income of PHP 4,500 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing the needs of their family, since their eldest child is already in college.

Jinnie is 38 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, her partner in all her financial needs for her business ventures. Recently, she got a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of patronizers. The amount will be used to purchase additional stocks for her buy & sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her buy & sell business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can access financial assistance for her chosen business. Marissa has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Marissa wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Gradiana

texts.en:
Gradiana is a businesswoman, so she always finds ways to improve her business. Gradiana has a kiosk that she opened in 2011. She started to do business with her own working capital of $250.

She is selling bread, fried bananas, doughnuts, coffee, noodles, and sugar. She will use the $600 loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goods to keep in her store such as cane milk, biscuits, candles, candy, sugar, coffee, and flour.

loans.use: to buy cane milk, biscuits, candles, candy, sugar, coffee, and flour.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, 51 years old, is married and a resident of Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  Because she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In 2008, both Alicia and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Narcisa Jaqueline

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de 10, 8 y 2 años, los mayores estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Narcisa es una mujer que le gusta contribuir con los gastos que demandan el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, decidió hace 8 años emprender un negocio, ella  vende ropa, zapatos de catalogo y productos Belcorp, Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Ella  tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran y que le permiten ganar sus recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes y cremas. Lleva más de 10 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Sacred Heart Credit Group gathers each 15 days in the City of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in all seasons of the year, and for being a city with a beauty without equal, with its many tourist attractions.

Here lives Mrs. Narcisa, who is 33 years old, and married. From this relationship have sprung three children, ages 10, 8, and 2. The older of the children study in school. Narcisa's husband is a chauffeur.

Narcisa is a woman who likes to help cover the costs demanded by a home and her children's studies. She decided eight years ago to start a business. Narcisa sells clothing and shoes from catalogs, including Belcorp, Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for ladies). She sells door to door and, also, from her home. The products are sold on credit and she collects payments every eight or 15 days. Narcisa has many customers who always buy from her, permitting her to gain resources.

This loan is for purchasing clothing, shoes, perfume, and creams. Narcisa has belonged to her Credit Group for over 10 years and she likes it because with these loans, she began her business.

Her dream is that her children may become professionals.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes and creams to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a single man. He describes himself as focused. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy modern barber shop equipment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy modern barber shop equipment

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
She is Ma. Luisa, 42 years old, from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Manuel, her business partner, and they are blessed with children who are still students. Living in a third world country is indeed a challenge and a struggle but the couple strives to give their children a better future. They live a very simple life, happy and content that their family is intact.

Ma. Luisa and her husband worked hard to put up a general store that sells fresh and packaged food and household items. She also makes rugs and pillows for sale. To further improve her sales, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to pay for rice, canned goods, beverages, charcoal, plastic ware, fruits and veggies like bananas, apples, star apples, soursop, mangosteen, eggplant, cabbage, etc. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help. Her earnings will help support her children's schooling.

She prays for an abundance of blessings from her labor and that her children will finish their studies to give them a chance for a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, fruits, veggies, and plastic ware to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es: El Sr Luis tiene 45 años vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos, él estudió hasta salir profesional de Abogado y proviene de una familia trabajadora con buenos valores y buena administración de sus recursos económicos. El no ejerce lo que estudio por factores económicos, inclinándose a la enseñanza de Taekwondo y desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para solventarse y costear sus estudios. Él es entrenador de Taekwondo logrando el  7mo Dan desde hace 15 años y recientemente logró la apertura de su propio Gimnasio que el mismo  poco a poco lo ha estado equipando, actualmente es casado y en todo este tiempo ha luchado para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El Sr. Luis necesita el préstamo para comprar material deportivo como ser tatamis, pads, cabezales para brindar a sus alumnos  más variedad de intensidades de entrenamiento y así poder satisfacer a sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. Él demuestra una buena organización y control de sus ingresos lo que representa un buen manejo de su negocio
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old, lives in his own home, and has two children. He studied to be a Lawyer and comes from a hardworking family with good values and good financial management. He does not practice what he studied for financial reasons, and leaned toward teaching Taekwondo. He began working from a young age in order to support himself and pay for his schooling.

He is a Taekwondo trainer, earning his 7th dan (7th degree black belt) after 15 years. He recently opened his own gym that he has been equipping little by little.

He is currently married and in all this time he has fought to improve his family's quality of life. He needs a loan to buy sporting materials such as tatamis (karate mats), pads, and helmets in order to offer his students a greater variety of training intensities. In this way he can satisfy his customers and increase his profits. He demonstrates good organization and control of his revenue, which represents good management of his business.

loans.use: to buy karate mats, pads, and helmets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials to grow her production and sales, and improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Josebel

texts.en: Josebel is a mother of two small children and has operated a motor transport business with her husband as a driver for the past nine years. Her business involves motor for hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children. She asked for a loan to purchase another motor unit. Owning another one will increase her income and would help her to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase another motor unit

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en: Ilda is a businesswoman and she has a kiosk, so now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Ilda started to open her kiosk in 2014 with her own working capital of $800. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergents, sugar, snacks, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, lighters, eggs, candy, catsup, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.  She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she hopes with this loan she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, snacks, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, lighters, eggs, candy, catsup, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic windows, doors and other items. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy an 8,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy an 8,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and married with six children. With all of her children currently in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, soft drinks, toothpaste, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store
